texts.fr: La cliente Karutsi  est secrétaire du collectif  d’affaire  « Confiance», jeune entrepreneur expérimentée et  mère de 8 enfants qui étudient. Son conjoint est un artiste peintre. La cliente s’est déjà spécialisée dans la vente de plastiques (bassins, gobelet, objets ménagés plastiques, etc.). Elle a choisi être opérateur d’un seul article dans le quel, elle sera plus compétitive. Elle installe ses articles au marché central. Elle commença ses affaires avec  le prêt de l’IMF Hekima, il y a environ 3 ans. Ce nouveau crédit va lui servir d’acheter les plastiques (10 douzaine de bassins, 5 douzaines de gobelets, 4 douzaines de plats, etc.). Ainsi, elle souhaite accroitre son entreprise, scolariser, nourrir ses  enfants. Le capital de rotation insuffisant est un grand défi pour son activité. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour son soutien en microcrédit aux petits entrepreneurs.
texts.en:
Hekima client Karutsi  is the secretary of the business group called « Confiance», a young, experienced and the mother of eight children who are enrolled in school. Her husband is an artist who paints. This client is already specialized in selling plastic items (bowls, mugs, plastic household goods, etc.) 

Karutsi has chosen to sell one single sort of merchandise so that she will be more competitive.  She displays her items in the central market. She began her business with an IMF Hekima loan around three years ago. This new loan will allow her to buy plastic items (10 dozen bowls, 5 dozen mugs, 4 dozen serving dishes, etc.) In this way, she wishes to grow her business, pay school fees for her children, and feed them. Insufficient working capital is a great challenge for her business. She would like to end by expressing a hearty thanks to Hekima for its micro-credit support for small-scale entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to buy plastic items (10 dozen bowls, 5 dozen mugs, 4 dozen serving dishes, etc.)

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Quynh

texts.en: Quynh was born in 1994. She lives in Bac Ninh. She is studying for a Bachelors of Nursing at Thai Nguyen University of Medical (http://www.tnmc.edu.vn/webdhyd/). Her course lasts 36 months, and she will graduate in 2016. Her education fee is subsidized by her parents. Quynh plans to find a part-time job to earn much of the money for her education fees. Quynh’s family has four members. She is the first person in her family to  graduate high school and have a higher education. Her mother is a breeder. Her father leases canvas backgrounds to earn a living. Her mother is with her in the posted photo. Her family’s income is about 5,000,000 VND per month. Quynh has a passion for her major. She wants to complete this university course. She understands that learning helps her have qualifications to get a high-paying job and earn income for her family. She wants to borrow 14,580,000 VND to pay for her education fee. If she can not access this loan, her studying must be interrupted.  She appreciates the help of people all around the world who are raising funds for this kind of program. This has supported the education of a lot of students in Vietnam. She also hopes this program could be expanded more to help more students.

loans.use: to pay her education fees.

loans.name: Reyna Marisela

texts.es:
Reyna es una mujer de 22 años de edad es casada y madre de 2 hijos los cuales están estudiando en la primaria en diferentes grados de educación. Ella tiene un grado de educación primaria completa gracias al apoyo de los padres mismos que le enseñaron a trabajar la tierra a muy temprana edad. Hoy en día lo practica junto a su esposo el cual es agricultor y cultivan café ya que la zona donde ellos habitan por su clima y su tierra es apta para dicha actividad la cual es sustento y medio de ingreso para su familia y para muchas otras de la zona. La tierra que trabajan es propia gracias a una herencia por parte de sus padres la cual está cerca de su casa de habitación.

Su sueño es ampliar su tierra adquiriendo más para poder cultivarlas con otra variedad de café ya que de esa manera ella podrá asegurar los estudios de sus hijos por lo que podrá generar más ingresos. Al mismo tiempo fortalecerá el patrimonio para sus hijos por lo que hoy en día ha solicitado un financiamiento a la cooperativa COMIXMUL para la compra de 3 QQ de fórmula 12-24-12, 6 QQ e formula 18-46-0, 6 QQ de urea, 6 QQ de nutricafe, 6 QQ de formula cafetalera, 2 litros de insecticida y 1 litro de fungicida con lo que protegerá sus cultivos de café asegurando el grano y protegiendo la planta para el final de la cosecha.
texts.en:
Reyna is a 22 year old woman who is married and the mother of 2 children who are studying in primary school in different grades. She was able to complete primary school thanks to help from her parents and they themselves taught her to work the land at an early age.

Today she works with her husband who is a farmer growing coffee close to where they live. The climate and land is good for this activity and is the means to their family livelihood and for many others in the area. The land they work is their own thanks to an inheritance from her parents and is close to their home.

Her dream is to expand her land, acquiring more land in order to grow other varieties of coffee as in this way she will be able to ensure that her children can study and they will be able to generate higher income.

Today, as she strengthens an inheritance for her children, she is asking for funding from communal bank COMIXMUL in order to buy 3 quintals of 12-24-12 formula, 6 quintals of 18-46-0 formula, 6 quintals of urea, 6 quintals of nutricafé, 6 quintals of coffee formula, 2 liters of insecticide, and 1 liter of fungicide so that she can protect her coffee crops ensuring and protecting the crops for the final harvest.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to help her cultivate her fields of coffee

loans.name: Mawuko

texts.en: This is 43-year-old Mawuko. She is married and has one child aged eleven years old, who goes to school. In 2005, Mawuko established her business selling cosmetics (cream, quitters, perfume, wigs, weavon and other beauty products). She began her business because as the second child of five, her parents were poor and could not afford to send all of them to school. She had the chance to attend school up to the secondary level, and therefore she is educated enough to read and write. She is using her educational background to operate her business successfully. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns a very respectable profit every month from this business. She would need a loan of GHS 1,700 to buy cream, quitters, perfume, wigs, weavon and other beauty products and resell to customers. In the future, she plans to improve her business and her family. She is looking forward to the funding as she requires more capital. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy cream, quitters, perfume, wigs, weavon and other beauty products and resell to customers.

loans.name: Mathias

texts.en:
Mathias is 38 years old and lives in the town of Kajjansi in the Kampala west region of Uganda. He is married and has 6 children with 3 of them currently in school. For the past 4 years, Mathias has been working hard to manage his beverages business, which sells sodas and beers. 

To help expand his business, Mathias has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used for business expansion into a wholesale shop and will help Mathias to generate greater profits and to bridge the financial gaps in his business. Mathias hopes that in the future he will be able to provide quality products. 

Mathias is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Mathias who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to expand his business into a wholesale shop

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer Los Olivos De Pro Group

texts.es: Giovanna de 24 años  tiene 02 hijos pequeños. Giovanna y su esposo trabajan  para  el bienestar de sus hijos, hace algunos años se inicio en la venta de  productos de belleza empezó su negocio ofreciendo  productos a sus familiares y amistades, en la actualidad tiene muchas clientas quienes le solicitan diversos productos como perfumes, maquillaje y accesorios de belleza.Por otro lado los fines de semana prepara dulces para vender  en su casa  a acondicionado algunas mesas y bancas  para atender  a sus ocasionales clientes. Giovanna esta agradecida por tener trabajo para ayudar a su familia. El préstamo recibido lo invertirá en la compra de productos de belleza quiere seguir invirtiendo en ese negocio que le deja mejores ganancias. Su mayor sueño en la vida es tener casa propia para poner un negocio estable, en la foto es la 6ta de la izquierda esta sentada viste chompa negra y pantalon celeste.
texts.en: Giovanna is 24 years old and has two small children.  Giovanna and her husband work for the well-being of their children. A few years ago they began selling beauty products and thus began their business offering products to their family and friends.  Currently they have many customers who ask for diverse products such as perfumes, make-up, and beauty accessories.  In addition, on the weekend they make sweets to sell from their home, setting up some tables and benches to wait on their occasional customers.  Giovanna is thankful for having work that helps her family.  The loan that she receives will be invested in purchasing beauty products. She wants to keep investing in this business so that it will provide better income.  Her greatest dream in life is to have her own home in order to create a stable business.  In the picture she is the 6th from the left and is seated wearing a black sweat shirt and light blue pants.

loans.use: To purchase beauty products.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 31-year-old Iraqi client who lives in his parent’s house and takes care of his widow mother.
 
Ali owns a general store and specializes in selling tools and supplies. He has been in this field since 2011 and has gained good experience in what he practices. He now has an employee and has become well-known in his neighborhood. 

Ali is requesting a loan of 2,400 USD. He will use this loan to renovate his shop by installing a display window and increasing his inventory. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so that he may be able to take better care of his mother.

loans.use: to renovate his shop by installing a display window and to increase his inventory

loans.name: Mouhammad

texts.en:
Mouhammad is a youth client from Iraq. He is 24 years old and lives with his family consisting of five members, of whom two are employed and help Mouhammad in providing the family living.

Mouhammad is a grocer and owns a grocery store, where he sells all the basic needs of a house like dairy products, snacks, canned food, juices and detergents. He has been in this field since 2008, and through time, he gained much experience in this field. Mouhammad now has an employee hired and is well-known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation.

Mouhammad is requesting a youth loan of $3,000 USD. The aim of this loan is to buy a big motor generator for his grocery store to keep his products fresh. Mouhammad is aiming to grow more in this field and someday open a bigger grocery store in order to sell more products and increase his profits so that he may be able to provide himself and his family better living standards.

loans.use: to buy a big motor generator for his grocery store to keep his products fresh.

loans.name: Kousar's Group

texts.en:
Kousar is a 38-year-old married woman who has been selling milk for many years with the support of her husband. Kousar sells milk to many of her neighbors. Her business is good enough to give her a decent life. She has five children, and she is very motivated to provide them with a beautiful life. Kousar has improved her business to meet the day-to-day expenses of life. This is her third year with BRAC Pakistan.
 
Kousar is happily running her business, but she needs money to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales. Therefore, she requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan. She expects a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the near future.

She says thank to Kiva and to its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a buffalo for getting milk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fruits, such as passion fruits, mangoes and oranges

loans.name: Duc

texts.en:
Duc was born in 1992. He lives in Bac Ninh Province. He learns electrical and electronic engineering as a major at University of Hai Duong (http://uhd.edu.vn/). His course lasts 36 months, and he will be graduated in 2014. 

His education fee is subsidized by his parents. Duc’s family has two members. His mother had her picture taken with him in the posted photo. He is the first person in his family who graduated high school and has a higher education. 

His family’s income is about 3,000,000 VND (Vietnamese dong) per month. Duc has a passion for his major. He wants to follow it until the end of this university’s course. Because his place has many industrial parks, he understands that learning will help him have opportunities to get a high-paid job to afford to help his parent and consulting for people with more knowledge about electrical and electronic. 

He wants to borrow 10,206,000 VND to pay for his education’s fee. Through this program, he wants to tell people that he appreciates the help of people all around the world who have contributed to this kind of program. This has supported a lot to his individual education and of the Vietnamese’s youth generation in general.

loans.use: to pay for his education fee.

loans.name: Huan

texts.en:
Huan was born in 1994. He lives in Bac Ninh Province. He learns Information Technology as his major at Academy of Military Technical (http://www.mta.edu.vn/). His course lasts 30 months. His education’s fee is subsidized by his parents. Huan plans to find a part-time job to have more money to pay for his education’s fee. 

Huan’s family has five members. He is the first person in his family who has a higher education. His parents grow rice to earn a living. His mother had her picture taken with him in the posted photo. His family’s income is about 5,000,000 VND (Vietnamese dong) per month. Huan chooses his major because it is consistent with his knowledge and his hobby. He has a passion for his major. He wants to follow it until the end of this university’s course. He understands that learning helps him have qualifications to get a high-paid job and bring income for his family. 

He wants to borrow 14,580,000 VND to buy a computer to support his studying. If he couldn’t access this loan, his studying must be interrupted. He appreciates the help of people all around the world who are raising funds for this kind of program. This has been supportive a lot to the education of students in Vietnam. He also hopes this program could be expanded more to help more students.

loans.use: to buy a computer to support his studying.

loans.name: Mwanamwisho

texts.en:
Mwanamwisho is a married woman with three children. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Mwanamwisho operates a food-making business, making staples, such as beans, chapatti (flat bread) for sale to passerbys and neighbors. 

With the Kshs 50,000 loan, she wants to purchase food items, such as wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar and beans. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income and establish a restaurant in the near future

loans.use: to purchase food items, such as wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar and beans

loans.name: Gisela

texts.es:
Gisela es una mujer de 37 años, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa con su esposo y sus dos hijos, ella es muy amable, trabajadora, dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Gisela no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Secretariado que deseaba.
Por iniciativa propia, Gisela trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de abarrotes y bebidas, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y por los buenos precios que ofrece a sus clientes.
Gisela se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada comprará mayor cantidad y variedad de mercadería para su negocio, de esta manera ella atenderá a mas clientes, así pues Gisela seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ver a sus hijos convertidos en buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
Gisela is 37 years old and lives in the city of Pucallpa with her husband and two children. She is very kind and hard-working, and puts all her efforts in getting her family ahead. Unfortunately due to a lack of economic resources and the need to work, Gisela was not able to study to become a secretary as she once wished.

By her own initiative Gisela works in her small business selling everyday goods and drinks. She works for approximately 10 hours every day, and thinks she does well because of her dedication and the good prices she offers to her customers.

Gisela is very grateful to Kiva lenders, since thanks to their help she will buy a higher quantity and a larger variety of merchandise for her business. In this way she will attract more customers, and thus Gisela will keep working and making an effort to achieve her great dream to see her children become good professionals.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Dora's Group

texts.en:
This group is composed of two members who live in the same neighborhood. The group's representative, Dora, is 35 years old and has a secondary school education. With the goal of boosting their business in order to cope with the demands of their customers, this group is requesting financial support from ID-Ghana for the third time. Both are into the sale of eggs, soap, fruit drinks, candles and Milo. 

Dora is married to a loan officer named Addo. The couple have one child, who is not in school but in their care. She lives together with her husband and child. The couple jointly ensure that the household expenses are covered. For this reason, Dora has been selling eggs, soap, fruit drinks, candles and Milo for 7 years. She gets her supplies from a market in Ghana. 

With the goal of increasing her level of business and satisfying her customers, Dora along with the other member are requesting a loan from ID-Ghana.

loans.use: To buy eggs, soap, fruit drinks, candles and Milo and sell them to customers

loans.name: Blanca Isolina

texts.es:
Blanca es una mujer de 59 años de edad, está acompañada desde hace 38 años su pareja es panificador y agricultor tuvieron en común 4 hijos de los cuales ninguno vive con ellos, solo dos nietos de 10 6 años de edad  que están estudiando básica

Ella aprendió a elaborar pan, desde que estaba muy joven tiene 19 años  de dedicarse a la panadería decidió hacer esa actividad; porque no encontró otra forma de ayudar a su familia y colaborar en los gastos de la casa. Con su compañero de vida,  instalaron su propio puesto de panadería, antes se dedicaban a vender pan pero lo compraban hecho. Hoy en día ellos lo producen, va a comprar los insumos a la ciudad, recorre 34 kilómetros, paga transportarse.

 El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar  harinas, azúcar, miel, entre otras. El préstamo mejorara su negocio porque tendrá la oportunidad de satisfacer la demanda del pan, ya que es bastante.
Desea, seguir haciendo pan y abrir  sus propias tiendas de pan en todo el municipio donde vive. Su  sueño es producir pan para exportarlo pues considera que lo elaboran muy rico, para que su familia vivan mejor. Con las ganancias desea, adquirir otro horno, para panificar y que la producción abunde más. Así quiere ampliar su negocio
texts.en:
Blanca is a 59 year old woman, accompanied by her life partner for 38 years, and she is a baker and a farmer.  They have 4 children, none of whom live with them, and they have only 2 grandchildren who are 10 and 6 years old attending primary school.

She learned to bake bread from the time she was very young and 19 years ago she decided to dedicate herself to the bakery because she didn’t have another way of helping her family with the household expenses. She and her life companion opened their own bakery shop. Before they had sold bread that they bought, now they make it themselves, buying the supplies in the city, traveling 34 kilometers, paying for transport.

She is applying for a loan in order to buy flour, sugar, honey, and other items. The loan will improve her business because she will have the opportunity of meeting the demand for bread, which is high.

She wants to continue making bread and to open bread shops in all the nearby neighborhoods. Her dream is to bake bread to export because she considers her bread very tasty and she wants her family to live better. With her profits she wants to buy another stove so she can bake bread and produce more. She wants to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, honey, and more items for her bakery.

loans.name: Bolodombolo Group

texts.fr:
Les six  femmes du groupe Bolodombolo sont mariées majoritairement  dans des familles monogamiques. Elles ont en moyenne 35 ans et 2 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le village de Bamanan-Zambougou dans la région de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le village. Elles font le petit commerce de céréales, du lait et de condiments. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Bah (femme debout à l’extrême droite  dans la photo) compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 1 sac  de riz avec les exploitants à Konodimini en gros. La revente se fait au comptant  et à crédit à domicile et à Konodimini  à une clientèle composée majoritairement  de femmes. Madame Bah espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20 000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé dans la prise en charge des besoins des enfants et pour augmenter son fond de commerce.
texts.en:
The six women of the group called Bolodombolo are married, mostly in monogamous families. They have an average age of 35 and on average two children each. They all live in the village of  Bamanan-Zambougou in the region of Ségou (fourth administrative region of Mali) and they met through ties of neighborhood, kinship, and through their money-earning activities in the village. They sell cereals, milk and condiments. Wishing to grow their working capital, the members of the group decided to work together  with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their first solidarity loan. 

Madame Bah (the woman standing on the far right of the photo) intends to use her loan to buy one sack of rice wholesale from the farmers in  Konodimini. The resale will be done for cash and credit from her home and in Konodimini  to a clientele composed mainly of women. Madame Bah hopes to make an average monthly profit of 20,000 f CFA with this loan which will be used to cover the needs of her children and to grow her working capital.

loans.use: to buy rice for resale

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David lives in Mombasa, Kenya. He is 42 years old and married with three children. He has been operating a food cafe for more than two years now and the business has been seeing growth. He has two employees who help him run the business. He knew Milango through friends, and he decided to join so as to access credit to fund the business. 

He now seeks a loan to renovate and expand the premises. This business is the only source of income for the family. He hopes that the cafe will grow into a reputable restaurant in town. The extra income that he will raise will improve his living standards.

loans.use: to renovate and expand the cafe premises.

loans.name: Hariet

texts.en: Hariet is grateful to have recieved a loan from Kiva. She is 27 years of age, married and blessed with one child. She was able to secure her first loan, which she repaid without challenges, and now she seeks another loan to buy detergent for her new venture. She has been in the detergent business for sometime, and the business is growing alongside her other clothes business. She hopes that in the next five years she will be a supplier. The challenge in the business is not getting paid on time so that she can move ahead.

loans.use: to buy detergent

loans.name: Janet

texts.es:
Janet es una mujer de 21 años, vive en la ciudad de Chincha con su pequeño hijo, ella es muy trabajadora, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Janet no ha podido estudiar la carrera profesional de Administración de Empresas.
Por iniciativa propia, Janet trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de ropa y juguetes, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y por los buenos precios que ofrece a sus clientes.
Janet se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada comprará mercadería para abastecer su negocio, de esta manera atenderá a mas clientes, así pues Janet seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su negocio en una galería de su ciudad.
texts.en:
Janet is a 21 year old woman. She lives in the city of Chincha with her young son. She is hardworking, and puts all her efforts into supporting the family. Unfortunately, due to lack of financial resources and the need to work, Janet has not been able to study for a career in Business Administration.

Through her own initiative, Janet works in her own small business selling clothes and toys. She works every day for approximately 10 hours and thinks she is doing well because of her efforts and the good prices she offers her customers.

Janet is grateful to Kiva lenders as thanks to the help she can buy merchandise to supply her business, and in this way she can cater to more customers. Janet plans to continue working and struggling to achieve her big dream of having a shop in a gallery in the city.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her clothing and toy business

loans.name: Yngrid Yasmin

texts.es:
Yngrid es una mujer de 21 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Chincha con sus padres y hermanos, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres, Yngrid pudo estudiar la carrera técnica de Enfermería.
Por iniciativa propia, Yngrid trabaja como enfermera en un centro medico de su ciudad, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y dedicación.
Yngrid se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada mejorará su vivienda, pintando y poniendo piso a una habitación de su hogar, de esta manera ella y su familia tendrá mayor bienestar, así pues Yngrid seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ser una gran profesional.
texts.en:
Yngrid is a 21-year-old single woman who lives in the city of Chincha with her parents and siblings. She is a very kind, hard-working and enthusiastic person with a great wish to improve her situation. Thanks to the efforts and support of her parents Yngrid was able to study a technical major in nursing.

By her own initiative Yngrid works as a nurse in a medical center in her city, working for approximately 10 hours every day. She thinks she does well due to her good performance and dedication.

Yngrid is very grateful to Kiva lenders, since thanks to their help she will improve her home, painting and installing a hard floor in one room. In this way she and her family have a better life. Yngrid will thus continue to work and to make an effort to achieve her dream of being a great professional.

loans.use: to improve her home

loans.name: Rani's Group

texts.en:
Rani is 37, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

Her financial condition is not good, and the living condition of her house is not up to the mark.

These drawbacks are only due to a lack of income. She is the mother of a son, and he is still going to school.
 
Her husband owns a small restaurant in which he offers lunch at noon. Actually his restaurant is situated near a firm and all the laborers of that firm like to take lunch at his restaurant. At noon he offers lunch and in the evening time he offers only tea. He sends tea and food inside the firm so that sometimes the crockery gets lost. Now he has limited crockery to offer food to his customers. 

Her husband wants to buy new crockery and wants to offer more flavors of food. Therefore, Rani requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan. 

She hopes that her husband would be empowered to buy new crockery and food items. Rani is very happy and relaxed after taking this loan because this loan will bring positive changes in the lives of her family members.

loans.use: To buy crockery and food items for their resturant.

loans.name: Nolipaz

texts.en: Nolipaz, aged 48, is married to a farmer. To improve her family’s living condition, she is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase more groceries to sell in front of their house, such as food snacks, spices and beverages. By doing so, she will be able to earn more income to financially support her family's needs especially her children's. In the future, she would like to expand her store and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in front of their house, such as food snacks, spices and beverages.

loans.name: Felicita Ingri

texts.es:
Felicita es una mujer de 22 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Parcona con sus padres, ella es muy trabajadora, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por salir adelante; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Felicita no ha podido estudiar la carrera profesional de Administración de Empresas.
Por iniciativa propia, Felicita trabaja como personal de limpieza en una empresa de su ciudad, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y esfuerzo.
Felicita se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada comprara una cocina, la cual reemplazara a su cocina de kerosene que presenta desperfectos, de esta manera Felicita brindara mayor seguridad para su familia, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de convertirse en una buena profesional.
texts.en:
Felicita, 22, is single and lives with her parents in the city of Ica in the district of Parcona.  She's a very hardworking woman who puts all her effort into getting ahead.  Felicita wasn't able to study business administration because she lacked the financial resources and had to work.

Felicita works on her own initiative on the cleaning staff in a company in her city.  She works approximately 10 hours every day and believes it's going well for her because of her dedication and effort.

Felicita's very grateful to the Kiva lenders because thanks to their help she'll buy a stove to replace her flawed kerosene stove.

This way Felicita can provide safety for her family and continue to work and make the effort to achieve her big dream of becoming a good professional.

loans.use: to buy a stove

loans.name: Sauda

texts.en:
Sauda is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Sauda operates a food preparation business, making rice, tea, beans, and chapati (flat bread) for sale to passersby and neighbors. 

With the loan of 30,000 KES, she wants to purchase food items like wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar and beans. She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase food items like wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar and beans.

loans.name: Djekafo Group

texts.fr:
Les 4 femmes du groupe Djekafo sont mariées majoritairement  dans des familles monogamiques. Elles ont en moyenne 42 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le village de Bamanan-Zambougou dans la région de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le village. Elles font le petit commerce de céréales, du lait et de condiments. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3ème  cycle du prêt solidaire.
Madame Maimouna (2ème  femme debout de la droite vers la gauche  dans la photo) compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 3 sacs  de mil avec les exploitants à Konodimini. La revente se fait au comptant  et à crédit à domicile et à Konodimini  à une clientèle composée majoritairement  de femmes. Madame Bah espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 18 000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé dans la prise en charge des besoins des enfants et pour augmenter son fond de commerce.
texts.en:
The four women of the group called Djekafo are married, mostly in monogamous families. They have an average age of 42 and on average, three children. They all live in the village of  Bamanan-Zambougou in the region of Ségou (fourth administrative region of Mali). They met through ties of neighborhood and kinship, and through their money-earning activities in the village. They are small-scale sellers of  cereals, milk and condiments. Wishing to grow their working capital, the members of the group decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their third solidarity loan. 

Madame Maimouna (second woman standing from right  to left in the photo) intends to use her loan to buy three sacks of millet from the farmers in Konodimini. She will resell the millet for cash or credit from her home and in Konodimini  to a clientele composed mainly of women. Madame Maimouna hopes to make an average monthly profit of 18,000 f CFA with this loan. The profit will be used to cover the needs of her children and to grow her working capital.

loans.use: to buy millet for resale

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad was born in 1982. He is married and lives in an area in Jordan called Marka. He is in the military. Ahmad also has been selling foodstuffs for 1 year. He is planning to expand his mini-market in the future. Now, he needs to buy new merchandise like children's milk and cleaners in order to raise his income to be able to support his family. However, he doesn't have enough money for that. For this reason, he applied for this loan.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs for his mini-market

loans.name: Mwanahamisi

texts.en: Mwanahamisi is requesting a loan of 10,000 Kenyan shillings to purchase cooking oil and cassava. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income that she used to take care of her family. She appreciates the previous loan.

loans.use: to purchase cooking oil and cassava.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa lives in West Point, one of the most populated and well known markets in Montserrado county in Liberia.  She is 33 years old, and  she is married with three children, ages between 5 and 20 years, who are in school and live at home. 

For the past four years, she has had a table in her community where she sells rice, pepper, soap, vita, and others items.  She received a small amount of money from her husband to started her business, and she learned this way of trading from her mother. She likes her business because she makes some profits. 

Hawa is requesting a loan to buy rice, pepper, soap, vita, and others items to expand her business. Her plans are to educate  her children and build a house.

loans.use: to buy rice, pepper, soap, vita, and other items to expand her business

loans.name: Hamlet

texts.en:
Hamlet is 41 years old and he lives in Vanadzor city with his wife, two sons, and retired mother. Hamlet has no higher education, but it is already five years that he perfectly manages the furniture-making handicraft, the income of which serves as his family's livelihood. He makes various fashionable furniture for bedrooms and guestrooms, cabinets and soft furniture. 

Hamlet’s furniture-making activities take place in a small workshop beside their house. The materials that he needs during his work are bought from the building materials shops of his city. Hamlet takes individual orders and after a short wait, the ordered furniture is ready for the customer.

Hamlet is asking for a loan of 500,000 Armenian drams to buy dry timber for his furniture-making activities.

loans.use: To buy dry timber for his furniture-making activities

loans.name: Armine

texts.en:
Armine is from Yerevan town, where she lives with her mother. She works at a local cafe as a singer and by this earns her living. Besides working as a singer, Armine is also involved in sewing. She sews different dresses and sells them to her acquaintances. 

Realizing that the sewing business can provide her a stable income, Armine wants to enlarge it. So far she does all her sewing by hand.  Since she has no sewing machine, it is very difficult for her to expand her production of dresses. So she has applied for this loan for help. 

Armine has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit.  Thus this loan is very important for Armine to enable her to buy a sewing machine and increase her sewing business.  Armine waits for lenders' support.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and expand her business

loans.name: Saima

texts.en:
Saima is 31. Her husband is a photographer by profession; he owns a photography shop near his house and he provides services for snapshots and developing for marriage ceremonies or festivals. He shoots the snaps but for developing he has to take help from the snaps developers. His business is going on very well and he is earning sufficient income. 

Saima's husband has been using a camera which uses rolls of film but its result is not digital, and now he wants to buy a digital camera so that he can provide better services to his customers. He wants to provide digital services to his customers so that his reputation and goodwill increase. 

Therefore, Saima requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so her husband would be able to buy a digital camera for snapshots. Saima is very thankful to Kiva and to its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a digital camera for photography.

loans.name: Shamshad

texts.en:
Shamshad is 50 years old, a vigorous married woman and a mother of five children. She has a business doing hand-embroidery. She is passionate about her work, and client demand is strong.  Shamshad’s embroidery patterns are very popular on her street, and she is the best earning resource in her household. 

 To complete the orders of her customers on time, she needs to purchase raw materials. For this she has requested for a loan of Rs. 50,000 to buy reels of thread in different colors along with packs of beads, sequins and stones for its embellishment. In this way she would be able to cater for more customers consistently. She is hopeful to get an increase in her income by targeting more customers. She is in her 9th loan cycle with good repayment history. She dreams of her children's bright future and desires to improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy reels of thread in different colors along with packs of beads, sequins and stones.

loans.name: Hameeda

texts.en:
Hameeda is 44 years old, a married woman and mother of five children. The man shown in the photo is Hameeda’s husband who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. 

For this reason, Hameeda has applied for a loan of Rs 30,000, for her husband. He wants to buy new tires for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. Hameeda is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires for her husband's vehicle.

loans.name: Shaheem

texts.en: Shaheem is a 48-year-old woman and a mother of three children. She has been successfully running a small general store in her community for the last eight years. She offers various daily-use items. She has good communication skills and counts on a good client list. As she wants to grow her business, she requested a loan of Rs 40,000 to buy a stock of rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates. She then would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She is on her fourth loan cycle and has shown excellent repayment behavior. She wishes to utilize part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses and part to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy a stock of rice, sugar and flour.

loans.name: Alijon

texts.en:
Alijon is a hardworking man. He and his wife are happy and have two children. He has a lot of friends, and all of them love him very much.

Alijon has been farming for 10 years, producing wheat and potatoes. He has been in this line of work since he was a boy, so all of his experience has been dedicated to producing crops. His products are sold at the local market in the city. He has additional income from animal husbandry. 

In order to increase his working capital, he is asking for a loan of 5,000 somoni to buy cattle. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy cattle for increasing his working capital.

loans.name: Shakeela

texts.en:
Shakeela is 46 years old and married, the mother of four children. She is striving hard to meet their needs, including food, clothing, and health. 

She started her business of sewing clothes to contribute to the family income. She is well familiar with the stitching techniques and enjoys a great client list. 

To cope with the increasing demand of her customers, she has requested a loan of PKR 25,000 to buy a stock of threads in different colors, along with packs of buttons and needles. She expects a boost in her earnings and wishes to spend the part of income on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a stock of threads in different colors, along with packs of buttons and needles.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with two children, both in school. She lives in her own house, which has neither electricity nor piped water. 

She has operated a fish-selling business for the past five years, selling from home to restaurant operators and passersby. 

With the KSH 30,000 she wants to purchase more bundles of fish for resale. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish for resale

loans.name: Shahida

texts.en:
Shahida is 51 years old and married.  Two years ago she started her business of milk sales with the support of her husband. She has four buffaloes and one cow. 

Because of her work, she is respected in her home. She helps her husband in all family matters as well as financial matters. While talking to the Kashf officer, she shared the feeling of achievement she got by sending her children to schools for better education. 

She is in her third loan cycle with the Kashf Foundation. She has some past savings, and she has applied for a loan of PKR 35,000 to purchase another buffalo. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

She is very thankful to Kashf for its support.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Josephine's Group

texts.en:
This group is composed of two members who live in the same neighborhood. The group's representative, Josephine, is 40 years old and has an elementary-school education. 

With the goal of boosting their business in order to cope with the demand of their customers, this group is requesting financial support from ID-Ghana for the third time. They are into the sale of footwear and plates. 

Josephine is married to a carpenter named Nicholas. The couple has three children, who are not in school but in their care. Josephine lives together with her husband and children. The couple jointly ensures that the household expenses are covered. For this reason, Josephine has been selling footwear for six years. She gets her supplies from a market in Ghana. 

With the goal of increasing her level of business and satisfying her customers, Josephine, along with the other member, is requesting a loan amount of 1,600 GHS (Ghana cedis) from ID-Ghana.

loans.use: To buy footwear to sell to customers.

loans.name: Liana

texts.en:
Liana is choreographer with eight years of teaching experience. She lives in Yerevan town with her father and gives dancing classes at a local art school. As a hardworking teacher and good dancer, Liana teaches school-age children with great love and care. But Liana needs financial support for purchasing clothing for her dance classes. 

Liana has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. So, this loan is very important for Liana to be able to purchase clothing for her children and make her dance classes more attractive for them.

She hopes for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for clothing for the dance classes that she teaches.

loans.name: Mugdelain

texts.en:
Mugdelain is a 50-year-old married woman.  She has run a business of buying and selling animals for many years with her husband (who is also shown in the photo). She buys baby goats and calves at low prices, brings them up, then sells them out in the market at a higher price. 

Her business is good enough to provide her with a decent life, and she has improved her business to meet her day-to-day expenses. For the further improvement of her business, Mugdelain has contacted the Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase one more goat and a calf. 

Mugdelain is in her seventh loan cycle with a good repayment history.  She hopes to grow her business and dreams of  providing a better standard of living for her family members, through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to purchase one more goat and a calf

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a jointer.

loans.name: Erkin

texts.en:
Erkin is 44 years old. He lives in a small village with his wife and two children. He requested loans from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected because of his low income and the family’s poor living conditions.

The only source of income for the family is from agricultural activities. In particular, they have milking cows. They sell milk at local markets. Besides that, they have agricultural land where they grow potatoes and crops. It is hardly enough to provide food for the family. 

He wants to develop his business, but he has no money to buy more cattle. This loan will help him to increase the number of cattle, and from the profit, improve his family's living conditions. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy cattle for his business.

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en:
Farzana is a 40-year-old married woman and a mother of four. She is a hardworking mother who is helping her family by providing the service of tailoring in her community. She has years of experience in this field. She very well knows the techniques of stitching. 

Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns enough to lead a decent life. To help her continue operating her business, she requested for a loan of PKR 15,000 to buy a new sewing machine with some spools of threads in different colors. In this way, she will be able to stitch up more dresses on time.  

In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine with some spools of threads in different colors.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy corn in order to make and sell tortillas.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma appreciates her previous Kiva loan that improved her living standards. She is requesting a loan of KES 40,000 to purchase tea leaves, bread, cooking oil, salt and sugar to sell. 

Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase tea leaves, bread, cooking oil, salt and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Tahira

texts.en:
Tahira is a 39-year-old married woman and a mother of six children. She has been successfully running a small general store at the corner of her house. She counts a good client list and makes enough to contribute to her family's income, as her husband is a government employee with low salary income.

To make her store fully stocked, she requested a loan of PKR 35,000 to buy a stock of rice, sugar and flour to meet the increasing demands at her store. She is in her fourth loan cycle. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy a stock of rice, sugar and flour to meet the increasing demands at her store.

loans.name: Mai

texts.en:
Mai is a 46-year-old married woman. she has been running a business of animal sale and purchase for many years. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, raises them, then her husband sells them out in the market at higher prices. 

She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf foundation. Currently, she requested a loan of PKR 35,000 to purchase two more goats. 

She is in her third loan cycle with good repayment history. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase two more goats.

loans.name: Felicia's Group

texts.en:
Felicia is the representative of a group that consists of two indigenous women from Teshie-Ghana. These women engage in trading slippers, wigs, creams and shampoo. 

Felicia is a married mother and she works very hard to support her household. She has two young children. This hardworking woman is a traveling merchant who sells wigs, perfumes, creams and shampoo. The income she generates from this business enables her to cover all of her family expenses, reinvest, and repay her loan. She has received two previous loans, which were a great help to her and her children. 

This new investment will be used to buy merchandise such as wigs, perfumes, creams and shampoo and resell to customers.

Her most important goal is to provide a better quality of life for her little ones, but she also wants to increase her sales by expanding into other communities nearby.

loans.use: To buy merchandise such as wigs, perfumes, creams and shampoo to resell to customers.

loans.name: Sadia

texts.en:
Sadia is a 24-year-old lady who is been working doing hand embroidery for many years. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home. 

To help her to continue her operations, she requested a loan of PKR 20,000 to buy reels of threads in different colors along with packs of beads, sequins and stones for embellishment. This will help her to complete the orders of her customers on time. 

She is hopeful of getting an increase in her income by targeting more customers. Sadia dreams of providing a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to buy reels of threads in different colors along with packs of beads, sequins and stones.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is 27 years old. She is a married woman and a mother of three children. The man shown in the photo is Mariam’s husband who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family's expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. 

For this reason Mariam has applied for a loan of PKR 30,000 for her husband. He wants to buy new tires for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. She is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires for her husband's vehicle.

loans.name: Saiqa

texts.en:
Saiqa is a 24-year-old vigorous lady; she has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family as her husband is employed but has a low salary and income. Due to lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. 

For this reason she requested a loan of PKR 30,000 from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of threads in different colors with packs of laces, zippers and buttons. This will help her to create a means of increasing revenues so she may able to generate a healthier source of income. She is in her 3rd loan cycle with a good repayment history.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads in different colors with packs of laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Sahib

texts.en:
Sahib is a 47-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store for the past two years at the corner of her house. She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. She makes enough to provide for her family. 

To make her store fully stocked, she requested a loan of PKR 25,000 which she will use to buy a stock of rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates. In this way she will be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She wishes to utilize part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy a stock of rice, sugar and flour.

loans.name: Rukia

texts.en:
Rukia appreciates her previous Kiva loan that improved her living standards.

She is requesting a loan of KES 10,000 to purchase wheat flour, bread, cooking oil, salt, sugar and maize flour. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, bread, cooking oil, salt, sugar and maize flour.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer con muchas ganas de salir adelante, es madre de 2 hijos de 11 y 13 años de edad por quienes trabaja muy duro para poder ofrecerles una vida digna. Maria trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de abarrotes, el cual inicio con  mucho esfuerzo; Maria cree que está saliendo adelante porque es muy  amable con los clientes y sobre todo vende productos de calidad.

Maria está muy agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a su gran ayuda podrá comprar mas mercadería para su negocio como Arroz, azúcar al por mayor, fideos, entre otros, lo que le permitirá atender mejor a sus clientes y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su sueño:” Darle una profesión a sus hijos y tener un minimarket
texts.en:
Maria is a woman eager to move forward. She is a mother of 2 children, 11 and 13, for whom she works very hard to be able to offer them a dignified life. Maria works in her small business selling groceries, which she started with much effort. Maria believes that she is moving forward because she is very friendly with the customers and, above all, she sells quality products.

Maria is very thankful for the Kiva lenders given that thanks to their great help she will buy more merchandise for her business like rice, bulk sugar, pasta, etc. This will permit her to assist her customers better and continue fighting in order to be able to make her dream a reality: "To give a career to her children and have a mini market."

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Zubaida

texts.en:
Zubaida is a 54-year-old woman, and a mother of five. She is involved in a business of selling bangles. She always has a great collection to offer, and she is quite familiar with the tastes and demands of her customers. She has gradually improved her business and makes enough to bear her household expenses.  

Now, she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy more varieties of bangles in different colors and designs. In this way, she will be able to increase her net income through increased sales. She is in her 10th loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior. She dreams of expanding her business and providing a better standard of living for her children.

loans.use: to buy more varieties of bangles in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 46 years old and lives in West Point which has the most populated market in Montserrado County. She is married with six children aged 10 to 29. Three of her kids are going to school and live at home. She stoped her education at 11th grade, and she is a potential business woman who manages her business well. Her husband is a businessman. Notwithstanding, she manages her business well to enable her to support her home. 

Over the past four years, she has been running a table in the local market without facing any serious problem. She started her business with a little amount she got from her husband. She sells, spending 10 hours each day. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, pepper, bitter-ball, onions, vita, etc. for her business. Her plan is to expand her business even more. She thanks BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, pepper, bitter-ball, onions and vita for her business.

loans.name: Haleema

texts.en:
Haleema is a 56-year-old married woman.

She is involved in a business of milk sales with the support of her husband. She has two buffaloes in milk and sells their milk to many of their neighbors, along with butter and cheese that she makes from the milk.  She looks after the buffaloes and performs the task of collecting milk from them while her husband sells it to different places on daily basis. They are happily doing it together to support their family.

She is the mother of two children and needs to earn much more to meet their everyday expenditures including food, clothing and health. In order to make huge profits, she requested a loan of 50,000 PKR to buy one more buffalo. This will help her to increase her sales, which will ultimately help in generating more income for her.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en:
Sakina, age 48, is a married woman and a mother of five. She has been doing a business of milk sales for many years to contribute to her family income. At present she has two buffaloes which she uses for milk to sell to the people of her locality. She has become famous for providing good-quality milk and has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation. 

Currently she is in her second loan cycle and has applied for a loan of PKR 30,000. This will allow her to purchase one more buffalo. She is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her and will bring positive changes to her business.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo.

loans.name: Shakeela

texts.en:
Shakeela is a 32-year-old married woman who has been doing a business of milk sales for many years. She has two buffaloes and two cows in milk. She sells good-quality milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter that she makes from the milk. Her business is good enough to allow her to lead a decent life. She is a mother of seven children: five daughters and two sons, and all are school-going. She is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing. 

She has improved her business to meet day-to-day expenses of life. She is in her second loan cycle with a good repayment history. Currently, she requested a loan of PKR 30,000 to purchase one more buffalo. It will help her to inflate her sales which will help in generating more income for her.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo.

loans.name: Binti

texts.en:
Binti appreciates her previous Kiva loan that improved her living standards.

She is requesting a loan of 100,000 KES to purchase corn flour, wheat flour, tea leaves, bread, cooking oil, salt and sugar. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase corn flour, wheat flour, tea leaves, bread, cooking oil, salt and sugar.

loans.name: Anees

texts.en:
Anees is a 46-year-old married woman. For many years she has been successfully running a business of milk sales. Over time, she has become famous in her area for providing good quality milk. She counts a good client list and makes enough to contribute to her family's income.

She is a hardworking woman and the mother of six children. Her business is good enough for her to lead a decent life. It’s her third year with Kashf Foundation and she is happily running her business through its support. Now she requested a loan of 35,000 PKR to purchase one more buffalo. She hopes to get an increase in the production capacity of milk which ultimately will help in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo

loans.name: Sajjda

texts.en:
Sajjda is a 38-year-old married woman and a mother of six. She has been successfully running a business selling milk for many years. She sells milk and yogurt to the people of her community. Over time, Sajjda has become famous in her area for providing good quality milk. She has a good client list and makes enough to contribute to her family's income.

It is her third year with Kashf Foundation.  Currently she is requesting a 35,000 PKR loan to purchase another buffalo. She expects to boost her earnings with her loan and plans to spend her profits on expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo

loans.name: Estela Karen

texts.es:
Estela es una mujer de 29 años de edad,  estudio hasta cuarto grado en una escuela rural, hace 20 años se traslado de domicilio, por problemas del conflicto armado en El Salvador, Ella es madre soltera de dos niñas de 6 y 9 años y trabaja por su cuenta para brindarles lo necesario, ellas asisten a la escuela de la comunidad. Estela, posee su casa aparte, pero están cerca de la casa de su mamá y sus hermanos en el mismo terreno.      

 Ella posee,  un  negocio de venta de tortillas en su casa que maneja de forma independiente, antes la                trabajaba de empleada cerca de sus casa y ahí aprendió el negocio de las tortillas y luego de algún tiempo decidió hacerlo de forma independiente en su casa; ya que es un negocio que sabiéndolo administrar es rentable. Se levanta a las 3 a.m. todos los días a preparar el maíz y cocerlo en la hornilla de leña a las 5 a.m. ya esta lavando el maíz para irse al molino a las 6 a.m. y  alistar a las niñas y llevarlas a la escuela a las 7: 30 a.m. su mamá le ayuda en la elaboración de las tortillas por ratos.       

Con el préstamo comprara maíz y leña, en estos días porque el maíz se compra mas barato, por la cosecha de las milpas de invierno de algunos agricultores de la zona, cancelara el saldo de un crédito vigente en la Fundación CAMPO. así podrá generar mayores ingresos para su familia y que sus hijas estén mejor y que no les falte nada.

Sus sueños, son tener un negocio exitoso, que sus hijas estudien y vivan bien; manifestó que su niñez fue dura su mamá hacia tamales para vender y a ella le tocaba andar con el guacal en la cabeza por todo el caserío y  no quiere eso para las hijas . 

Quiere ver si poco a poco va mejorando la casa y construirla de ladrillo o de bloque, por que donde vive ahora es de lamina.
texts.en:
Estela is a 29 year-old woman; she studied until fourth grade in a rural school. 20 years ago she moved from home because of problems of armed conflict in El Salvador. She is a single mother of two daughters, 6 and 9, and works on her own to provide them with the necessary. They go to the community school. Estela owns a separate house, but the children are close to the house and to their mother and her siblings in the same area.

She owns a business selling tortillas in her house that she manages independently. Before she worked as an employee near her house and there she learned the tortilla business. Later, after some time she decided to do it independently in her house, given that she knew it would be a profitable business to run. She gets up at 3 AM every day to prepare the corn and cook it in the wood oven. At 5 AM, she is already washing the corn in order to go to the mill at 6 AM. She enrolls and takes the girls to school at 7:30 AM. Her mother helps her with the production of tortillas for a while.

With the loan she will buy corn and firewood. In these days corn is bought more cheaply because of the harvest of the winter cornfields of some farmers of the region. She will pay off a current balance in the CAMPO Foundation. Thereby she will be able to generate more income for her family and that her daughters are better and so that they are not lacking anything.

Her dreams are to have a successful business and that her daughters study and live well. She said that her childhood was hard: her mother made tamales to sell and she had to walk with the crate on her head through the entire neighborhood and she doesn't want this for her daughters.

She wants to see if little by little she can improve the house and to construct it of brick or cinderblock, because where she lives now it's made of sheet metal.

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood and to pay off a current balance with the institution.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
José esta soltero, es de profesión abogado, vive en la casa de sus padres en la zona de Sopocachi de la ciudad de La Paz 
Actualmente trabaja como procurador en el Poder Judicial donde percibe un sueldo mínimo con el cual cubre sus necesidades de alimentación y estudio, el crédito que solicita es para ayudar a sus padres a terminar de construir un muro de contención para que no haya deslizamientos de terreno en el domicilio

El sueño de Jose es darles comodidad a sus padres y que tengan una casita cómoda donde descansar ya que son mayores de edad.
texts.en:
José is single and a lawyer by profession.  He lives at his parents’ house in the District of Sopocachi in the city of La Paz.  

José currently works a prosecutor for the judiciary.  He receives a minimal salary, which enables him to cover necessities such as food and education.  The loan he is requesting will help his parents finish the construction of a retaining wall that will protect their house from landslides.  

José dreams of providing his parents a comfortable home where they can rest since they are older in age.

loans.use: to build a retaining wall to protect his parents' home from landslides.

loans.name: Khalida's Group

texts.en:
Khalida is 35 years old and lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her entire family depends on a single source of income from an embroidery shop. This embroidery shop is run by her husband. Her husband has help from the ladies of his town.  He pays a reasonable amount to these ladies. He provides the embroidery material to these ladies and they provide the service to knit the embroidery. He then collects this knitted embroidery and sells it in his shop. This has allowed him to make the maximum income for his family. 

Additional needy ladies have asked to provide this embroidery service, but he does not have the funds to buy the costly embroidery material. He plans to sell the extra knitted embroidery in the market also. 

Therefore, Khalida requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband would be able to buy more material such as cloth, sequins and pearls of various colors.

Khalida says thank to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy thread, fancy cloth, sequins and pearls of various colors.

loans.name: Matluba

texts.ru: Матлюба живет в деревни. Ее деревня находится далеко от города, где природа подарила людям возможность для развития сельского хозяйства. Она 13 лет назад начала свой бизнес, не так как другие жители земледелием и скотоводством, а купле продажей детской одежды. Так как она живет в сельской местности и там мало конкуренции, так и ей легко справляться с бизнесом. Она покупает товар оптом из городского рынка и реализует в розницу на своей лавке. Она общительная и милая женщина и поэтому умеет делать индивидуальный подход каждому клиенту. Она хочет отремонтировать свой дом, так как ее дом имеет плохое состояние, и она должна создать хорошую условию для своих 3 детей, а ее муж трудовой мигрант и не отправляет деньги для покупки строительных материалов. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 7500 сомони для покупки строительных материалов, как краски, цемент, песок и т.п. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Matluba lives in a village, located far from any big city, and where nature gives people the opportunity to develop the agricultural industry.  Thirteen years ago, Matluba started a business, not a farming or herding business like many villagers, but rather in selling children's clothing.  Since she lives in a rural area she has little competition and it is easy for her to be successful in her business.  She buys her goods wholesale at a large city market and retails her goods from her own shop.  Matluba is a sweet and out-going woman, and because of this, she is able to take an individual approach with each client.

Matluba's home is in poor condition and she wants to repair it because she needs to provide her three children with good living conditions.  Her husband is an emigrant laborer and he won't send money home for building materials.  Matluba is requestng a loan of 7,500 somoni (TJS) to buy building materials such as paint, cement, sand, etc.  She is relying on your kindness.

loans.use: to buy building materials such as cement, wood, soil for repairing her house

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 33-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. She has seven years of experience in this field.  Her husband also assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts over the years. She is a mother of five children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health.

She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy packs of oil, biscuits and grains to meet with the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of oil, biscuits and grains

loans.name: Seryozha

texts.en:
Seryozha is 54 years old and lives in Kapan city. He is married and has a daughter and a son.  Both of his children are married and they live separately with their own families. His wife works as a teacher at the nearest village school. 

Seryozha has a special interest in veterinary, but for many years he has worked as a preservation inspector. Seryozha and his wife also own a small farm where they breed two cows, a calf, five piglets and they also have beehives.  Seryozha says that he and his wife sell milk, meat and honey from their farm.

He requested a loan of 600,000 Armenain Drams (AMD) to buy some animal fodder for the upcoming cold winter months and to buy a few beehives.

loans.use: to buy some animal fodder for the upcoming cold winter months and to buy a few beehives

loans.name: Mujeres Activas Group

texts.es:
La señora Manuela de estado civil casada, de 49 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 7 hijos y 2 de ellos estan estudiando, se dedica al comercio especificamente a la compra y venta de frutas exportadas, inició este negocio con ya ayuda de su esposo y hasta ls fecha lleva 10 años de experiencia. Cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica al comercio.

Decide organizar un grupo y solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizará para ampliar su capital de trabajo comprando mas frutas para surtir su venta, desea en el futuro tener un local grande el el mercado de su municipio. Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a elaboración de tejidos y a actividades pecuarias. En la fotografía hace falta una de las integrantes puesto que no pudo asistir al momento de tomar la foto.
texts.en:
Manuela is 49 years old and married. She didn't have the opportunity to study, but she has 7 children and 2 of them are studying. 

She makes a living in buying and selling fruits for export. She started this business with the help of her husband and has 10 years of experience to date. She counts on the support of her husband, who is dedicated to the business.

She decided to organize a group and apply for a loan that she will use to expand her working capital. She will buy more fruits to supply sales. She hopes in the future to have a large stall in the municipal market. 

The other members of the group make a living in the elaboration of textiles and in livestock activities. One member is missing from the photo, because she could not be there when the photo was taken.

loans.use: to buy fruit.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a 54-year-old married man. He lives in Vani district with his wife and daughter.  His wife is a housekeeper.

David in actively involved in agricultural activities. In particular, he has a milking cow and a calf. They produce dairy products for selling. Besides, they have a 0.5 hectare plot of agricultural land and a greenhouse where cucumbers, tomatoes and greens are grown. They sell the harvested products at local markets at a good price.

As the income is only seasonal and not enough for the family, David decided to start his business and seek credit among local financial institutions, but his attempts were unsuccessful because of his poor living conditions. The startup program that is joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables the rural poor and inexperienced people to get a loan for starting or re-starting businesses. His application was approved under the framework of this program to get a loan of $3,000. With the received credit, David will purchase a minibus and transport people. This will increase the income of his family and he will be able to improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase a minibus and transport people

loans.name: Akbarjan

texts.ru:
Акбаржану 47 лет и он живет в городе Турсунзаде. У него высшее образование, по профессии он стоматолог. Акбаржан в течение нескольких лет работал в поликлинике стоматологом. Теперь он решил открыть собственную клинику и уже арендовал специальное помещение для этого. Акбар просит кредит для того чтобы приобрести новое стоматологическое оборудование и начать работу. 
Акбара знают жители его местности не только как опытного стоматолога, но и как отца двоих сыновей и верного мужа. Его дети пошли по стопам отца, но не стали стоматологами. Они стали ювелирами. Стоматология тоже требует ювелирной работы.
texts.en:
Akbarjan is 47 years old and lives in the city of Tursun-zoda.  He has a higher education in dentistry.   For several years Akbarjan worked as a dentist in a polyclinic.  He has now decided to open his own clinic and has aleady rented a specialized office.  Akbarjan is requesting a loan in order to buy new dental equipment and start working.  

The residents of his region know Akbarjan not only as an experienced dentist, but as a father of two sons and a faithful husband.  His sons set off in their father's footsteps, but didn't become dentists, they became jewelers.  Dentistry also requires the knoweldge of a jeweler.

loans.use: to buy dental equipment for starting his business

loans.name: Solidario Claveles Group

texts.es:
Solidario Claveles 
Este grupo esta conformado por la señora Rosaria de 37 años de edad, ella tiene una panaderia desde hace 12 años, desde muy temprano empieza su actividad en la elaboracion de pan para cuando sus clientes la visitan ya tiene para la venta, en esta oportunidad esta solicitando este credito para la compra de arina y materiales para la elaboracion de pan ya que por la calidad de pan que vende sus clientes han aumentado y no tiene el suficiente capital para trabajar entonces esta solicitando la ayuda de kiva para seguir creciendo en su negocio.
texts.en: Rosaria, 37 years old, is a member of this group.  She has had a bakery for 12 years. Very early in the morning, she starts cooking bread so that it is ready for when her customers visit.  She is taking this chance to request a loan to buy flour and supplies for making bread.  The quality of her bread has led to an increase in customers, but she still doesn't have sufficient capital, so she is requesting the help of Kiva to continue growing her business.

loans.use: to buy flour and supplies for buying and selling bread.

loans.name: Marcia

texts.en:
Marcia is 33 years old and lives in the West Point area, which has the most populated market in Montserrado County. She is single and has three children ages 4, 9, and 18. Her children attend school and live at home.  She describes herself as a hard-working woman. 

Over the past three years Marcia has been selling morning-calama (soft-cooked rice that is eaten with sugar, mayonnaise, and milk) around the community from a bucket. She spends 6 hours each day selling. She like her business because of the popularity she has achieved over the years. She started this business with money given to her by her mother.  She normally uses a taxi to buy her goods.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, sugar, mayonnaise and milk for her business. She plans to build a house and become a big business woman.

 She thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, sugar, mayonnaise and milk for her business.

loans.name: Armando Antonio

texts.es:
Armando es un joven de 19 años, el cual vive en la ciudad de Chincha. Para poder salir adelante trabaja como albañil, el labora alrededor de 8 horas al día, ya que con el fruto de su trabajo solventa sus gastos de estudio, ya que actualmente se encuentra estudiando la carrera de ingeniería industrial.
