Armando está muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá solventar los pagos de sus mensualidades y podrá comprar folletos, libros, entre otros, de esta manera tendrá los materiales necesarios para estudiar y seguir luchando para hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Terminar su carrera y poder apoyar a su familia”.
texts.en:
Armando is a 19 year old young man.  He lives in the city of Chincha.  In order to be able to get ahead, he works as a bricklayer.  He works around eight hours a day.  With the fruit of his labor he pays his educational expenses.  He is currently studying for a degree in industrial engineering.

Armando is very grateful to the Kiva lenders.  Thanks to the help they have given him, he will be able to make his monthly payments and buy folders and books, among others.  This way he will have the materials needed to study and to continue struggling to make his big dream come true.  His dream is to finish his degree and to be able to support his family.

loans.use: to make his monthly payments and to buy educational materials.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 50 years old and lives in the town of Kajjansi in the Kampala west region of Uganda. He is married and has 10 children. Six of his children are currently in school. For the past 30 years Charles has been working hard to manage his retail shop which sells sugar, rice and soap. 

To help expand his business Charles has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to expand his business into a wholesale shop and will help Charles to generate greater profits and to bridge the financial gaps in his business. Charles  hopes that in the future he will be able to to expand his business. 

Charles is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Charles who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but who have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to expand his business into a wholesale shop.

loans.name: Armen

texts.en:
Over the years, Armen has become a master in the business of making rolls of tin foil and plastic wraps. He now works harder and more productively since his family has become bigger. He is married and his daughter was born 2 months ago. Armen’s business is going ahead and fortunately he has a lot of orders from supermarkets and corner stores. 

The previous two loans that Armen received from Kiva were more than useful and profitable. Armen would like to partner once again with Kiva lenders and he hopes for success and support like the other times. He is requesting a loan of $3,000 to buy a lot of materials for his business.

loans.use: to buy a lot of materials for his business.

loans.name: Julia Rosa

texts.es:
Julia tiene 25 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Pisco y para poder salir adelante trabaja como empleada en una pequeña distribuidora de su ciudad, con el fruto de su humilde trabajo puede solventar los gastos de su hogar a que ella es madre soltera y su pequeño tiene 2 años de edad; Julia cree que le está yendo bien porque es responsable y sobre todo honrada.

Julia está muy agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar una computadora, con lo cual podrá realizar sus informes de manera adecuada y así poder seguir esforzándose por hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Terminar una carrera profesional”.
texts.en:
Julia, age 25, lives in the city of Pisco.  In order to be able to get ahead, she works as an employee of a small distributorship in the city.  With the fruit of her humble work she is able to pay the household expenses.  She is a single mother, and she has a little two year old.  Julia believes that it is going well for her because she is responsible and, above all, she is honest.

Julia is very grateful to the Kiva lenders.  Thanks to the help they have given her, she will be able to buy a computer.  With the computer she will be able make her reports in an adequate manner.  This way she will be able to continue putting forth great effort to make her biggest dream come true.  Her dream is to finish her degree.

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: María Gloria

texts.es:
María tiene 41 años de edad, estudio hasta 5° grado, y no pudo continuar sus estudios porque se vivía un momento crítico por la guerra. Actualmente, es soltera y tiene dos hijos de 15 y 17 años que viven con ella, y están estudiando 5° y 9° grado en la escuela.


Ella, es costurera desde que tenía 16 años, ya que inicio un curso de costuteria en la comunidad, desde hace 10 años ha empezado a trabajar fuerte en este oficio, hasta la fecha tiene cuatro cursos dos de ellos realizados en la ciudad. Por ahora, tiene contrato con el Ministerio de Educación pues la contrataron para hacer los uniformes escolares. 

También trabaja con un  grupo en la comunidad llamado, especialmente es dedicado en el procesamiento de dulces y conservas y sus trabajos los realiza en casa. 


El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar adornos, para hacer trajes para los alumnos que desfilaran el 15 de Septiembre.

Su deseo, es seguir trabajando y creciendo con el negocio y poder comprar otra máquina de coser para que su hija cuando tenga tiempo, pueda ayudarle con el negocio y que sus hijos se preparen para ser profesionales.
texts.en:
María is 41 years old and went to school until the 5th grade, but she couldn't continue her studies because she grew up during wartime in her country. Currently, she is single and has two children who are 15 and 17 years old, both live with her and they are currently in the 5th and 9th grades. 

She is a seamstress, a job she has had for 16 years, after she took a sewing class in the community. It was 10 years ago that her work in this profession began in earnest. She has taken four different classes in the city to improve her skills. And now, she has a contract with the Education Ministry, who have hired her to make school uniforms. 

She works with a community group and she is especially dedicated to making sweets and conserves, work she does from home. 

The loan she is applying for is to purchase embellishments in order to make uniforms for the students who will graduate on September 15th. 

Her desire is to continue working and growing her business and to be able to purchase another sewing machine so that, when her daughter has free time, she can help her in this home business and that her children are able to get the education for a professional career.

loans.use: purchase embellishments, to make dresses for students who will parade on September 15th.

loans.name: Umoja Group

texts.en:
Umoja group is a group of woman from Eastern Kenya Meru region near Mount Kenya. It was started in 2012 to empower women with renewable energy and especially biogas since their region has a big problem with fuel for cooking. The plight of many women when it comes to firewood and charcoal can be likened to that of Lucy.

Lucy, second from right, is a middle aged woman. She is a mother of six and lives with her husband and her extended family. Lucy is a small scale farmer practicing dairy farming and owns a small piece of land where she grows food crops. With 4 cows, Lucy is able to sell at least 26 liters of milk daily and this forms her main source of income. Her husband works seasonally as a casual laborer to add to the family income.

Her main source of fuel is kerosene for lighting, as well as firewood and charcoal which are illegally acquired from the forest. This comes with a lot of challenges like women being sexually harassed by the forest guards, sometimes being arrested for trespassing forest reserves, sometimes being attacked by wild animals, and many other challenges. With the heavy load they have to carry they also develop back and joint problems.
 
With the campaign against deforestation in Mount Kenya forest, Lucy and her friends decided to have a biogas plant installed for them and they approached VEP for advice. Due to their many financial commitments, especially school fees for the kids and feeding the family, they opted for a biogas loan. With biogas Lucy and the others will save on fuel cost for cooking and lighting. They will also promote afforestation and a clean environment.

Lucy’s immediate and extended family will also benefit from the bio slurry which will be used as fertilizer on the farm. In the end, she will save more money for her basic needs and will be in a better position to repay the loan.

loans.use: to construct a Bio-Digester for home energy

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
Mario vive con su pareja y sus hijos en la ciudad de La Paz

En su casa tiene un pequeño taller de costura ya que se dedica a la confeccion de ternos de varon, con esta actividad el mantiene a su familia desde hace muchos años, su pareja se enfermo y tuvo que cubrir varios gastos, esto hizo que se quede sin capital por consiguiente solicita el credito para compra de material (telas, hilos, etc.) y continuar con su actividad, ya que es su unica fuente de ingresos.
texts.en:
Mario lives with his partner and their children in the city of La Paz.

He has a small workshop in his house where he makes men’s suits.  Through this business, he has been able to support his family for many years.  His partner became ill, so he has had to cover several expenses.  This forced him to go without capital.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan for buying materials (fabric, thread, and other items) so that he can continue his business since this is his only source of income.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, and other supplies.

loans.name: Sando

texts.en:
Sando is 30 years old and lives at West Point area which has the most populated market in Montserrado County. She is single and has three children between 9 and 12 years old; they are presently in school and live at home. She completed grade school before starting her business. She describes herself as a hardworking woman. For the past 3 years she has been selling soap in the local market. She sells for six days in a week from 8am to 9pm; she likes how fast her customers buy from her. She started this business by selling for her mother. She uses a taxi to pick up her stock. She is requesting a loan to purchase more soap for her business, she plans to build a house and attend a university. 

She likes to say thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more soap for her business

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en:
Everlyne is a widowed woman. She has three children, all of whom attend school. Everlyne lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest  monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Everlyne operates a retail shop that sells household consumables such as sugar, bread, rice, and beans. She dreams of opening a wholesale shop in the future.

She joined Yehu to get financial support. With the 50,000 KES from the loan, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, beans, and sugar for resale.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, beans, and sugar for resale.

loans.name: San Francisco De Los Llanos Group

texts.es:
La señora Basilia es madre soltera, tiene 47 años de edad, no le dieron la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 11 hijos y 6 de ellos estan estudiando, se dedica a la agricultura, inició este negocio desde pequeña ayudando a sus padres y a la fecha lleva 25 años de experiencia.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que lo utilizará para la compra de fertilizante para la cosecha de maíz y frijol, desea en el futuro tener más cuerdas de terreno para poder tener mas cosechas. Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a sembrar maíz y frijol, tambien a la crianza de animales domésticos.
texts.en:
Basilia is a single mother and 47 years old.  She didn't have the opportunity to go to school.  She has 11 children, and 6 of them are going to school.  She works in agriculture, and started in this business when she was young, helping her parents and to this date she has 25 years of experience.

She organized a group and requests a loan that will be used to buy fertilizers for her corn and bean crops. In the future she wants to have more land to be able to grow more crops.  The other members of the group work in growing corn and beans, and also in raising animals.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Naxi Jen Group

texts.es:
Naxi Jen es el nombre de un grupo integrado  por 8 mujeres cuya comunidad se caracteriza por hablar el dialecto Mazateco además del español; ell nombre del grupo está en esta lengua y significa Cerro de las Palmas, la principal fuante de trabajo se encuentra en el campo, en la siembra y cultivo de caña de azucar. 

Doña Dora es uno de los miembros del grupo, solo estudio secundaria, esta casasa y tiene 4 hijos que se encuentran estudiando(Jovana, Victor, Angel, Manuel). Ella platica que hace algunos años tomo un curso en el cual aprendio a elaborar pan  y hacia pequeñas ventas de donas y churros, hasta hace un año con el apoyo de su esposo iniciaron a elaboran y vender pan con el objetivo de ganar un poco de dinero,generar su propia funte de empleo haciendo algo que les gusta,  ellos todos los dias desde temprano se ponen a trabajar para que al medio dia esten saliendo con sus canastos por su comunidad ofreciendo su pan.
Un credito de VisionFund le ayudará a comprar variedad de harinas, azucar, aceite, levaduras y sal para continuar con su actividad.

Ella espera que su negocio continue progresando para que sus hijos tengan la oportunidad de estudiar una carrera profesinal y mejorar su vida. 

Los demás integrantes del grupo son:
Norma venta de frutas y verduras
Adela venta de dulces 
Liliana venta de bisurteria
Praxedes venta de muebles 
Florentina venta de antojitos 
Mayra venta de carne 
Benedicta venta de articulos para el hogar (toperware)
texts.en:
Naxi Jen is the name of this communal group, that is made up of 8 women. In their community they speak the dialect Mazateco as well as Spanish. The name of their group means "Cerro de las Palmas" (Palm Hills). The principal source of work here is the growing and harvesting of sugar cane. 

Ms. Dora is one of the group members and she finished secondary school. She is married and has four children who are all going to school (Jovanna, Victor, Angel, Manuel). She tells us that a few years ago she took a class where she learned to make bread and she began making small sales of donuts and churros. She likes this line of work a lot and she spends every day from the early morning to the end of the day making breads and taking them in her baskets to sell in her community. 

A credit with VisionFund will help her to purchase a variety of flours, sugar, oil, yeast and salt so she can continue baking. 

She hopes that with this loan she will continue improving her life so that her children have the opportunity to study for a profession career and improve their lives as well. 

The other members of the group are:
Norma who sells fruits and vegetables
Adela who sells sweets 
Liliana who sells jewelry
Praxedes  who sells furniture 
Florentina who sells snacks 
Mayra who sells meat 
Benedicta who sells housewares like tupperware

loans.use: purchase a variety of flours, oil, sugar, salt and yeasts.

location.town: Nuevo Soyaltepec, San miguel soyaltepec, Oaxaca

loans.name: Etidal

texts.en: Etidal was born in 1976. She is married and has 5 children. Her husband works in security. Etidal has been working in selling foodstuffs for 3 years. She started her project in a room at her house. Then she moved to her home garage as an independent mini market. But her garage doesn’t have a roof. As winter is coming, she is planning to build a roof for her garage to protect her mini market and its merchandise from rain and wind. But she doesn’t have enough money to build it. For this reason, she applied for this loan.

loans.use: To build a roof for her mini market

loans.name: Las Crucitas Group

texts.es:
Ubaldo, tiene 54 años de edad, esta casado, tiene seis hijos y vive en el municipio del Naranjito, Santa Bárbara. Tiene 30 años de dedicarse a la agricultura de maíz, frijol y su actividad principal es el cultivo de café. Estos cultivos los tiene en un lugar cercano a su casa y la producción la vende en la misma zona. Lleva cuatro ciclos de préstamos en ODEF. Este préstamo actual es por 10,000 lempiras y lo va utilizar para la compra de fertilizantes, abonos, fungicidas y para el pago de la mano de obra ´para darle mantenimiento a los cultivos de granos básicos y café, con el propósito de prevenir las enfermedades a los cultivos. Su meta es seguir adelante, seguir trabajando día a día, y poder dejarle  algo a su familia para que puedan trabajar.
Ubaldo ha solicitado el préstamo en forma grupal, el grupo se llama Las Crucitas y esta formado por 10 integrantes que viven en la misma comunidad y se dedican a la agricultura. En la foto se identifican así: a la izquierda esta Emar, Aly camisa café, Orvin camisa verde rayada, Víctor camisa celeste, Marvin, Elvin, Ubaldo de camisa manga larga cuadriculada blanca, German, José y Samuel a la derecha camisa salmón.
El préstamo grupal es por 81,000 Lempiras y lo utilizaran para comprar fertilizantes, abonos y pago por limpieza de la finca de café.
texts.en: Ubaldo is 54 years old, married, has six children and lives in the town of Naranjito, Santa Bárbara. He has worked for 30 years in farming corn and beans and his main activity is in coffee cultivation. He keeps his crops close to home and the produce is sold in the same area. He has had four cycles of ODEF loans. The current loan is 10,000 lempiras, and will be used in order to purchase fertilizers, manure, fungicides and to pay for labour costs for the maintenance of crops such as staple grains and coffee. His goal is to keep going, to keep working day by day, and to be able to leave something for his family so that they are able to work. Ubaldo has requested a group loan. The group is called Las Crucitas and consists of 10 members living in the same community who work in agriculture. In the photo the group members are as follows: on the left is Emar, Aly in the brown shirt, Orvin in the striped green shirt, Victor in the blue shirt, next Marvin and Elvin, Ubaldo in the checkered long-sleeve white shirt, German, Jose and finally Samuel on the right in the salmon-coloured shirt. The group loan is for 81,000 Lempiras and they will use it to purchase fertilizer, manure and to pay for the cleaning of the coffee farm.

loans.use: to purchase manure, fungicides, fertilizers, and to cover labour costs for the maintenance of the coffee plantation

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 32 years old and lives in the town of Zana in the Kampala west region of Uganda. She is single and has 3 children who are all currently in school. For the past 15 years, Jane has been working hard to manage her produce business, which sells beans and g.nuts (Ugandan peanuts). 

To help expand her business, Jane has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to expand on her produce business and add more sacks of beans and rice for sale. This will help Jane to generate greater profits and improve her standard of living. Jane hopes that in the future she will be able to build rental houses. 

Jane is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Jane who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to expand on her produce business and add more sacks of beans and rice for sale

loans.name: Nidia De Fatima

texts.es:
Nidia de Fátima de cincuenta y uno años, madre soltera con un hijo, es originaria del Sauce, lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte del país. Nidia se caracteriza por ser una persona responsable, trabajadora, con ganas de superación personal. En sus ratos libre le gusta disfrutar de la compañía de su familia. Les prepara platos típicos de la región como “indio viejo” lamentablemente por falta de recursos económico no pudo cursar una carrera y se vio obligada a trabajar desde temprana edad para ayudar con los gastos del hogar.

Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica la elaboracion y venta de pinatas  ubicada en sus casas de habitación Ella dedica a su negocio unas 10 horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos.  Nidia agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan  a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de  trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Nidia de Fátima is 51 years old and a single mother with one child.  She is originally from El Sauce, a place that is located in the northern part of the country.  Nidia is known for being a responsible and hardworking person who wants to excel on a personal level.  In her free time she enjoys spending time with her family and preparing for them traditional dishes from the region known as “Indio Viejo”.  Unfortunately, due to the lack of financial resources, she was not able to study for a degree.  Therefore, she was obligated to work at an early age so that she could help with the household expenses.

Thanks to her efforts and her drive to succeed, Nidia earns her living by making and selling piñatas from her home.  She works at her business approximately 10 hours a day by offering her products.  In the not-so-distant future, she would like to generate more income.  Nidia is grateful for the assistance that the Kiva lenders offer to people who have limited resources and are from poor countries, such as Nicaragua, so that they have a way of making a decent living.

loans.use: to buy supplies for making piñatas and other products for children's parties.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy beverages and supplies

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en: Mwanajuma is appreciative of her previous loan that enabled her open a new M-PESA (moblie money transfer) shop. She is currently requesting for a loan of 50,000 KES to repair the broken chairs, windows, and desks in her classrooms. She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to repair the broken chairs,windows, and desks in her classrooms.

loans.name: Mamoun

texts.en: Mamoun was born in 1991. He lives with his family which consists of his parents, 3 sisters and 5 brothers at a sector in Jordan called Madaba. Mamoun has been working at a small supermarket for 4 years. He started his mini market business selling a small amount of foodstuffs. Then he expanded it over time. One of the obstacles he faces is not having experience of the business. Mamoun currently needs to buy new merchandise for his supermarket. But he doesn’t have enough money for it. For this reason, he applied for this youth loan.

loans.use: to buy more food products for his store.

loans.name: Katherin

texts.es:
Katherin esta soltera vive con su padre, ambos viven en anticretico en la ciudad de La Paz.

Ha sumado una nueva actividad a su venta de jugos, también vende productos Herbalife que ayudan a hacer dieta, respecto a su puesto de jugos, ella sigue preparándolos y vendiéndolos en la madrugada, el credito que solicita es para poder invertir en Herbalife y convertirse en una vendedora lider y de esta manera poder generar mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Katherin is single and lives with her father.  Both of them live in a rental property in the city of La Paz.

Katherin started a new business in addition to selling juices.  She also sells Herbalife products that help with dieting.  With regard to her juice stand, she continues to prepare and sell her products in the early morning hours.  

The loan she is requesting will be invested in Herbalife products so that she can become a top sales leader.  This will also help her to generate more income.

loans.use: to buy Herbalife diet products that she can sell.

loans.name: Zuhura

texts.en: Zuhura appreciates her previous Kiva loan that improved her living standards. She is requesting a loan of KES 50,000 to purchase onions, tomatoes, vegetables, and fruits for resale. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase onions, tomatoes, vegetables, and fruits for resale

loans.name: Kobah

texts.en:
Kobah is 48 years old and lives in the town of West Point. She is a widow and has three children between 12 and 22 years old; they all live with her and are attending school.

For 8 years now she has been selling used clothes in the local market. She sells from morning to afternoon time six days a week. She has a regular group of customers that visit her table for new used clothing items. She gives goods on credit to some customers and collects the money later; most interestingly she makes her own money. 

Kobah has requested a loan to purchase more used clothes. In the future, she wants to be her own boss and wants her children to live a good life. She thanks BRAC Liberia for their continuous support.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for sale

loans.name: Bendiciones De Jesus Group

texts.es:
Doña Esmeralda es una señora de 67 años de edad, está casada, tiene 8 hijos todos mayores de edad y ya se independizaron, y vive con su esposo en una colonia suburbana de Choloma Cortes. Tiene muchos años de dedicarse al comercio, principalmente a la compra y venta de productos alimenticios como carnes de todo tipo y lácteos como queso, mantequilla, crema y cuajada. Este negocio lo ha mejorado con la inversión de préstamos, ya tiene formada su clientela. Actualmente esta solicitando otro préstamo por 12,000.00 Lempiras para comprar más producto de carnes y lácteos para vender, ya que es su fuente de ingresos. Ella Tiene como meta cultivar palma africana para generar mas ingresos y tener una mejor vida familiar. 
Su préstamo es grupal, el grupo se llama Bendiciones de Jesús y se ha formado por cuatro personas, en la fotografía se identifican así: a la izquierda se encuentra doña Esmeralda, seguido esta Wilfredo, Glenda y María Victoria a la derecha , todos viven en la misma comunidad y se dedican al negocio de confección y venta de carnes, destazo de ganado para vender carne, venta de mercadería y venta de lácteos. el préstamo grupal es por 67,000 Lempiras y lo van a invertir en  la compra de carnes, reses, y lácteos para la venta.
texts.en:
Esmeralda is a 67 year old lady. She is married with eight adult children who are all independent and she lives with her husband in a suburban neighborhood of Choloma Cortes.

She has been working in commerce for many years, mostly in buying and selling food products such as all kinds of meat and dairy products such as cheese, butter, cream and cheese curd. This business has improved through loan investments and she has an established clientele. Currently she is seeking another loan of 12,000 lempiras in order to buy more meat and dairy products to sell, as this is her source of income. She has a goal of cultivating African palm fruit in order to generate more income and to have a better family life.

Her loan is part of a group. The group is called Bendiciones de Jesús and it has four members, identified in the photograph as follows: Esmeralda is on the left, next is Wilfredo, with Glenda and María Victoria to the right. They all live in the same community and all work in meat processing and sales, butchering beef, commodity sales, and dairy product sales. The group loan is for 67,000 lempiras and they will invest it the purchase of meat, cattle, and dairy products for sale.

loans.use: to buy meat and dairy products such as cheese, butter, cream, etc. to sell

loans.name: Rubenia

texts.es: Rubenia, tiene  34 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposo con quien tiene 4 hijos, y reside en el municipio de Arizona, Atlántida. Anteriormente solo se dedicaba a la venta de  ropa y hace 3 años decidió por vender también refrescos, churros, dulces, jugos y otras golosinas. El negocio lo tiene en su casa. Ha solicitado un préstamo por 5,000 Lempiras para surtir de refrescos, jugos, granos básicos y ropa para vender. Con esta inversión espera obtener mejores ganancias ya que tiene como meta terminar de darles el estudio a sus hijos y mantener su negocio activo y con las ganancias piensa hacerle mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Rubenia is 34 years old. She lives with her husband with whom she has four children, and lives in the municipality of Arizona, Atlántida.

Previously she only engaged in selling clothing but three years ago she decided to also sell soft drinks, churros, candy, juice and other snacks. Her business is home-based.

She is asking for a loan of 5,000 lempiras to purchase soft drinks, juices, basic grains, and clothes to sell.

With this investment she hopes to obtain better earnings as she has as a goal being able to continue paying children’s school fees and keeping her business active and with the earnings she is thinking of making some home improvements.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, juices, candy, and also clothing and basic grains to sell

loans.name: Saro

texts.en:
Saro is from Gyumri town, where he lives with his wife and daughter. 

Saro earns a living for his family by providing an electronics repair service. Over years of hard work, Saro was able to get clients due to his nice attitude toward people and the high quality service Saro is known for among locals.

Now, to purchase tools for repairing electronics Saro needs financial support. Saro has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. 

This loan is very important for Saro to be able to continue his business and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase tools for repairing electronics

loans.name: Khalida

texts.en:
Khalida was born in 1976. She is married and lives with her family, which consists of her husband and four sons and daughters, at a sector in Jordan called Southern Ghour. One of her daughters is married. Her husband is a governmental employee. 

Khalida has been working in sewing for seven months. She is doing great with her project. But she still needs to buy new fabrics and a sewing machine to raise her productivity and income to support her husband in covering their children's needs. But she currently doesn’t have enough money to buy them, so she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To buy new fabrics and a sewing machine

loans.name: Sameera

texts.en:
Sameera was born in 1964. She lives with her family, which consists of her parents, three sisters and five brothers at a sector in Jordan called Southern Ghour. One of her brothers is in the military. 

Sameera has been selling foodstuffs for six months; she started her project with a small amount of money. Then she started to expand it slowly. She is planning to rent a store to open a mini-market in the future. 

Now she needs to buy new merchandise of biscuits, chips, and candy with the hope of raising her sales. But she doesn't have enough money to buy them, so she applied for this loan.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs for her mini-market

loans.name: Phydilizah

texts.en:
Phydilizah is a widowed woman; she has three kids who attend school. They own a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Phydilizah has operated a retail shop for the past 15 years. She faces a major challenge of fluctuations in prices.

With the Kshs 50,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, soap, cooking oil, maize flour, beans, and sugar to sell. 

She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, soap, cooking oil, maize flour, beans, and sugar to sell

loans.name: Anita Lucia

texts.es:
La Señora. Anita es una socia amable y gentil que a diario lucha para mejorar la estabilidad económica de su hogar, forma parte desde hace 2 años del grupo de crédito Mujeres con Decisión, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es cuna de grandes artistas, deportista y artesanos, su centro histórico aun guarda su belleza colonial, su gente aun mantienen la cultura, tradiciones y la gastronomía de sus pueblos.

La Señora Anita tiene 55 años de edad, es una mujer casada y fruto de esa unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos mayores de edad, tres de ellos son casados y viven independientes, su hijo soltero estudia en la universidad y también se dedica a trabajar. Su esposo es de profesión fotógrafo, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de una de sus hijas.

Doña Anita es fotógrafa y su profesión la ejerce desde hace 27 años, le encanta su trabajo y fue su esposo el que le enseño esta actividad, trabaja todos los días sin un horario fijo. 

El dinero de su crédito va a invertir en la compra de una impresora digital de fotos.

Su meta es ampliar su estudio fotográfico.
texts.en:
Anita is a friendly and kind member.  She struggles daily in order to improve the financial stability of her household.  She has been part of the Mujeres con Decisión group for two years.  She lives in the city of Cuenca, which is the birthplace of great artists, athletes, and craftsmen.  Its historical center still maintains its colonial beauty.  Its people still maintain the cultures, traditions, and cuisine of its villages.

Anita, age 55, is married, and they have four adult children.  Three of them are married and live independently.  Her single son attends the university and also works.  Her husband is a photographer.  She does not have her own house, so she lives in the house of one of her daughters.

Anita is a photographer, and she has practiced this profession for 17 years.  She loves her work.  It was her husband who taught her this business activity.  She works every day without a fixed schedule.

She will use the loan to buy a digital printer for photos.  Her goal is to expand her photography studio.

loans.use: to buy a digital printer for photos.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 34 years old and lives in the town of Abala, in the Kampala west region of Uganda. He is single, and has two children who are currently in school. For the past 15 years, Joseph has been working hard to manage his welding shop, which sells metal doors. 

To help expand his business, Joseph has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more metal, and will help Joseph generate greater profits, to expand, and increase his stock. Joseph hopes that in the future, he will be able to buy more metal. 

Joseph is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Joseph who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more metal.

loans.name: Luka

texts.en:
Luka is 57 years old, married and blessed with five children.  Luka runs a posho mill business which he has run for nine years. Luka's current monthly income from the business is KES 10,000.

He is borrowing a loan of KES 70,000, with which he intends to buy stocks of maize as well as spare parts for the posho mill for purposes of maintenance. 

Luka plans to venture into another business with the anticipated profit. This is his second loan from KADET, after paying back his previous loan successfully.

loans.use: to buy more maize for his business.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane appreciates her previous kiva loan that improved her living standards.  She is requesting a loan of KES 67,460 to purchase onions, tomatoes, vegetables and potatoes for resale.  Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase onions, tomatoes, vegetables and potatoes for resale.

loans.name: Norma Elizabeth

texts.es:
La Señora Norma es una socia muy amable y participativa que forma parte del grupo de crédito Mujeres con Decisión, le gusta su grupo de crédito ya que todas son mujeres luchadoras, responsables y tienen un mismo objetivo el cual es mejorar su calidad de vida. Vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, cuna de grande artistas, deportista y artesanos, se encuentra bañada por 4 ríos, su centro histórico aun guarda su belleza colonial, su gente aun mantienen la cultura, tradiciones y la gastronomía de sus pueblos.

La Señora. Norma tiene 38 años de edad, está casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos de 18 y 10 años, su primer hijo ingresa a la universidad y su segundo hijo estudia en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo labora como empleado público, la casa es propia.

Doña Norma es una mujer emprendedora que está estudiando la carrera de nutrición y dietética que está cerca de culminar, pero para aportar a la economía de su hogar desde hace 2 años tiene un bazar. 

El dinero de su crédito va a invertir en la compra de artículos de bazar para incrementar la mercadería de su negocio. 

Su meta es culminar su carrera.
texts.en:
Norma is a very friendly and participatory member of the communal bank called Mujeres con Decisión. She likes the communal bank as they are all fighting women, responsible, and have the same objective of improving their quality of life. She lives in the city of Cuenca, cradle of great artists, athletes and artisans, bathed by four rivers. Its historic center keeps its colonial beauty and its people still keep their ancestral culture, traditions, and cuisine. 

Norma is 38 years old. She is married and through her marriage has 2 children of 18 and 10 years of age. Her oldest son is beginning university and her youngest son is in a little school in the city. Her husband works as a public employee. They own their home.

Norma is an enterprising woman who is studying for a nutrition and dietetics career and is close to completion, but to contribute to the household finances she has had a bazaar. The money from her loan will be invested to buy merchandise for her bazaar so she can stock her business. Her goal is to finish completing her studies.

loans.use: to buy merchandise in order to stock her bazaar.

loans.name: Ruth Esperanza

texts.es:
La Señora Ruth se encuentra en el banco comunal Mujeres con Decisión desde hace 9 años, le gusta los créditos porque le permiten mejorar su estabilidad económica, y al mismo tiempo puede crecer en su negocio. Vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es cuna de grande artistas, deportista y artesanos, se encuentra bañada por 4 ríos, su centro histórico aun guarda su belleza colonial, su gente aun mantienen la cultura, tradiciones y la gastronomía de sus pueblos.

La Señora Ruth tiene 39 años de edad, está casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 17, 14 y 8 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos están estudiando en el colegio y su ultimo hijo está en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo labora en una mecánica automotriz, la casa en la que viven es de su propia.

Doña Ruth trabaja de lunes a sábados en un local que venden ramos de flores para toda ocasión, esta en este trabajo desde hace algunos años. 

El dinero de su crédito va a  invertir en la compra de víveres en su hogar y para para pagar los estudios de sus hijos. 

Su sueño es tener su propio negocio en decoraciones de flores.
texts.en:
Ruth has been a member of the communal bank "Mujeres con Decisión" (Decisive Women) for nine years. She likes the loans because they allow her to improve her economic stability, and at the same time she can grow her businesses. She lives in the city of Cuenca. This city is the hub for great artists, sportsmen, and artisans. It is bathed by four rivers. Its historic center still maintains its colonial beauty. Its people still maintain their culture, traditions, and the gastronomy of their towns.

Ruth is 39, married, and in her marriage union has conceived three children, ages 17, 14, and 8. Her first two children are studying in high school and her last child studies in a little school in the city. Her husband works in an auto shop. They live in their own house.

Ruth works from Mondays to Saturdays in a shop that sells flower bouquets for all occasions. She has been doing this work for several years. She is going to invest the money from her loan in the purchase of food supplies for her home, and to pay for her children's studies. Her dream is to have her own business in flower decorations.

loans.use: to buy food supplies and pay for her children's studies

loans.name: Osan

texts.en:
Osan lives in Ijevan town with her husband, son, daughter-in-law, and little grandson. Jointly with her son, Osan has been engaged in a retail business for ten years. They purchase processed cheese from local farmers and sell it at the Yerevan town market. This cheese selling business is the only source of family's income, so they work hard to sell more and gather good income for the family. 

As they have no car, it is very difficult for them to bring cheese to Yerevan every day. The family's income doesn't allow them to purchase car, so Osan has applied for this loan. She needs this loan to pay customs clearance fees for the car which her husband sent from abroad. 

Osan has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. 

The loan is very important for Osan and her family so they have a car and can enlarge their family business.

loans.use: to pay for customs clearance fees for a car

loans.name: Majdi

texts.en: Majdi was born in 1990. He lives with his family, which consists of three brothers and his parents in a sector in Jordan called Southern Ghour. Majdi has been selling foodstuffs and cleaners for six months. He started his project with a small amount of money. Then he started to expand it slowly until he had his mini market. He is planning to add variety to his products and to expand his mini market by adding a freezer and other products in the future. Now he needs to buy new merchandise to increase his profit and income but he doesn't have enough money to buy it. For this reason, he has applied for this youth loan.

loans.use: to buy new foodstuff merchandise for his mini market.

loans.name: Taghreed

texts.en:
Born in 1986, Taghreed is married to an agricultural worker and has three children. She has been raising sheep and selling milk products for the past year, an enterprise she began with the purchase of a small quantity of sheep. 


Taghreed is planning to expand her business by buying more sheep and livestock in order to raise her productivity and income to better support her husband in covering their children's needs. For this reason, she has applied for this youth loan.

loans.use: to buy more sheep and livestock to increase her productivity

loans.name: Saiah

texts.en:
Saiah lives in West Point, one of the most populated and well-known markets in Montserrado county. A 45-year-old mother of four children between 11 and 26 years of age, two of whom are in school and live at home, she is married to a businessman. 


For the past three years Saiah has been frying and selling fish in her local market; she got money from her oldest sister to start this business. Saih is now requesting a loan to purchase more fish for her business. In the future she wishes to buy land and build her house.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for her business

loans.name: Sara Elizabeth

texts.es:
Sara es una joven de 23 años de edad,  estudio hasta el bachillerato. Después del bachillerato conoció al que ahora es su esposo  que trabaja en una planta de pollos de engorde, llevando registro de entradas y salidas y cuidando los pollos, dando cuido en galeras; ellos son padres de un niño de 8 mese de edad  y viven con los padres de Sara. 

 El año pasado, solicito un crédito a Kiva; para instalar una tienda en casa de sus padres, ya que la madre de ella tenia tienda anteriormente y les iba bien con el negocio; por que puso la tienda con el préstamo que se le dio; pero cuando tubo que dar a luz a su hijo la quito porque no había quien la atendiera y por la dieta ya no podía mas. ahora solo maneja la venta de recargas de saldo para celulares en su casa  y vende cosméticos de revistas. Siempre le gusto las actividades comerciales.  

Con el préstamo que ahora solicita, cancelara el saldo vigente del préstamo anterior  y con el resto iniciara un negocio que consiste en la venta de ropa para todas las edades ( esta la comprara en la capital, deberá viajar  unos 120km de ida y vuelta ya que la ropa en ese lugar es  mas barata),  venta de queso( este lo comprara en  una ciudad, a mayoristas que le dan buen precio y producto de buena  calidad) ,  mantendrá el negocio de la venta de las recargas para teléfonos celulares y la de los cosméticos de revista. Con el préstamo, se espera establecer económicamente , ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa . Por que ahora, que el niño esta pequeño los gastos son mas y serán mayores  y el sueldo de él no le cansaria y así poder vivir un poco; debido a que no quiere  cargar gastos a sus padres con los gastos de ellos.  

Sus proyectos,  son tener un negocio exitoso y bien establecido para  cubrir satisfactoriamente las cuotas del préstamo y empezar a construir su propia casa,   y que su hijo cresca y asista a la escuela, educarlo y hacer de él un hombre de provecho.
texts.en:
Sara is a young woman who is 23 years of age and studied through high school.  She met her husband after high school and he now works at a poultry plant.  He is in charge of taking care of the chickens and managing the coops.  Sara and her husband are the parents of an eight-month-old son.  They live with her parents.  

Sara requested a Kiva loan last year so that she could open a store in her parents’ home.  Her mother previously owned a store that did very well, which is the reason why she requested a loan.  After she gave birth to her son, Sara was not physically able to attend to a business.  For now, she is only able to sell rechargeable mobile phone cards from her house and also cosmetics through magazines.  She has always enjoyed working in retail businesses.

With the loan she is requesting now, Sara will pay the outstanding balance of her previous loan.  The rest will be used to start a business that consists of selling clothes for all ages.  In order to buy inventory, she will travel approximately 120 kilometers round trip since the place where she buys clothes sells them at a much cheaper price.  Sara will also sell cheese that she plans to purchase in the city since the wholesalers offer a quality product at a good price.  She will still maintain her business of selling rechargeable phone cards and cosmetics through magazines.  With this loan, she hopes to establish herself financially and help her husband with the household expenses.  Since her son is still young, her expenses are numerous and much higher.  Her husband’s salary cannot go any higher since he is already exhausted and they would like to live a little.  Sara also does not want to burden her parents with their expenses.  

Her goals include having a successful and well-established business so that she can successfully repay this loan and begin the construction of a house of her own.  When her son grows up, she wants him to attend school, get educated, and become a productive young man.

loans.use: to pay off an existing loan and to buy clothes, cheese, rechargeable phone cards, and cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Rosaura

texts.es:
La Señora Rosaura es muy amable y gentil que se encuentra realizando su cuarto crédito  a lado de sus amigas y compañeras del grupo de crédito María Reina de la Paz, le gusta este tipo de créditos porque en cada reunión comparte buenos momentos con sus compañeras y a su vez mejora su negocio. Vive en la ciudad de Cuenca lugar que goza de un clima frió, esta bañada por 4 ríos y cuenta con varios lugares para disfrutar de la naturaleza, su centro guarda celosamente su historia y su gente mantiene la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

La Señora. Rosaura tiene 53 años de edad, está casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 8 hijos, cuatro de ellos ya son casados y viven independientes, uno de sus hijos se dedica a trabajar y le ayudar económicamente, uno estudia en la universidad y sus dos últimos hijos estudian en un colegio de la ciudad. Su esposo labora en el área de la construcción como albañil, la casa en la que viven es propia.

Doña Rosaura a mas de dedicarse los quehaceres de su hogar labora diariamente en la venta ambulante de cosméticos y ropa por catalogo, también en sus tiempos libres se dedica a tejer a mano bufandas o chompas. 

El dinero de su crédito va a  invertir en la compra de ropa y cosméticos. 

Su meta es ampliar su casa.
texts.en:
Rosaura is very friendly and courteous. She is making her fourth loan alongside her friends and companions of the communal bank María Reina de la Paz. She likes this type of loan because at each meeting she shares good times with her companions and at the same time improves her business. She lives in the city of Cuenca, a place that enjoys a cool climate, is bathed by four rivers and has several places to enjoy nature, and which guards its history jealously, and its people maintain the culture and traditions of the past.

Rosaura is 53 years old. She is married and has eight children. Four of them are married and live independently, one of her children works and helps her financially, one studies at university, and the last two study at a school in the city. Her husband works in construction as a mason. They live in their own home.

Rosaura, besides doing the household chores, works as a traveling salesperson selling cosmetics and clothing from a catalog. In her free time she also works knitting scarves or sweaters. She is going to use the money from the loan to invest in the purchase of clothing and cosmetics. Her goal is to expand her home.

loans.use: to buy clothing and cosmetics

loans.name: Al-Esteglal Group

texts.en:
This group is named Al-Esteglal and consists of three women who live in Aden, Yemen. The women strive to provide for their families. They are applying for a loan of 170,000 YER from AMB. All of the members hope that this loan will improve their living standards.

Asteglal, 45, joined this group and is the group's leader. She is a married woman who works hard to provide for her eight children. She has been selling women's and children's clothing. Despite selling products, the money she earns is not enough to both cover household expenses and expand her business. Therefore, she is applying for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB to buy additional clothing to sell.

loans.use: to buy women's and children's clothes for her business

loans.name: Sophiah

texts.en:
Sophiah is a married woman, she has four children all of whom attend school. Sophiah owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Sophiah operates a vegetable stall business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other vegetable operators.
 
With the 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES), she wants to purchase bananas, sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, fruits and green vegetables for resale. She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase bananas, sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, fruits and green vegetables for resale

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 54 years old and married, and his wife supports the family, too. He is a carpenter and has been in business for ten years. Right now his monthly income is KES 10,000. Charles is borrowing a loan of KES 70,000, which he intends to use to purchase timber for selling.

With the anticipated profit, Charles plans to expand his business to a big timber store in order to increase his carpentry stock. This is his third loan, and he successfully repaid his previous loan.

loans.use: to purchase more timber.

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.es:
La Señora María se encuentra realizando su segundo crédito a lado de sus amigas y compañeras del grupo de crédito María Reina de la Paz. Vive en la ciudad de Cuenca lugar que goza de un clima frió, esta bañada por 4 ríos y cuenta con varios lugares para disfrutar de la naturaleza, su centro guarda celosamente su historia y su gente mantiene la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos. Le gusta este tipo de crédito por la solidaridad y la unión de todas sus socias.

La Señora María tiene 34 años de edad y es soltera, vive en compañía de sus padres con quienes comparte los gastos de su hogar, la casa en la que vive es de sus padres.

Doña María desde hace 4 años se dedica la venta de cosméticos y trabaja de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo, también se dedica a la costura ya que es una profesional. 

Su crédito va a invertir en la compra cosméticos.

Su meta es tener un local para vender bisutería y perfumería.
texts.en:
María is making her second loan alongside her friends and companions from the communal bank María Reina de la Paz. She likes this type of loan because of the solidarity and unity of all the members. She lives in the city of Cuenca, a place that enjoys a cool climate, is bathed by four rivers and has many places to enjoy nature. It guards its historical center jealously and its people keep the traditions of the past. 

María is 34 years old, single, and lives with her parents with whom she shares the household expenses. The house she lives in belongs to her parents.

María has been working selling cosmetics for four years and works from Sunday to Sunday without a fixed schedule. She also works as a professional seamstress.

She is going to invest her loan in the purchase of cosmetics. Her goal is to have her own facility where she can sell jewelry and perfume.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics for her business

loans.name: Muna

texts.en: Muna was born in 1978. She lives with her family, which consists of her parents and five siblings, at a sector in Jordan called Southern Ghour. Muna has been working to sell clothes for three years. She started her project selling a small quantity of clothes and she is planning to expand her project more in the future. Now she is asking for a loan to buy new merchandise that she doesn't have enough money for otherwise, in order to raise her profit and to help her family financially.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to trade

loans.name: Agripina

texts.en:
Agripina is a married woman; she has no children. Agripina lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Agripina has operated a vegetable stall business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other vegetable vendors in her business.
 
With the KSH 10,000, she wants to buy sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, onions, bananas, other fruits, and green vegetables for resale.

loans.use: to buy sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, onions, bananas, other fruits and green vegetables for resale

loans.name: Jacobo

texts.es: Desde hace más de 40 años Jacobo y su familia se han dedicado al campo y es la producción de café su mayor fuente de ingresos. Jacobo es socio de la “Unión Regional” desde hace 20 años y es allí a donde entrega toda su producción para que sea procesada y posteriormente exportada, por esa razón siempre está pendiente de que su café sea de la mejor calidad. Para esta cosecha necesita un crédito para realizar algunas labores de limpieza y para pagar a los cortadores que contratará para que le ayuden con el trabajo. Este crédito lo pagará al final de la cosecha. Con las ganancias que obtenga Jacobo tiene pensado invertir en un negocio de abarrotes para mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
For more than 40 years, Jacobo and his family have engaged in farm work and coffee production as their main source of income.  Jacobo has also been a member of Unión Regional de Huatusco for 20 years.  Since he is a member, all of the coffee he produces is transported for processing and eventual export.  For this reason, he is always mindful that his coffee must be of the best quality.  

For this crop season, Jacobo needs a loan so that he can pay for labor to handle a few cleanup and pruning jobs.  Therefore, he needs to hire laborers to help with the work.  This loan will be repaid at the end of the harvest.  With the profit he earns, Jacobo plans to invest it in a grocery business so that he can improve his income.

loans.use: to hire laborers to handle a few cleanup and pruning jobs on his coffee farm.

loans.name: Cristian Javier

texts.es: Cristian,  a sus 22 años de edad, es casado y padre de un hijo de 20 meses de nacido. Con el fin de adquirir ingresos por cuenta propia desea iniciar su propio negocio, en sociedad con su mejor amigo (ver foto) y aprovechar los conocimientos que tienen en administración y gastronomía. Montará un restaurante tipo gourmet express, idea que surgió de la necesidad de satisfacer los gustos y necesidades de las personas que transitan por la zona donde reside, para lograrlo ya cuenta con el local y requieren el apoyo del préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de activos fijos (nevera, horno, asador, instalar la cocina, ollas, cubiertos, vajilla, y otros utensilios de cocina), realizar adecuaciones en el local y comprar surtido al por mayor (verduras, carne, pastas, gaseosas) de esta forma podrá dar inicio a su proyecto de negocio con el ideal de conseguir clientes que hagan de su negocio un sitio reconocido por la calidad tanto de los alimentos,  como del servicio que ofrecerán. Cristian es consciente que para sacar su proyecto adelante debe trabajar con dedicación, disciplina y esmero, sólo así logrará hacer de su idea una empresa rentable que le genere buenos ingresos y le garantice una estabilidad económica para brindar a su familia un mejor bienestar y calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Cristian, 22, is married and the father of one 20-month-old son. With the purpose of acquiring an income on his own, he wishes to open up his own business, in partnership with his best friend (see photo), and take advantage of their knowledge of administration and gastronomy. 

He will put together a gourmet express type of restaurant, an idea that sprung from the need to satisfy the tastes and needs of the people who travel through the area where he lives. In order to achieve this, he has already obtained the store property and requires the support of a loan to invest in the purchase of fixed assets (fridge, oven, roaster, and for kitchen setup: pots, cutlery, tableware, and other kitchen utensils), to make adjustments to the premises, and to buy wholesale products (vegetables, meat, pasta, sodas). 

This way, he will be able to begin his business project, with the idea of obtaining clients that help make his business site recognized as much for the quality of its food as for the service it offers. Cristian knows that to succeed with this project, he must work with dedication, discipline and care. Only then will he make his idea a profitable business that generates a good income for him and guarantees him economic stability to offer his family a better quality of life and well-being.

loans.use: To buy fixed assets (fridge, oven, roaster, and for kitchen setup: pots, cutlery, tableware, and other kitchen utensils), to make adjustments to the premises, and to buy wholesale products (vegetables, meat, pasta, sodas).

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.es: Magdalena, de 26 años es una mujer sencilla. Vive en compañía de su esposo y su hijo a los que cuida en la casa de sus padres. Cuando conformó su familia se inicio en el negocio de la agricultura, afirma que le va muy bien pues gracias a sus padres, pudo aprender lo necesario en el cultivo y fertilización, además le heredaron los terrenos donde hoy siembra, comenta que en un inicio le fue muy difícil comenzar con el capital económico pero poco a poco aprendió a mejorar y eso le gusta pues ahora se siente orgullosa de ello. Desea abono orgánico para sus sembríos pues dentro de poco comenzará la temporada de cosecha. Este es su segundo crédito con kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, por lo que promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Magdalena, invertirá los S/.500 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Magdalena, 26, is a simple woman. She lives with her husband and son, who she takes care of in her parents' house. When she formed her family, she started in the agricultural business. She states that it is going well for her because, thanks to her parents, she was able to learn what was necessary to cultivate and fertilize crops. She also inherited the land she sows today. 

She states that in the beginning it was very difficult for her to start with little economic capital, but little by little, she learned to improve and she enjoys this, since now she feels proud of it. She needs organic compost for her crops because soon the harvest season will begin. 

This is her second loan with Kiva and she is thankful for the financial support that she has received in order to get ahead, which is why she promises to be punctual with her loan payments. Magdalena will invest the 500 soles in the purchase of organic compost to nourish her crops.

loans.use: to buy organic compost

loans.name: Rosebella

texts.en:
Rosebella is 54 years old and married to Peter. They have been blessed with six children, and she supports only one, who is 14 years old. 

She is a dairy farmer. She has been in business for 30 years, and now her monthly income from the business is KES 8,000. She is borrowing a loan of KES 60,000, with which she intends to purchase one dairy cow. This is her sixth loan after successfully repaying her previous loans.

loans.use: to buy one dairy cow.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty appreciates her previous Kiva loan, which improved her living standards.  She is requesting a loan of KSH 35,000 to buy onions, tomatoes, other vegetables, and potatoes for resale.

Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy onions, tomatoes, other vegetables, and potatoes for resale

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 45 years old and married to Hannah. They have four children, who are in school. He has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru for ten years.

Now, Daniel has applied for a fifth loan from KADET. He will use the loan to purchase fertilizer and seeds, and to pay labourers for help with the farming. With the anticipated profit, Daniel hopes to pay school fees and to make some savings.

In the near future, Daniel hopes to start a large-scale farming operation with accumulated profits.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seeds, and to pay labourers for help

loans.name: Maria Esperanza

texts.es: María Esperanza de 45 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo y sus tres hijos de 6, 10 y 18 años. Se gana la vida lavando ropa ajena quienes le pagan por esa labor. Su esposo trabaja como auxiliar en la construcción y juntos hacen frente a los gastos y sustento para sus hijos. María desea cambiar el material del techo de su humilde vivienda pues el que tiene esta deteriorado, enmohecido y picado es por esa razón que adquirió un préstamo con FUSAI para la reparación y compra de lamina galvanizada, tuercas y pines. Más adelante está dispuesta a seguir mejorando su vivienda para que sus hijos estén más seguros dentro de ella.
texts.en:
María Esperanza is 45 years old and lives with her husband and their three children (ages 6, 10, and 18).  She earns her living by washing clothes for other people who are willing to pay her to do this type of work.  Her husband works as a construction assistant and together they are able pay the expenses and support their children.  

María wants to replace the roof materials of her modest home, which has deteriorated, rusted, and is full of holes.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan from FUSAI in order to pay for repairs and to buy galvanized sheets, screws, and bolts.  Going forward, she is willing to continue the improvements to her house so that her children will have a safer place in which to live.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for repairing the roof of her house.

loans.name: Gladys Teresa

texts.es:
La Señora. Gladis forma parte del grupo de crédito María Reina de la Paz. Vive en la ciudad de Cuenca lugar que goza de un clima frió, esta bañada por 4 ríos y cuenta con varios lugares para disfrutar de la naturaleza, su centro guarda celosamente su historia y su gente mantiene la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

La Señora Gladys tiene 42 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 19, 15 y 10 años de edad, su primera hija está estudiando en la universidad, su segundo hijo en el colegio y su última hija estudia en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo es de profesión Ingeniero en minería y labora en esta actividad, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

Doña Gladys se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace algunos años, este trabajo le ha permitido mejorar la economía de su casa y el bienestar de su familia. 

Su crédito anterior lo invirtió en la compra de mercadería de la cual obtuvo buenas ganancias, está repitiendo su crédito para compra ropa de moda  para su clientela. Su grupo de crédito le gusta por la solidaridad, unión y compañerismo que existe dentro de su grupo.
texts.en:
Gladys is part of the credit group María Reina de la Paz. She lives in the city of Cuenca, a place that enjoys a cold climate and is bathed by 4 rivers. Cuenca has several places to enjoy nature, and its center zealously holds its history. The people maintain the culture and traditions of their villages. 

Gladys is 42 years old, married, and the fruit of her union are three chidren, ages 19, 15, and 10 years old. Her first daughter is studying at the university, her second son is in high school, and her last daughter studies at a small school in the city. Gladys's husband is a mining engineer. They do not have have they're own home, but are renting. 

Gladys has been selling clothes for some years, and this job has allowed her to improve the economy of the household and the well being of her family. 

She invested her previous loan to purchase merchandise, from which she earned good profits, and she is repeating the loan to buy fashionable clothes for her clients. She likes her borrowing group because of the solidarity, unity and fellowship that exists within it.

loans.use: buy clothes.

loans.name: Sophiko

texts.en:
Sophiko is 35 years old and a married woman, from Vani district. She lives with her husband and four children. The family is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have a milking cow and a calf. She milks the cow every day and produces dairy products for sale. In addition, they have a plot of agricultural land, where they have 300 nut trees. They sell the harvested nuts at a good price. As the income is only seasonal and is not enough for covering the expenses, Sophiko decided to start her own business and seek for credit among local financial institutions. Her attempts were unsuccessful because of her poor living conditions.

The startup loan program, a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables rural poor and inexperienced people to get a loan for starting or re-starting businesses. Sophiko's application was approved under the framework of this program, to get a loan of 800 GEL. With the received credit, she will start trading in clothing. Sophiko plans to go to Turkey and purchase clothing at wholesale prices, and then resell the goods at higher prices among her fellow villagers. This will increase the income of her family. With increased income, she will be able to improve the living conditions for her children.

loans.use: to begin a clothing sales business

loans.name: Janepher

texts.en:
Janepher, a single woman with five children, all of whom attend school, owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.


For the past seven years, Janepher has operated a business selling fruits such as bananas to passersby. She faces the challenge of seasonality.


With this Kshs 30,000 loan, she will purchase bananas and packets of sweets. Janepher decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bananas and packets of sweets

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Meet 38-year-old Fatmata from Torkpoitown in Sierra Leone. She is married, with three children between 5 years and 13 years. Two of her children are currently attending school. 

In 2008, Fatmata established her clothing business. She began her business because she needs to create her own source of income, instead of her family depending on her husband alone. She works at the business 10 hours per day and seven days per week.  She says that the main challenge to her business is price inflation.  

Fatmata requires a loan to buy more lace material and wax cotton to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and pay her children's school fees. 

In the future, Fatmata plans to open a shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more lace material and wax cotton to expand her business.

loans.name: Comfort's Group

texts.en:
Florence represents this group of three women. Combined, they sell wax prints, bed sheets, dippers, powder, underwear, and smoked fish. The group is requesting a total of GHS 1,900 to improve their businesses.

Florence is 47 years old and a single mother of three children. She divides her day between business and family. For the past four years, she has been selling dippers, underwear, and powder.  

Florence is a very responsible and hardworking person. She hopes to continue to combine work and family. She is applying for a loan of GHS 700 to purchase dippers, underwear, and powder to sell to customers. She is grateful to receive a loan and determined to meet her repayment schedule. She has successfully repaid her two previous loans.

loans.use: to purchase dippers, underwear, and powder to sell

loans.name: Khadiga

texts.en:
Khadiga is 45 years old, and she lives in Hodeidah. She is a hardworking person who has gone through many adversities in her life. For this reason, she has always had great strength that has allowed her to get ahead. She is a seamstress, who trained in a small association for this work. Her business provides her with a source of household income and support.

Because her work is recognized as being of good quality, she would like to increase her profit. For this reason, she is requesting a loan of 50,000 YER, which she will use to purchase sewing items so as to develop her business. Her dream is to be able to improve her household financial situation.

loans.use: to purchase sewing supplies, so as to develop her business.

loans.name: Melquelidec

texts.es:
Melquelidec, es un hombre  de 34 años de edad, estudio hasta 1 grado,  no pudo seguir por la situación económica de sus padres. Esta acompañado, su pareja realiza oficios domésticos y tienen dos hijas de 4 y 1 año de edad. El cliente tiene la responsabilidad de mantener a su familia.

Él es agricultor y se ha dedicado desde muy pequeño, ya que su padre lo llevaba a trabajar con él. Para llegar al lugar donde realiza las labores agrícolas tiene que caminar aproximadamente 30 minutos, cuando termina el trabaja cuidando ganado de manera temporal. Su horario de trabajo varia se va temprano a las 6 regresa como a las 11 a casa y en la tarde se va tipo 2 a 4 pm.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar abono y fertilizantes para tener una mejor producción y así tener buenas ganancias para suplir las necesidades básicas del hogar.

Espera que sus hijas vayan a la escuela y se preparen para que en un futuro puedan valerse por sí solas. Planea construir una casa propia para tener una mejor estabilidad y que las hijas crezcan en ambiente mejor.
texts.en:
Melquelidec is 34 years old and is in a relationship. He says he completed first grade but was not able to stay in school because of his parents’ economic situation. His partner does domestic work, and together they have two daughters, ages 1 and 4. He says it is his responsibility to support his family.

Melquelidec has worked in agriculture since he was very young. He says his father used to bring him to work with him when he was a child. Melquelidec says that to reach the area where he farms he has to walk about 30 minutes. When he finishes his agricultural work, he also looks after livestock on a seasonal basis. He says his hours vary. He leaves at 6 in the morning and returns home at 11. He then returns to work in the afternoon, usually between 2 and 4pm.
 
Melquelidec is requesting this loan to buy manure and fertilizer to improve his crop yield and have better profits to meet the basic needs of his family. He hopes that his children will go to school so that they can learn to support themselves in the future. He plans to build his own house to have more stability and so that his daughters can grow up in a better environment.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizers.

loans.name: Jackeline

texts.es: Jackeline, de 29 años, tiene 2 hijos con quienes vive en una casa alquilada. Ella posee terrenos propios que se ubican a 2 horas de caminata de su localidad, por esa razón alquiló otros terrenos agrícolas, donde pueda sembrar mayor cantidad de alimentos como: papa, maíz y alverja. Sus 3 años de experiencia en la venta de sus sembríos en la feria de Pampas, le ayudan a obtener las ganancias que le sirven para alimentar y educar a sus hijos. Le gusta mucho su trabajo, pues disfruta del campo y poder vivir ahí. Más le disgusta cuando los precios bajan en el mercado, “a veces es inestable, los precios de las cosechas en el mercado”, afirma. Pero hace menos de un año emprendió el negocio de venta de accesorios para mototaxis, como también en un pequeño taller mecánico para estos vehículos, espera poder emprender este nuevo reto. Este es su segundo crédito con kiva, en todo este tiempo obtuvo el dinero necesario para invertir en el desarrollo de su negocio, por lo que promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Jackeline, invertirá los S/.1500 en la compra de llantas y repuestos para su taller.
texts.en:
Jackeline, age 29, has 2 children who live with her in a rented house. She owns her own land located a 2-hour walk from where she lives, so she also rents additional agricultural land where she can plant a greater quantity of food crops, such as potatoes, corn and peas. Her 3 years of experience selling her harvest at the market in Pampas has hrelped her to make the money she needs to feed and see to the education of her children. She loves her work, enjoying the countryside and the ability to live there. What she finds most difficult, though, is when the prices drop in the market. "Sometimes it's unstable, the prices for my crops at the market," she says. 

However, less than a year ago, she launched a new business selling accessories for mototaxis and operating a small mechanics workshop for the vehicles. She is hopeful that she will be able to undertake this new challenge. This will be her second Kiva credit, and she has always had the money she needs to invest in her business so she can promise to be punctual with her payments. Jackeline will invest the 1,500 Soles [PEN] in tires and car parts for her workshop.

loans.use: to buy tires and car parts for her workshop.

loans.name: Maxima

texts.es:
Maxima, de 43 años es una mujer tímida y vive en compañía de su esposo David y sus 3 hijos a los que cuida en su casa propia. Desde niña trabajó sin descanso, ahora agradece esa enseñanza pues puede mantener a su familia con la siembra de productos de primera necesidad como papa, maíz y demás alimentos. Afirma además que tiene animales que le ayudan a mejorar sus ingresos. Hace poco adquirió su casa, pues ella vive en un lugar lejano a 2 horas de viaje, ahora solo siembra cerca del pueblo y puede brindar a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida.  Ahora desea mejorar su siembra con fertilizante natural para obtener buenos ingresos.
Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “nuevo amanecer” y este es el segundo crédito con kiva, en todo este tiempo obtuvo el dinero necesario para invertir en el desarrollo de su negocio, por lo que promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Maxima, invertirá los S/.1000 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Maxima, 43, is a timid woman who lives with her husband, David, and their three children, who she takes care of in her own home. Since she was a girl, she has worked without rest. Now she is thankful for those lessons since she can support her family by sowing staple products such as potatoes, corn, and other foods. She also states that she has animals that help her to improve her income. 

She acquired her house recently, since she was living in a remote location (a two hour trip away), now she only sows near the town and she can provide her children with a better quality of life. She now wishes to improve her sowing with natural fertilizer to obtain a good income. 

She belongs to the solidarity group "Nuevo Amanecer" (New Dawn), and this is her second loan with Kiva. During this time she has obtained the money necessary to invest in the development of her business, which is why she promises to be punctual with her loan payments. Maxima will invest the 1000 soles in the purchase of organic compost to nourish her crops.

loans.use: to buy organic compost

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a married woman. She has one child, who goes to school. She lives in a rented house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, she has operated a food market business, selling potatoes, rice, and bananas. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the loan that she is requesting, she wants to purchase a stock of wheat flour, bananas, potatoes, and beans. She decided to join Yehu to access loans, to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase foods to sell at the market, including a stock of wheat flour, bananas, and beans

loans.name: Iye

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 33-year-old Iye from Kandehtown town, Bo. She is married with three children between the ages of 9 months and 12 years. Two of her children are currently attending school. She began this business because she wants to contribute in the home to support the children. 

Iye runs a general stock business; she sells soft drinks, biscuits and bread. She has been running this business for seven years. She works at the business throughout the week and for ten hours per day.  Iye says that sometimes business is very difficult.

Iye has requested a loan in order to purchase soft drinks, biscuits and pure water for resale.
