The extra income from this loan will allow her to pay her children’s school fees and increase her business. In the future, she plans to expand her enterprise more than ever. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, biscuits and pure water for resale.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 30-year-old Lucy from Kandeh town, Bo. She is married with three children between the ages of 7 months and 14 years. Two of her children are currently attending school. 

Lucy runs a food stand; she sells rice, oil and cooking seasoning. She has been running this business for five years. She works at the business throughout the week and for ten hours per day.  Lucy says that her business is doing well.

Lucy has requested a loan in order to purchase cooking seasoning, rice and provisions for resale. The extra income from this loan will allow her to repay her loan and increase her business. 

In the future, she plans to expand her enterprise more than ever. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase cooking seasoning, rice and provisions for resale.

loans.name: Yasin

texts.en:
Yasin was born in 1982. He is married and lives with his wife in Karak, Jordan. His wife is a government employee. 

Yasin has been selling clothing for the past year. He started his business with a small amount of money and has been expanding it slowly. He has faced a problem with marketing. Currently, he is applying for a loan to purchase new children's products in order to raise his profit and income.

loans.use: to buy new clothes

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha is 20 years old and lives in the town of Seeta, in the Mukono region of Uganda. She has no children yet. For the past four years, Aisha has been working hard to manage her boutique shop, where she sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Aisha has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to increase her purchase of clothes to sell. This will help Aisha to generate greater profits and take good care of herself and her siblings. Aisha hopes that in the future, she will be able to expand the business. 

Aisha is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to increase her purchase of clothes to sell

loans.name: Umu

texts.en: Greetings from Sierra Leone! Umu is 35 years old and lives in Moriba town. She is married and the mother of two children who are three and ten years old. Both children attend school. Umu earns a living by selling palm oil, nut oil and beans. She has been running this business for eight years and works 10 hours per day and 7 days per week. Her business is doing well and she is requesting this loan to buy more palm oil to sell as well as gari, a carbohydrate made from cassava. She will use the extra income from this loan to feed her children and expand her business. In the future, she hopes to export her goods. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy food items, including palm oil, to sell.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 33-year-old Juliet from Kandetown, Bo. She is married with three children between the ages of 6 and 12 years. Two of her children are currently attending school. She began this business because she wants to help her husband develop her home.

Juliet runs a general stock business; she sells soft drinks, biscuits and sweets. She has been running this business for 15 years. She works at the business throughout the week and for ten hours per day. Juliet says that her business is doing well.

Juliet has requested a loan in order to purchase soft drinks, biscuits and sweets for resale. The extra income from this loan will allow her to pay her children’s school fees and increase her business. 

In the future, she plans to expand her enterprise more than ever. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, biscuits and sweets for resale.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 40-year-old Hawa from Moriba town, Bo. She is married with 5 children. Her children are currently attending school. 

Hawa runs a food stand. She sells rice, pepper and cooking seasoning. She has been running this business for 16 years. She works at the business throughout the week and 10 hours per day. Hawa says that sometimes business is very difficult.

Hawa has requested a loan in order to purchase cooking seasoning, rice, and oil for resale. The extra income from this loan will allow her to repay her loan and increase her business. 

In the future, she plans to expand her enterprise more than even. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase cooking seasoning, rice, and oil for resale.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en: Meet 30-year-old Aminata from Moribatown, Sierra Leone. She is the mother of one child who is a year old. She went into the business of selling plastic slippers in 2008 to earn enough money to survive. She works at her business 10 hours per day and seven days per week, and says that her main challenge is price inflation. Aminata is requesting this loan to buy more plastic slippers to sell so that she can expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to meet this goal as well as pay her child's school fees. In the future, Aminata plans to open a shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more plastic slippers to sell.

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.es: Fortunata, de 64 años es una mujer trabajadora. Habita en la casa que heredó de su madre al lado de su esposo y uno de sus hijos. Fortunata se dirige todas las mañanas a sus terrenos agrícolas, ya tiene 5 años de experiencia en la siembra de productos, como maíz, papa y cebada, los que comercializan en la ciudad de Pampas, durante la feria de los días domingos. Sus terrenos agrícolas, son propios, pues durante todo estos años de trabajo duro, pudieron ahorrar lo necesario para tener una vejes segura. “Me gusta sembrar, es todo lo que aprendí desde pequeña, mis padres me enseñaron a trabajar la tierra y vivir de ella”, afirma. Es por esa razón que desean mejorar sus sembríos y continuar con las fuerzas para seguir sembrando.Este es su segundo crédito con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Fortunata, invertirá los S/.500 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para esparcir entre sus sembríos de maíz.
texts.en:
Fortunata, age 64, is a hardworking woman. She lives in the house she inherited from her mother, along with her husband and one of their children. Every morning, Fortunata heads to her fields, where she has over 5 years experience planting crops such as corn, potatoes, and barley. She sells her harvest in the city of Pampas, at the Sunday market. She owns her fields free and clear, so through the years she has been able to save toward providing a decent retirement. "I like to plant. It's all I've learned since I was little, when my parents taught me to work the land and live off it," she says. 

This is why she would like to improve her fields and continue planting. This is her second Kiva credit and she feels grateful for the financial assistance that she has received to help her keep on going. She is committed to making her payment in a timely fashion. Fortunata will invest the 500 Soles [PEN] in buying organic fertilizer to spread between her corn crops.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Robiya

texts.ru: Милая женщина из замечательного городка Гисара – Робия. Ей 54 года. Про таких женщин говорят «Знает, чего хочет и добивается своего без изъяна». Это и вправду так. Она, однажды поставив перед собой цель: открыть свою собственную фирму по животноводству, решила действовать. И вот уже 10 лет как она занимается выращиванием крупнорогатого скота. Ей всегда помогают ее любящий муж, дети и невестки. Ухаживать за скотом она еще научилась до замужества в доме своих родителей. И посей день, ей нравится заниматься этим делом. Робия просит кредит для увеличения поголовья скота. В будущем она думает расширить свой бизнес.
texts.en: This is a kind 54 year old woman from the wonderful little town of Gissar.  There is a saying about women like her that "she knows what she wants and goes after it flawlessly."  This is true about Robiya.  Once she set a goal of opening her own business in animal husbandry.  She acted upon her goal and now, 10 years later, she is still raising large cattle.  She is always helped by her loving husband, her children and daughters-in-law.  She learned how to take care of cattle when she still lived with her parents before she was even married.  To this day, she loves being in this line of work.  Robiya is requesting a loan in order to increase the size of her herd.  She plans to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy two cows

loans.name: Hafeetha

texts.en:
Hafeetha was born in 1960. She is married and has four children. Her husband works as a driver. 

Hafeetha has been sewing and doing embroidery for five years. She is planning to expand her business in the future. She needs a loan to buy fabric and raw materials.

loans.use: to buy more thread and fabric

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 32-year-old Marie from Kandeh town, Bo. She is married with four children between the ages of 6 and 15 years. Three of her children are currently attending school. 

Marie runs a food stand; she sells rice, pepper and cooking seasoning. She has been running this business for ten years. She works at the business throughout the week and for ten hours per day. Marie says that her business is doing well.

Marie has requested a loan in order to purchase cooking seasoning, rice and oil for resale. The extra income from this loan will allow her to repay her loan and increase her business. 

In the future, she plans to expand her enterprise more than ever. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase cooking seasoning, rice and oil for resale.

loans.name: Duba

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! She is 45-year-old Duba from Moriba town Bo. She is married with 3 children between the ages of 12 and 18 years old. Her children are attending school. 

Duba runs a palm oil business. She sells palm oil, nut oil, and beans. She has been running this business for 8 years. She works at the business 10 hours per day and 7 days per week. Duba says that the main challenges to her business are high competition in the palm oil business and transportation problems.

Duba has requested a loan in order to purchase food items including a gallon of palm oil and gari. The extra income from this loan will allow her to feed her children and increase her business. In the future, she hopes to export her goods. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase food items including a gallon of palm oil and gari.

loans.name: Aisee

texts.en:
Aisee is 36 years old and lives in West Point. She is married and has three children between eight and sixteen years old. Her husband is a machinist. 

For the past ten years, Aisee has been selling fish from a table in the local market. She sells from Monday to Saturday, working nine hours each day. One problem she faces is rainy season. 

Aisee is requesting a loan to purchase fish for her business. She likes her business because of the way people respond to it. Her plan is to buy a piece of land and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase fish for her business

loans.name: Ciatta

texts.en: Ciatta lives in the town of West Point, and is 37 years old, married and the mother of three children who are ages 8, 17, and 20. For two years now she has earned a living by selling ice in the market. She started this business with financial help from her husband, and learned the trade from her mother. She likes her work because she makes a profit, and is requesting a loan to buy more ice to sell. Her goal for the future is to build house for her children to live in, and to be able to afford to send them to school.

loans.use: to buy ice for her business,

loans.name: Fatu

texts.en:
Fatu lives in West Point, Montserrado County, the capital city of Liberia, which is well known as the largest commercial city of Liberia. She is 35 years old and is married with two children, ages 5 and 10. They are in school and live at home.

For the past several years now, Fatu has been selling rice in the market. She started this with money given to her by her husband, and learned this way of selling from her mother. She enjoys the way customers respond to her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice for her business. In the future, she wants to become an international businesswoman.

loans.use: to purchase more rice for her business.

loans.name: Alduvar

texts.es:
El señor Alduvar es una persona muy trabajadora, humilde  y responsable vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto a su familia,  se dedica a la sastrería y venta de refrescos.
Don Alduvar tiene su negocio desde hace 15 años, tiene su negocio en su casa de habitación en el municipio donde vive. Necesita el préstamo para la compra de telas, hilos y refrescos que es su otro negocio.
Don Alduvar con el préstamo espera que sus ventas aumenten y que este le sirva de mucho ya que no cuenta con los productos que ahora le exigen sus clientes para cubrir los pedidos solicitados.
Don Alduvar espera que gracias al préstamo poder mejorar la calidad de vida de la familia con el aumento de los ingresos en el hogar, espera en un corto plazo hacer crecer su negocio y  con esto poder seguir apoyando a su familia y que  tengan una vida mejor.





Choluteca, Honduras – Agosto del  2013
texts.en:
Alduvar is a very hard-working, humble and responsible person, who lives with his family in a community in the south of Honduras. He is a tailor and sells soft drinks. Alduvar has done this for the past fifteen years. He works out of his house in the municipality where he lives. 

Alduvar needs this loan to buy cloth and thread and then soft drinks which is his other business. Alduvar hopes that with the loan his sales will increase. The loan will be very useful as he does not have a lot of the products that his customers are asking for. 

Alduvar hopes that thanks to this loan he can improve his family's quality of life with more money coming into the household. In the short term he wants to expand his business and through this continue to support his family and that they enjoy a better life.

Choluteca, Honduras – August 2013.

loans.use: to buy cloth, thread and soft drinks for his businesses.

loans.name: Ciro

texts.es:
Ciro, habita en una casa alquilada junto a su esposa e hijos, a los que quiere mucho. El trabajo al que se dedica este noble hombre es la venta de animales menores en la fería que se desarrolla en su localidad, comenta que gracias a ello puede obtener el dinero para los gastos familiares, pero como es un hombre trabajador también se dedica al trabajo de albañilería en su s tiempos libres, como a la agricultura los fines de semana en su pueblo. “Comencé en este negocio de la compra y venta de animales por mis hijos, pues ellos necesitan de una mejor calidad de estudio, por eso me establecí con una casa alquilada, ahora estoy ahorrando para comprar mi casa propia”, menciona.Este es su primer crédito con kiva, y se siente agradecido por el apoyo que recibe para seguir adelante, por lo que promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.
Ciro, invertirá los S/.1000 soles en la compra de animales menores como ovejas y cerdos para su venta.
texts.en:
Ciro lives in a rented house together with his wife and children, whom he loves very much. He works selling small farm animals in the livestock market that is held in the town. He says that thanks to this he is able to earn money for his family’s expenses.  Ciro says that he is a hard-working man who also does masonry work in his free time and agricultural work on the weekends in his village. He says, “I started in this business of selling and buying animals for my children because they need a better education. I settled down in a rented house, and now I am saving to buy my own house.”

This is Ciro’s first Kiva loan. He says he is grateful for the support to get ahead, and he promises to make his payments on time. Ciro will use the 1000 PEN to buy small animals to sell such as sheep and pigs

loans.use: to buy sheep and pigs.

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith is a married woman. She has three children, all of whom attend school. Edith owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest  monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Edith operates a vegetable stall from her home. She sells produce to her neighbors and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other vendors. She joined Yehu to get financial support. She will use the Kshs 20,000 to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, fruits, and green vegetables for resale.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes, potatoes, fruits, and green vegetables for resale

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria lives in West Point. She is 42 years old. She is married, and her husband is a businessman, and they have five children between 11 and 22 years old. 

For four years now, she has been operating a cook shop (restaurant) in her community. She received a little amount from her husband to start her business, and learned it from her mother. She likes her business because she makes more profit.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more bonnie fish, spare ribs, rice, coal, and pig feet for her business. Her plan is to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more bonnie fish, spare ribs, rice, coal and pig feet for her business.

loans.name: Hajah

texts.en:
Hajah lives in West Point. She is 38 years old, married, and has eight children between 3 and 22 years old.  

For eight years now, she has been selling soft drinks in the market. She received a little amount from her husband to start her business, and learned it from her mother. 

She likes her business because it helps her feed her children. She is requesting a loan to purchase more soft drinks for her business. 

Her plan is to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks for her business.

loans.name: Richeal

texts.en: Richeal lives in West Point. She is 49 years old, married, and has five children between 10 and 30 years old. Only three of her children are in school. For three years now Racheal has been selling dried fish in her community market. She received a little amount of money from her husband to start her business, and learned selling from her mother. She likes her business because she makes a profit. She is requesting a loan to purchase more dried fish for her business. Her plan is to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more dried fish for her business.

loans.name: Tenneh

texts.en: Tenneh lives in West Point. She is 35 years old, married, and they have two children, ages 6 and 10. Her husband is with an NGO (non-governmental organization). For the past five years now Tenneh has been selling used clothes. She received a little amount of money from her husband to start her business, and learned selling from her mother. She likes her business because she makes a profit. Tenneh is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes for her business. Her plan is to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Orlando

texts.en:
Orlando has always been an innovative farmer in his small, Tlaxcalan village. He is investing in a 6-cubic-meter Sistema Biobolsa digester for use on his farm to take advantage of the animal waste produced on-site. With the digester, he will convert the waste to produce potent biofertilizer and methane-rich biogas, concurrently saving money and reducing his farm's impact on the environment. 

He was convinced so thoroughly by the technology after he saw it in use, that he's buying a second system of the same size for his son. This loan represents 48% of the total cost of the two Sistema Biobolsa biodigesters.

loans.use: to purchase two 6-cubic-meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigesters.

loans.name: Sobeima Inés

texts.es: Sobeima tiene 47 años de edad y es madre de 2 hijos. Hace 22 años, con el propósito de generar ingresos para sustentar las necesidades de su familia, ella comenzó a preparar y vender regrigerios, aprovechando los conocimientos que había adquirido en diversos cursos que realizó en el Sena; de esta manera ha generado los recursos suficientes para sacar a sus hijos adelante y darles el sustento diario. Actualmente ofrece desayunos, almuerzos, cenas, helados y refrigerios ya que poco a poco fue ampliando su portafolio; trabaja sola, de 7:00 am a 4:00 pm y la principal ventaja es la ubicación en la que se encuentra pues hay gran afluencia de personas. La cliente es una mujer luchadora, pujante, activa y creativa, solicita el apoyo del crédito para invertirlo en la compra de un enfriador, una máquina para hacer crema chantilly, copas de cristal, insumos al por mayor (helados, salsas dulces, verduras, carnes) y hacer publicidad, de esta forma podrá darle continuidad a su negocio y atraer más clientes, lo que le permitirá aumentar sus ingresos, con los cuales podrá avanzar hacia el cumplimiento de su principal meta que es adquirir un local propio en el que pueda continuar con su labor y hacer de su establecimiento una buena fuente de ingresos, que sea rentable y que le garantice una estabilidad económica para poder ofrecer a sus hijos una mejor educación y bienestar, además de mejorar la calidad de vida para toda la familia.
texts.en:
Sobeima is 47 years old and is the mother of two children. 22 years ago, with the purpose of generating income to meet the needs of her family, she began preparing and selling refreshments, taking advantage of the knowledge she had acquired in a variety of courses she completed at the Sena. 

In this way, Sobeima has generated enough resources to get her children ahead and to give them their daily meals. Currently she offers breakfasts, lunches, dinners, ice cream and snacks, little by little growing her portfolio. 

Sobeima works alone, from 7:00am to 4:00pm, and her main advantage is the location where there are large numbers of people. She is a fighter, strong, active and creative, and she is seeking the support of a loan to invest in the purchase of a cooler, a machine for making whipped cream, crystal stemware, and wholesale supplies (ice cream, sweet sauces, vegetables, meats), and to advertise. 

In this manner, she'll be able to give continuity to her business and attract more customers, which will allow her to increase her income, so that she will be able to advance toward accomplishing her main goal which is to acquire her own store in which she can continue her work and to make her establishment a good source of income. 

Sobeima hopes the store is profitable and that it will ensure economic stability, in order to offer her children a better education and well being, as well as improving the quality of life for the whole family.

loans.use: buy a cooler, a machine to make whipped cream, crystal stemware, and wholesale supplies (ice cream, sweet sauces, vegetables, meats), and to advertise.

loans.name: Febilyn

texts.en:
Febilyn is married with an only child and lives in Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur with her family. Her husband is a farmer, their main source of income. She helps her husband operate and manage their own rice farm to make a living. 

In 2010, she joined Gata Daku MPC and it help her have an access to micro finance services. Recently, she borrowed a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy fertilizer for her farm. 

She hopes that through this amount, she would be able to gain more harvest for the family. Febilyn wants to improve the general living condition of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farm to gain more harvest.

loans.name: Famata

texts.en:
Famata lives in West Point, one of the biggest and well-known markets in Liberia. She is 37 years old. She is married and has two children who are 11 and 16 years old. Her children are in school and live at home with her. 

For over six years, Famata has been selling used clothes in the market. She received a small amount from her husband to start her business, and learned the business from her mother. She likes her business because it helps her to feed her children. She is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes for her business. Her plan is to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business

loans.name: Florance

texts.en: Florance lives in West Point. She is 30 years old, married, and has six children between 1 and 12 years old. Her husband is a businessman. For nine  years now she has been selling soft drinks in her community. She received money from her husband to start her business, and learned selling from her mother. She likes her business because she makes a profit. Florance is requesting a loan to purchase more soft drinks for her business. Her plan is to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks for her business.

loans.name: Cinia Marilú

texts.es:
Cinia es una mujer de 38 años de edad, estudio hasta 3 año de Bachillerato. Actualmente es soltera y tiene un hijo de 11 años que esta estudiando 5° grado. Ella y su hijo viven con sus padres y hermano.

Es costurera desde hace 10 años, inicio con un proyecto de la Alcaldía ya que era de gratis le gusto y así fue aprendiendo. Además, tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de ropa interior, blusas y perfumes. Trabaja en casa el oficio de costurera y aprovecha cuando va a traer a su hijo a la escuela para promocionar sus productos con las profesoras y madres de familia, en horas de 10 a 12 pm.

El préstamo que esta solicitando es, para pagar mano de obra;  ya que su padre siembra maíz 7,000 metros cudrados de maíz y 3,500 metros cudrados de frijol, y también lo necesita para comprar abono y fertilizante para poder obtener buen rendimiento. 

Su propósito es, primeramente sacar bastante frijoles para venderlos y las ganancias poderlas utilizar para la educación de su hijo e ir creciendo con su pequeño negocio de costureria.
texts.en:
Cinia is a 38-year old woman who studied three years of high-school. She is single and has an 11-year old son who studies 5th grade. They live with her parents and brother.  

She has worked as a dressmaker for 10 years. She started with a project for the Mayor's Office and kept learning since then. She also has a small business selling underwear, blouses and perfume, and offers her products to teachers and moms when she brings her son to school, between 10 and 12pm. 

She is requesting a loan to buy labor, given that her father has a  7,000 sqm land of corn and a 3,500 sqm land of beans. She also needs to buy fertilizer to obtain a good output. Her goal is to produce a good amount of beans for sale, to invest the profits in her son's education and to continue growing her small dressmaking business.

loans.use: to buy labor, given that her father has a  7,000 sqm land of corn and a 3,500 sqm land of beans. She also needs to buy fertilizer to obtain a good output.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is married and has 3 children. She lives in Kapalaran, Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines along with her family. Her husband earns a living through farming as their main source of income. Josephine helps in operating their farm, planting, and harvesting rice for sale to augment their living.

Josephine successfully repaid her previous loan from GDMPC, which she used to improve her farm. Recently, she borrowed again another loan of 15,000 PHP to buy fertilizer for their farm. 

In the future, Josephine wants to make improvements to her house and the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for their farm.

loans.name: Mamie

texts.en:
Mamie is 39 years old and lives in the West Point. She is married and has four children. One is eight months old, while the others are five, seven, and fifteen years old. Two of her children are presently in school, and they all live at home. 

For the past three years, Mamie has been selling soap in her community. She started this business with a small amount of money that she received from her husband, and she learned the business from her mother. 

What she likes about this business is that it helps her to pay her children's school fees. She is requesting a loan to purchase more soap for her business.  Her future plans is to saved money and build her house.

loans.use: to purchase more soap for her business.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 41 years old and married with four children who are in school.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Mary Jane is borrowing PHP 24,000 through NWTF to pay for laborers salary for the harvest of rice and buy new rice seeds for her business.

Mary Jane has been farming rice for 5 years and earns additional income from general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to pay for laborers salary for the harvest of rice and buy new rice seeds for her business.

loans.name: José Carlos

texts.es: José, a sus 20 años de edad, vive con su madre y sus abuelos, luego de soportar la separación de sus padres. Hace pocos meses su abuelo falleció y en la casa comenzaron a pasar una difícil crisis económica, por lo que José tomó la iniciativa de montar su propio negocio, una cría y venta de pollos, pues adquirió como herencia unos terrenos en los cuales desea construir los galpones, además podrá aplicar el conocimiento que obtuvo en el colegio donde realizó sus estudios secundarios. Para avanzar con su proyecto, solicita el apoyo del crédito, el cual invertirá en la compra de materiales para construir los galpones (madera, mallas de alambre, clavos), además comprará pollos y concentrado, así podrá dar inicio a su idea de negocio, con la cual espera generar los recursos suficientes para sacar adelante a su madre y a su abuela y para pagarse los estudios universitarios que desea iniciar. José es consciente que para lograr que su proyecto de frutos debe trabajar con esmero, disciplina y mucha dedicación, sólo de esta manera podrá alcanzar el sueño de convertir su idea de negocio en una granja productora de pollos que le garantice a mediano plazo una estabilidad económica favorable, que le permita brindar a su familia un mejor bienestar y calidad de vida.
texts.en:
At 20 years old, José lives with his mother and grandparents. A few months ago, his grandfather passed away, and his household began to go through a difficult economic crisis, which is why José took the iniciative to put together his own business of raising and selling chicken. He inherited some land on which he wants to build chicken pens, as well as be able to apply the knowledge he learned in his secondary studies. 

To advance the project, he is requesting a loan, which he will invest in the purchase of materials to construct the pens (wood, wire mesh, nails). He will also buy chickens and feed, so that he will be able to begin his business idea with which he expects to generate enough resources to support his mother and grandmother, and to pay for university studies that he wants to start. 

José is aware that to reap the benefits of his project, he must work with care, discipline and a lot of dedication. Only in this way will he be able to reach his goal of turning his business idea into a farm that will produce chickens, that will ensure favorable mid-term economic stablity, and let him offer his family a better well being and quality of life.

loans.use: buy chickens, feed, and materials to construct chicken pens (wood, wire mesh, and nails).

loans.name: Pedrito

texts.en:
Pedrito is a single farmer that lives in Kapalaran, Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur. He has been managing his farm to make a living.

Pedrito has been a member of Gata Daku Multi-purpose Cooperative since 2012. Now, he has borrowed a loan of 10,000 PHP to cover the cost of farm weeding maintenance. He hopes to improve the general living condition of his entire family to have a better future.

loans.use: to cover the cost of farm weeding maintenance

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es: Mercedes, de 46 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de 2 de sus 7 hijos en la casa que alquiló hace 12 años. Desde hace 12 años, cuando formó su familia,  comenzó a sembrar en los terrenos de su suegra, a una hora de su localidad, ahí siembra diversos productos como alverja, olluco, papa y oca, los que cuida cada fin de semana a la espera de la cosecha, pues los demás días las dedica en el trabajo del rancho donde extrae leche y le pagan un sueldo mensual que le ayuda en los gastos del hogar. Por esa razón, Mercedes, desea mejorar sus cosechas, pues en la venta que realiza de sus alimentos en la ciudad de Pampas, obtiene ganancias considerables, pero ella desea obtener mayores ganancias, que lo conseguirá con mejorar la calidad de sus alimentos. Este es su segundo crédito con kiva, en todo este tiempo obtuvo el dinero necesario para invertir en el desarrollo de su negocio, por lo que promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Mercedes, invertirá los S/.500 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para distribuir entre sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Mercedes is 44 and a hard-working woman. She lives with two of her seven children in the house that she first rented 12 years ago. 12 years ago, when she started her family, she began farming her mother-in-law's land an hour away from where she lives. There she grows various crops such as peas, potatoes, olluco and oca (olluco and oca are types of Peruvian root vegetables), which she takes care of each weekend, awaiting the harvest. The other days she does farm work in which she does milking and is paid a monthly salary. This helps her with the household expenses. 

For that reason Mercedes wants to improve her harvests, as by selling her crops in the city of Pampas, she gets considerable income. But she wishes to obtain greater income, which she will get through improving the quality of her crops. 

This is her second loan with Kiva, and in all this time she has obtained the money necessary to invest in developing her business. Therefore she promises to be on time with her installment payments. Mercedes will use the 500 soles to buy organic fertilizer to spread on her crops.

loans.use: To buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Gor

texts.en:
Gor is from Gyumri town and earns his living by providing installation service of gas balloons for automobiles.

Gor lives with his wife and three little daughters, and he works hard to sustain their living. 

Over years of hard work, Gor has been able to build a client base that prefers to use only Gor's service. Currently, Gor needs some financial support for purchasing gas balloons for installation in automobiles. Gor has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. Thus, this loan is very important to Gor in providing needed capital to continue his work.

loans.use: to pay for gas balloons for installation in automobiles

loans.name: Estela

texts.en:
Estela is 54 years old and widowed with five children.

Estela works hard to provide for her family. She runs a direct sales business selling Avon products in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock of Avon products to sell.

Estela has borrowed and repaid 16 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her business direct-selling Avon products for 20 years, and she also earns an income from pre-paid mobile loading.

Estela aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of Avon products to sell

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: Martha, de 38 años es una mujer sencilla. Vive en compañía de su esposo y sus hijos a los que cuida en su casa propia. Desde muy joven comenzó en la agricultura gracias a ello adquirió el dinero para comprar su casa y vivir en el pueblo, donde ahora trabaja en el municipio, además comenzó con el negocio de crianza de gallinas los cuales vende cada semana, afirma que no dejó de sembrar, para lo cual tiene su propio capital de trabajo. Ahora desea aumentar más su ganado para así poder mejorar sus ingresos, ya que tiene muchos pedidos. Este es su segundo crédito con kiva, desea su apoyo necesario para invertir en el desarrollo de su negocio, por lo que promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Martha, invertirá los S/.1000 soles en la compra de más gallinas, además de comida balanceada para su alimentación.
texts.en:
Martha is a modest and unassuming 38-year-old woman. She lives with her husband and children in their own home. She started working in agriculture at a very young age, and thanks to this she earned money to buy her house and live in the town where she now works. Martha also started in the business of raising chickens, which she sells every week. She says that she has not stopped planting crops, for which she has her own working capital. Martha says she now wants to increase the number of chickens she has because she has many orders to fill and can improve her income. 

This is Martha’s second Kiva loan. She says she would like to have the support to develop and invest in her business, and she promises to make her payments on time. Martha will use the 1000 PEN to buy more chickens as well as nutritionally balanced feed for them.

loans.use: to buy chickens and nutritionally balanced feed.

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en:
Mrs. Marjorie is married with one child. She became a member of Paglaum Multipurpose Cooperative three months ago. She is currently working as an Overseas Filipino Worker (OFW) in Japan to uplift the living condition of her family. She is an electronic assembler in one of the companies in Japan, and she has been working there for eight years already. 

Her income is just enough to sustain her living in Japan and for her parents living here in the Philippines. This is her first loan from Paglaum Multipurpose Cooperative to purchase materials for house repair and renovation to provide a comfortable home for her family.

loans.use: To purchase costruction materials for renovation of her house

location.town: Dipolog-Gulayon, Dipolog City, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Francelina

texts.en:
Francelina is applying for a loan of US$1,000 to improve her business. She runs a business from her house selling gasoline and diesel.  She makes a good income from selling gasoline and diesel, and she wants to buy more stocks with the loan. 

She lives in a town near by the main road, so many people come to buy, and she sells every day. She opened her kiosk a year ago with her working capital of US$600.

loans.use: To buy stocks of gasoline and diesel to sell

loans.name: Serfina

texts.es:
Serfina, tiene 59 años de edad , está casada y vive al lado de sus hijos y nietos en su casa propia.
Serfina se dedica a la elaboración de cerámicas y maseteros, como un negocio tradicional de su familia, con el apoyo de sus nueras y sus hijas preparan la mezcla para la elaboración de las cerámicas para luego proceder con la venta. Fue su abuelita quien le enseño este arte y gracias  a ello fue que tomo la iniciativa de poner el negocio, como todos, al principio no se les hizo nada fácil ya que en ese entonces el material requerido era muy escaso. Como un ingreso extra su esposo brinda servicios de albañilería, y tantos años dedicándose a ese rubro le ha dado el reconocimiento de su buen trabajo. Este es su primer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. 
El dinero solicitado de S/.1500 soles lo invertirá en la compra de material para la elaboración de las cerámicas como arcilla, tintas de colores, entre otros.
texts.en:
Serfina is 59, married, and lives with her husband, children, and grandchildren in the family's home. 

Serfina carries on a family tradition by making ceramic pottery. Her daughters and daughters-in-law help her prepare clay to make the items that she sells. Serfina's grandmother taught her this craft, and inspired Serfina to take the initiative of starting her own business. Nothing was easy at first, and the materials she required were scarce. Her husband has provided additional income by working in construction. Serfina has over the years gained a reputation for the high quality of her pottery. This is her first loan with Kiva and she is grateful for the financial support that will allow her to grow her business. She is committed to making timely payments. 

Serfina is applying for a loan of 1,500 soles, which she will use to purchase clay, dyes, and other materials for making ceramic objects.

loans.use: to purchase clay and other materials.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
This is Rebecca. Her previous loan was a big help in her business.  She was able to buy needed grocery items and other products for her variety store. Her income from loan has helped her in giving an education to her children. It also helped in their household expenditures.

She would like to apply for another PHP 10,000 loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add in her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and pay her children’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Rebecca hopes that her children will finish their studies.  She dreams that her business will grow bigger. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of their lives and business every week.  There she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet weekly. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay their microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of eight children, Lilia works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling spices in the Philippines. She earns additional income from selling dried coconut meat and farming rice. Lilia is borrowing PHP 29,000 through NWTF to buy additional spices for her spice trading business.

Lilia successfully paid back her previous loan, which helped to further build her businesses buying and selling spices, selling dried coconut meat and farming rice.

Lilia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional spices for her business

loans.name: Mary Wilma

texts.en:
Mary Wilma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her food vending business.

Mary Wilma has been in this business for three years. She earns additional income from pig fattening.

Mary Wilma has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for her business

loans.name: Leslie Ann

texts.en:
Leslie Ann is 28 years old and married with two children.

Leslie Ann works hard to provide for her family. She runs a direct sales business selling Natasha products in the Philippines, and has requested a 22,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more stock of Natasha products to sell.

Leslie Ann has borrowed and paid 9 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the direct sales business selling Natasha products for 3 years, and also earns an income from food vending, farming rice, and selling herbal products.

Leslie Ann aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of Natasha products to sell.

loans.name: Mahalia

texts.en:
Mahalia is married with six children and lives in Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur, along with her family. Her husband earns an income from farming, operating their own farm. She helps him to manage their farm to make a living. 

Mahalia borrowed a loan of 5,400 PHP from Gata Daku Multi-purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) Microcredit to cover the costs of farm weeding maintenance. She plans to use her generated income to improve their house for a better living in the near future.

loans.use: to cover the costs of farm weeding maintenance

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
Paulina, de 55 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive junto a su esposo Sergio y sus 4 hijos en su casa propia. Con la carretilla que posee vende diversos productos, como frutas de la región y flores. “Todo depende del mes, por ejemplo en el mes de mayo y noviembre vendo flores, los demás días del mes vendo frutas”, comenta. Su secreto es comprar las frutas por cajones y a menor precio, de esa manera se asegura poder tener la mayor rentabilidad posible. Mientras que las flores que vende los siembra por ella misma, sus principales flores constan de “gladiolos, lluvia e ilusiones”, los cuales comercializa en la temporada de la primera semana de noviembre cuando los pobladores visitan los cementerios, llevando flores a sus familiares. Pero como Paulina es una mujer muy trabajadora, también se dedica a la compra y venta de animales, los que comercializa en la feria de su ciudad los días sábados. Este es su segundo crédito con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
Paulina, invertirá los S/.800 soles en la compra de cajones de frutas para abastecer su negocio y si el dinero le alcanza comprará también ovejas.
texts.en:
Paulina is a hard-working woman. She is 55 years old and lives with her husband Sergio and their four children in their own home. From her cart she sells a variety of products like regional fruits and flowers. "It all depends on the month. In May and November, for example, I sell flowers. The other months I sell fruits", she commented. Her secret is to buy the fruit by the crate and at a low price. In this way she can be assured of making the most income possible.The flowers she sells she grows herself. The main types she sells are gladiolas and "lluvia ilusion" which are sold in the first week of November when the people visit the cemeteries and put flowers on the graves. But as Paulina is a very industrious woman she also buys and sells animals which she sells at the Saturday market. 

This is Paulina's second loan with Kiva and she is grateful for the financial assistance that allows her to get ahead. She promises to pay her loan in a timely manner. Paulina will invest the 800 PEN to buy crates of fruit to stock her business and if the money allows, buy a few sheep too.

loans.use: to buy fruit wholesale.

loans.name: Ysabel

texts.es: Ysabel, de 40 años es una mujer responsable. Vive en una casa alquilada junto a sus dos hijos. Ysabel se dedica a la venta de medicinas naturales las cuales son cultivadas en sus propios terrenos agrícolas. Ya tiene 35 años de experiencia en este rubro, su negocio consiste en la compra de platas medicinales por cantidad, con los que elabora medicinas caseras, que vende de feria en feria. Su experiencia y edad, le ayudan a obtener buenas ganancias. Ysabel ayuda a su esposo en la elaboración de estos productos, con el fin de aprender los secretos de la medicina natural, “mi esposo ya es conocido, los pobladores conocen mi casa y recibo las visitas de ellos constantemente, pues hay muchas enfermedades que no son curadas en los hospitales”, afirma. Ahora desea aprender todo lo necesario para poder continuar con el negocio si su esposo llegara a faltar. Este es su segundo crédito con Kiva y se siente agradecido por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, por lo que promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Ysabel, invertirá los S/.1000 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para esparcir entre plantas medicinales para la elaboración de las medicinas naturales.
texts.en:
Ysabel is 40 years old and describes herself as a responsible person. She lives in a rented house with her two children. Ysabel works selling natural medicines, made from plants that she cultivates on her own land. She says she now has 35 years of experience in this area. Her business consists of buying medicinal plants in large quantities which she uses to make home-made medicines. She then sells them from market to market. 

Ysabel says that she makes a good profit because of her experience and age. Ysabel helps her husband make these remedies in order to learn the secrets of natural medicine. She says, “My husband is now known, the people know my house and I get visits from them constantly because there are many illnesses that are not cured in hospitals.” Ysabel says she would like to learn everything she needs to know to continue the business if something were to happen to her husband.

This is Ysabel’s second Kiva loan.  She says she is grateful for the financial support to move ahead with her business, and she promises to make her payments on time. Ysabel will use the 1000 PEN to buy organic fertilizer for the medicinal plants used to make natural medicines.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer for medicinal plants used to make natural medicines.

loans.name: Rufina

texts.en:
Rufina is married and lives in Lower Lodiong, Tambulig with her family. Her husband serves as a barangay councilor in their community, and at the same time works on their own farm to make a living.

Rufina makes and sells snacks to help augment their general living condition. She earns 3,500 PHP each month doing this work. 

She successfully repaid her previous loans from Gata Daku MPC that she used for her business. She has recently requested a new loan of 6,000 PHP to purchase more ingredients to improve her business.  In the future, she hopes to expand her business and to be able to run her own store with shelter.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients to improve her business.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn, a married entrepreneur, lives in Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur with her family. Her husband is a farmer, while she runs a general store to make a living. 


Jocelyn, who successfully repaid her previous loan from Gata Daku MPC that she used to buy inventory, has requested a new loan of 6,000.00 PHP to purchase canned goods, noodles and milk. She plans to use the new revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell such as rice, sugar, canned goods, shampoo, soap, and toothpaste.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
This is Miriam. She previously accessed an 10,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase merchandise items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big addition for her children’s education and in their personal, household and business expenditures. She also has a variety store for additional income.

She would like to apply for another 12,000 PHP loan to buy more merchandise items and products to increase her product inventory. The more items she has on display and available on hand, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her children’s education and daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Miriam dreams to have other sources of income and hopes that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and it is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional supplies and merchandise products like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of nine children, Rosario works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.  Rosario is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Rosario has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Jenalyn

texts.en:
Jenalyn is 33 years old, married with three children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Jenalyn has a fishing business in the Philippines. Jenalyn requested a PHP 8000 loan amount through NWTF to buy a new engine for her fishing boat.

Jenalyn has been in this business for 13 years. In the future, Jenalyn would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for her fishing boat.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is 42 years of age and married and she is blessed with three children. She has managed a hog raising business for almost ten years. With this business she's earning a net income of PHP 4,000 when she sell four hogs. Due to lack of capital she decided to get a loan amounting to PHP 15,000 to purchase hog feed. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that she can expand her business and then her business will become more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase hog feed.

loans.name: Teresinha

texts.en:
A $600.00 loan is offered to Teresinha to improve her business. She has a kiosk where many people come to buy every day. She is married and she has three children. She will buy some additional supplies such as noodles, fish, eggs, slippers, milk, cigarettes, biscuits, sugar and coffee. She has been involving herself in business activities since 2002. She feels so comfortable to run her business because she can earn money every day.
Running a business has made Teresinha independent because she can be responsible for herself and also helping her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy noodles, fish, eggs, milk, cigarettes,  sugar and coffee to sell.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
Lucia es una mujer de 50 años de edad, estudio hasta 2° grado y no continuo con sus estudios; porque en esa época era muy difícil para sus padres.  Ella esta casada y su esposo se dedica a la agricultura y tienen 6 hijos, pero solamente uno vive en casa y esta estudiando 2° grado. Ella tiene que a cargo a su hijo y un nieto de 2 años de edad.

Realiza oficios domésticos y en ocasiones lava y plancha ropa ajena, para generar un ingreso extra, ya que en su casa tiene un pequeño negocio venta  de refrescos, charamuscas y agua.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar material como láminas, cuartones, y cemento para construir un corredor y techarlo; ya que en época lluviosa en la zona donde desea construir se encharca y es difícil movilizarse.

Su deseo, es que su hijo siga estudiando y que pueda llegar más lejos que ella. Espera en un futuro construir 2 habitaciones para que su hijo y su nieto tengan un espacio dentro de la casa.
texts.en:
Lucia is a 50 year old woman who is married and has six children. Only one of the children, who is a student in Grade Two, still lives in their home. Her husband is a farmer. She has to care for her child and a two year old grandchild. She only studied up to Grade two and had to stop then as it was a difficult time for her parents. She works as a domestic and sometimes takes in laundry to generate more income. She has a small business in her house where she sells soft drinks, charamuscas (a local candy) and water.

Lucia will use the loan to buy material like sheet metal, lumber and cement to build a gallery and roof it. The area where they want to build floods in the rainy season and it is difficult to get through it. Her wish is for her son to continue studying and to get further than she did. She also hopes in the future to add 2 rooms to the house so that her son and grandson have their own space.

loans.use: to buy material like sheet metal, lumber and cement to build a gallery and roof it.

loans.name: Bulganjargal

texts.en: Mrs. Bulganjargal, 31 years old, lives with her husband and mother in an old brick house on a plot of land in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Two years ago, she began running a grocery store and has now secured permanent customers and business is going well. Recently her husband began creating and selling frames to photographers. She is requesting a loan of 3000000 MNT to buy building and insulation materials such as cements, bricks, fiberglass and foam to renovate her old house for the incoming winter. The renovated house will enable the family to burn less coal for heating thus releasing less pollutants into the atmosphere. The burning coal is the main source of air pollution according to the state research department. So reduction in coal usage will contribute to the efforts against air pollution. The borrower is so excited and can't wait to live in comfortable yet warm house.

loans.use: To buy building and insulation materials.

loans.name: Mamie

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 32-year-old Mamie, from Kandeh town Bo, Southern area in Freetown. She is married and has four children between the ages of 5 and 11 years. Three of her children are attending school.  Her husband is a driver, so his income is not enough to take care of the household.

Mamie runs a cookery business; she sells cooked rice, fried fish, and cool drinks. She has been running this business for nine years. She wakes up at 4:30 in the morning, to prepare her cookery business. She will not rest until the food is finished. One of her daughters usually helps her with the work of the cookery business. Her business is the only source of income she has. Mamie says that her major hardship is that sometimes it is very difficult to prepare the cooked foods.  

Mamie has requested a loan in order to purchase cooking ingredients, including bags of rice, coconut oil, and pure water. The extra income from this loan will allow her to change her cookery structure and pay her children's school fees. In the future, she plans to have her own restaurant. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase cooking ingredients, including bags of rice, coconut oil, and pure water

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
This is Liezel, 42, resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Arthur, who works on a maintenance staff, and she is a mother to their children. Together with her husband, she manages their household while operating her business. She and her husband are working hard to provide income for their everyday needs.

Liezel maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics, and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller Life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct selling brands. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. The dealers' prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers rely on as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 2,000 PHP in sales every week.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan. She will use the loan to buy additional supplies and products like shampoo, cologne, deodorant, perfume, soap, fabric softener, undergarments, and other items needed in her business. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business.  

Liezel hopes to have her own stall and dreams of being successful in life and business. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and products such as clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Abdunabi

texts.ru: Абдунаби молодой и очень активный парень в возрасте 29 лет. Живёт он в сельской местности. Закончив местную школу, Абдунаби поступил в Институт иностранных языков. Учиться было трудно ему, потому что постоянно были проблемы с финансами в семье. И после окончания третьего года обучения, взяв академический отпуск, он решил поехать на заработки в Китай. Полностью окончив обучение в университете, Абдунаби решил остаться работать в Китае. Там он зарабатывал хорошие деньги. Однажды мать Абдунаби сильно заболела и он приехал на родину, чтобы заботиться о ней и обеспечивать необходимыми лекарствами. И с этого момента он решил больше не покидать свою родину и быть всегда рядом с матерью. Вскоре он женился и через год у него родился ребенок. В данный момент Абдунаби живет в счастливом браке со своей супругой. В своем городе нашел себе работу в одной Китайской строительной организации. Он там работает лаборантом. Супруга пока не работает, сидит с маленьким ребенком и присматривает за домом. В этом году они решили делать ремонт  дома.  Но достаточной суммы для ремонта  Абдунаби не имеет. Поэтому он обратился в Арванд и желает получить кредит на покупку строительных материалов для ремонта своего дома. Он и его семья ждут и надеются на положительный результат и Абдунаби заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en: Abdunabi is a very active young man of 29 years of age.  He lives in a rural area.  Upon finishing school locally, Abdunabi started study at an institute of international languages.  It was difficult for him to study because there were constantly problems with finances in his family.  After completion of his third year of study, he took a sabbatical and decided to move to China for work.  Once he completed his university studies, Abdunabi decided to remain in China to work, and there earned good money.  However, Abdunabi's mother became seriously ill and he returned home to take care of her and provide necessary medications.  From that moment he decided that he would not leave his homeland again, and that he would always stay near to his mother.  He soon married, and within a year a baby was born.  Abdunabi and his wife are happily married.  In his town he found work with a Chinese building organization, where he works in a laboratory.  His wife does not yet work; she stays with the small baby and looks after the home.  This year they decided to do repairs on their house, but Abdunabi does not have enough money for the repairs.  He therefore turned to Arvand and hopes to receive a loan to purchase building supplies to repair his home.  He and his family wait and hope for a positive result, and he thanks Arvand in advance for its support.

loans.use: to buy building materials for his home

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 20-year-old Kadiatu, from Torkpoi town Bo. She is single, with no child for now. She began her business, because she wants to create income to support herself and to develop her younger sisters.

Kadiatu runs a general stock business; she sells cigarettes, biscuits and sweets. She has been running this business for three years. She works at the business throughout the week, and for 10 hours per day. Kadiatu says that the major problem to her business is insufficient capital to expand it.

Kadiatu has requested a loan in order to purchase more goods to resell, including soft drinks, biscuits, and pure water. The extra income from this loan will allow her to attend a vocational school and increase her business. In the future, she plans to expand her enterprise more than ever. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more goods to resell, including soft drinks, biscuits, and pure water

loans.name: Tenneh

texts.en:
Tenneh lives in West Point, one of the biggest market areas in Liberia. She is 30 years old, and she did not attend school. Tenneh is married and has three children, aged between 5 and 11 years. Her children are in school and live at home.

Tenneh has been selling underwear, socks, etc., in the local market. She works from Monday to Saturday, spending eight hours each day. She received a little amount of capital from her husband to start her business, and she learned to run it from her oldest sister. She likes her business, because it helps her to feed her children. Tenneh is requesting a loan. She will use the loan to purchase more used underwear, socks, etc., for her business. She has plans to own a house and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more used underwear, socks, etc., to sell at the local market

loans.name: Fatu

texts.en:
Fatu lives in West Point. She is 42 years old, and she is married. She has four children, aged between 15 and 21 years. Only two of her children are in school.

For four years, she has been selling foods at the local market, including sugar, milk, and oats. She sold charcoal for one of her friends, and saved her earnings to enable her to start her own business. She learned to run a business from her best friend, and she likes her business because she generates some money every time she sells.

Fatu is requesting a loan, which she will use to purchase more goods to sell at the local market, including sugar, milk, and oats. Her dreams are to build a house and to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell at the local market, including sugar, milk, and oats

loans.name: Fanta

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 37-year-old Fanta, from Torkpoi town Bo. She is married and has four children between the ages of 12 and 20 years. Two of her children are currently attending school. She began her business, because she wanted to develop her home.

Fanta runs a general stock business; among the products she sells are soft drinks, biscuits and sweets. She has been running this business for 15 years. She works at the business throughout the week, and 10 hours per day.  Fanta says that sometime business is very difficult.

Fanta has requested a loan in order to purchase more goods to sell, including soft drinks, biscuits and sweets. The extra income from this loan will allow her to pay her children's school fees and increase her business. In the future, she would like to become a better businesswoman. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell, including soft drinks, biscuits and sweets

loans.name: Cerlita

texts.en:
Cerlita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 21,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional household goods, soap, milk, sugar, milk, canned goods, etc., for her general store business.  Cerlita has been in this business for 3 years. Cerlita earns more income from rice retailing.

Cerlita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional household goods, soap, milk, sugar, milk, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 29 years old and married with three children who are in school.

Arlene works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 24,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell like canned goods, milk, sugar, soap, etc.  Arlene has borrowed and repaid 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 4 years and also earns an income from farming rice.

Arlene aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like canned goods, milk, sugar, soap, etc.

loans.name: Agustihna

texts.en:
Agustihna is 20 years old, married and has one child.  She has a kiosk to generate income for her family.

She has been thinking how to run a big business, but she does not have enough working capital. She felt better when she applied for her first loan and she is applying for her second loan of $1,000. She will buy some additional supplies to keep in her kiosk such as onions, garlic and sweet potatoes. She is happy with TRM (Tuba Rai Metin) that offers loans to poor people.

loans.use: to buy onions, garlic and sweet potatoes

loans.name: Ivy

texts.en:
Ivy is very thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She is using her loan as additional capital for her business. She also uses the loan in sending her child to school. Her income from the loan is helping their household with their everyday expenses. She is also selling different vegetables for additional income. 

She would like to apply for another 40,000 PHP loan for her to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of their tricycle unit. She will also use the loan in buying vegetables for her vegetable stall. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Ivy dreams to be more successful in her business and hopes that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her work. It is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and the maintenance of her tricycle unit

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es: Lucia se gana la vida vendiendo en una joyería porque su nivel de instruccion es de primaria, tiene un marido que trabaja de conductor y está afiliado a un sindicato de transporte. Necesita crédito para comprar material de construcción para empezar el proyecto de refaccion de dos habitaciones de su vivienda que es propia y se encuentra en la ciudad de El Alto
texts.en:
Lucia is married and earns her living as a salesperson in a jewelry store because she was only able to go to elementary school. Her husband is a driver and is a member of a transportation workers union.

Lucia is requesting this loan to buy construction materials. She will use these to make repairs to two rooms of her home, which is in the city of El Alto.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to make repairs to two rooms of her home.

loans.name: Juditha

texts.en:
Juditha is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 29,500 PHP through NWTF to purchase materials to repair her fishing boat for her fishing business. Juditha has been in this business for 5 years. She earns additional income from a general store.

Juditha has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF.  She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase materials to repair her fishing boat.

loans.name: Felicidade

texts.en:
Felicidade is requesting a loan of $1000.00 to improve her business. She is married and she has two children. She runs a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. 

She will use the loan to buy stock for her store such as fish, water, soap, and soy sauce. She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $200.00. Felicidade is a hard working woman, and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy fish, water, soap, and soy sauce.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 13,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Josephine has been in this business for 5 years. Josephine earns more income from raising pigs.

Josephine has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell

loans.name: Mukaddam

texts.ru: Мукаддам трудолюбивая женщина. Она разведана и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Детям 10 лет и 1.5 года. Она одна воспитывает и обеспечивает своих детей. Она более 4 лет занимается шитьём женской одежды. Мукаддам шьёт красиво и аккуратно. Она старается, чтобы ее клиенты радовались и были довольны. Она уже несколько лет планирует отремонтировать свой дом. Она не имеет денег, чтобы купить строительные материалы, как цемент, древесина, краски и т.п. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Mukaddam is a hard-working woman.  She is divorced and is raising two children, who are ten and one and a half years old.  She is raising and providing for her children alone.  She has been sewing women's clothing for more than four years.  She sews beautifully and carefully, and tries to make her clients happy.  She has been planning for several years to repair her home,but doesn't have money to purchase building materials like cement, wood, paint, and so on.  She is asking for a loan of 5000 TJS.  She awaits your kindness and hopes for your charity.

loans.use: To buy building materials in order to repair her house

loans.name: Neftali

texts.es:
Neftali es un hombre de 53 años de edad, estudio hasta 4° grado año, no pudo seguir por la situación de la guerra que se vivía en ese entonces. Esta acompañado y tiene trece hijos y seis de ellos viven en casa  con él, y están estudiando 4°, 6° , 7° y 8°  grado en la Escuela de la comunidad, y todos los que viven en casa depende de él.

El cliente desde pequeño se ha dedicado en la agricultura, ya que su padre lo llevaba a trabajar y fue así que aprendió como trabajar las tierras. Ahora tiene unas cabezas de ganado y espera que vayan reproduciendo para tener un hato lechero. El trabajo lo realiza en casa y sus hijos le ayudan con el trabajo de campo que realiza.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar abono y fertilizantes, para cultivar 14,000 metros cuadrados de maíz y para comprar un par de novillas para que en un futuro poderlas reproducirlas. 

Lo que más desea, por ahora es que los hijos que están estudiando, puedan seguirlo haciendo, para que en un futuro puedan ser independientes, y sueña con tener varias cabezas de ganado lechero y vender leche y sus subproductos.
texts.en:
Neftali is a 53 year old man who studied until the 4th grade. He was unable to continue in school due to the war situation he lived through at that time. He has a common law wife and 13 children, six of whom live at home with him. They are in the 4th, 6th, 7th and 8th grade in a school in the community and all who live at home are dependent on him,

Since he was a small child Neftali has been engaged in agriculture because his father took him to the fields and that was how he learned to work the land. Now he has several heads of cattle and he hopes they will keep reproducing so he will have a small dairy herd. He works at home and his sons help him with the farming he does.

He is applying for a loan to purchase compost and fertilizer to cultivate 14,000 square meters of corn and to buy a couple of heifers and breed them in the future.

Currently, what he most wants is that his children who are in school continue studying so they can be self-supporting in the future. He dreams of owning several heads of dairy cattle and of selling milk and its byproducts.

loans.use: to purchase compost and fertilizers to cultivate 14,000 square meters of corn and to buy a pair of heifers so they can reproduce in the future.

loans.name: Mendsaikhan

texts.en:
Mendsaikhan, 43 years old, lives with her husband and three children in an old house on fenced land in Erdenet, the third largest city of Mongolia. She has been working as an operator at a carpet factory since 2011. Her husband also works at the same factory and he has held the position of assistant overseer for over nine years. Their children all study at university. 

She is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT to buy building and insulation materials such as bricks, cement, fiberglass and foam. Her house has deteriorated over the years and she wants to renovate it before winter. After renovation, her family can live in a comfortable and warm place where they don't need to burn much coal for heating. The burning of coal is considered to be the main cause of air pollution and the reduction of it will contribute to the efforts against air pollution as less pollutants are released into the atmosphere. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to buy building and insulation materials

loans.name: Shomurod

texts.ru: Шомурод трудолюбивый молодой человек. Ему 18 лет. Он не женат и живет с родителями. Он с детства всегда мечтал поступить в университет и получать высшее образование. Он в этом году успешно окончил среднюю школу и поступил в университет. Его родители очень рады за него и поддерживают его. Шомурод любит читать книги и в свободное время разгадывает кроссворд. Шомурод должен оплатить за учебный договор, но не имеет денег. Он запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Shomurod is a hard-working young man.  He is 18 years old, not married and lives with his parents.
