loans.use: to purchase ingredients for mixing livestock feed.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en: Carmelita is a farmer from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. She is a married woman and the mother of ten grown up children. Carmelita has been in the farming business with her husband for more than 35 years now. This is the source of her income. Carmelita is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm and to pay for the labor costs. With this, she will be able to improve the productivity of the farm, thus augmenting their yield and income. In the future, Carmelita hopes to make their farming venture a success and a stable source of income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm and to pay for labor costs

loans.name: Nazaria

texts.en:
This is Nazaria. She previously accessed a loan of 20,000 PHP that she used to buy more fruits of different kinds. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another loan of 20,000 PHP for her to purchase more fruits needed in her business. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Nazaria dreams that her business will flourish and that she will have more products to sell. She hopes that one day she will no longer need a loan. She meets with her co-fellowship members every week to share stories of her life and business and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more fruits needed in her business.

loans.name: Haide

texts.en:
Haide is married with six children and lives in Tangub City, Misamis, Occidental. Her husband is a government employee while she runs a general store to earn a living.

Haide has successfully repaid her previous loans from Gata Daku MPC that she used to improve her business. She is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP to purchase additional products like livestocks' feeds, rice and corn grits for sale.

In the future, Haide wants to build a house and see her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like livestocks'  feed, rice and corn grits for sale.

loans.name: Kely

texts.es:
La socia Kely estudio la carrera profesional de Psicologia y ahora esta haciendo una maestria,la socia tambien trabaja en un empresa de servicios de envio de documentos,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,el sueño de la socia es terminar de estudiar su maestria.La socia solicita le credito para pagar las mensualidades de su maestria.

La socia esta feliz con su prestamo y se compromete a cumplir los pagos de sus cuota
texts.en:
The bank member Kely studied the professional degree of Psychology and is now doing a master's. She also works in a services business, which mails documents. She works from 8:00 AM until 6:00 PM. Her dream is to finish studying her master's. She is asking for this loan in order to pay the monthly installments of her master's.

She is happy with her loan and she is committed to carry out the payment of her loan installments.

loans.use: to pay the monthly installments for her Master's.

loans.name: Ma. Rowena

texts.en:
This is Ma. Rowena. She previously accessed a 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan that she used to purchase scrap materials needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures. She is also selling ready-to-wear (clothes, shirt, socks, etc.) and different beverages.

She would like to apply for a new 50,000 PHP loan. She will be incorporating the loan into her current revolving fund used to buy scrap and recyclable materials. She will also use the money in buying ready-to-wear products and beverages. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Ma. Rowena hopes that her business will continue to grow and dreams to have a better living. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for recyclable materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Generosa

texts.en:
Generosa is married and has a food preparation business in the Philippines. She works hard to support her family.

Generosa is borrowing PHP 1800 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. in order to buy a solar lamp. She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have backup light in case of an emergency.

Generosa is aware that by using the solar lamp she is saving money, helping the environment, and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en: Valentina is 44 years old, married and has five children. Valentina plants and sells vegetables. Fish and meat also are add-ons offered during her selling to the people around her village. She usually gains about 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) each month, which goes for the education expenses of her children and the remaining amount served as additional revolving capital in her business. She would like to increase her sales with her earnings; that is why she is asking for a loan to buy fertilizers and insecticides to use for her vegetable planting and harvesting. Someday, Valentina hopes to maintain a good flow of sales and will keep offering affordable yet good products and services to her customers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides to use for vegetable planting and harvesting.

loans.name: Fortunato

texts.en: Fortunato is married with an only child. He resides in Bolinsong, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental, where he operates his own rice farm. He has been planting and harvesting rice for 20 years to make a living. In 2011, he joined Gata Daku NOC, and now he was able to borrow a loan of 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to purchase fertilizer for his farm. He want to improve his farm to get an abundant harvest in return for a better future of his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: El Progreso De La Amistad Group

texts.es: María es  integrante del grupo “El Progreso De La Amistad” la cual está conformada por 08 socios responsables y trabajadores. María tiene 38 años de edad, separada con  01 hijo  en etapa escolar. Ella se dedica a la compra y venta de productos como miel de abeja, queso y trucha la cual lo realiza a pedidos, siendo sus mayores clientes familiares y vecinos de la zona. A futuro le gustaría poner un puesto donde pueda ofrecer sus productos. Su último crédito lo destinará para la compra de miel de abeja, queso y trucha, pues tiene que viajar al centro del país para traerlo. El grupo “El Progreso De La Amistad” agradecen a las personas que hicieron posible éste crédito. María se la segunda del lado izquierdo, viste saco negro y pantalón celeste.
texts.en:
María is a member of "El Progreso De La Amistad" group, made up of 8 responsible and hard-working members. María is a 38-year old woman who is separated and has has one child attending school. Her job involves buying and selling products, such as bee honey, cheese and trout, and she works on request. Her biggest clients are family members and neighbors. 

Her goal for the future is to have a stall to offer her products. She will use the loan to buy bee honey, cheese and trout, as she needs to travel to the center of the country to get them. "El Progreso De La Amistad" group is grateful to the lenders that have made this loan a reality. 

On the photo, María is the second member starting from the left. She wears light blue pants and a black coat.

loans.use: to buy bee honey, cheese and trout.

loans.name: Sembrando Esperanza Group

texts.es: El grupo “SEMBRANDO ESPERANZA” está conformada por 07 socios quienes se dedican a brindar servicios y a las diversas actividades del comercio minorista. Elena tiene 40 años es soltera con tres hijos educando. En el  grupo cumple la función de presidenta. Hace muchos años se dedica a la venta de carrizo, flores, y frutas. La venta de carrizo la inicio su madre a quien apoya hoy en día Elena. El préstamo lo invirtió en la compra de carrizo, flores y frutas. Su mayor deseo es terminar de construir su vivienda. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo. Elena es la tercera del lado izquierdo viste casaca azul.
texts.en:
The "Sembrando Esperanza" group is made up of seven members who work offering services and performing various activities in the retail business. Elena is a 40-year old woman, single and mother of three children who attend school. She is the president of the group and, for many years, has been selling common reed, flowers and fruit. It is her mother who started selling common reed and now Elena supports her. 

She used the loan to buy common reed, flowers and fruit, and her biggest dream is to finish the construction of her house. The group members are grateful to Kiva lenders for this loan. 

On the photo, Elena is the third member from the left. She wears a blue jacket.

loans.use: to buy common reed, fruit and flowers.

loans.name: Rabi

texts.fr: Âgée de 30ans, Rabi épouse d'un revendeur a 02 enfants. L'ainé de 06ans va à l'étude tandis que le dernier de 02ans reste toujours à coté de sa mère. Pour aider son conjoint dans les charges familiales, elle a démarré en 2003 comme activité la vente des produits d'alimentation générale, de pagnes et bazins à domicile. Elle approvisionne à Lomé et est à son cinquiéme crédit de WAGES. Ce montant lui permettra de s'approvisionner en marchandises. Comme perspectives d'avenir, elle souhaite agrandir son activité et assurer les besoins primaires de la famille.
texts.en:
Rabi is the 30-year-old wife of a reseller and has two children. The oldest child is 6 years old and attends school while the youngest child, 2 years old, stays at home with his mother. 

In order to help her husband with their household expenses, Rabi started her business in 2003, selling general food products, hair extensions, and brocade from her home. She stocks up in Lomé and is on her fifth loan with WAGES.

This loan will allow Rabi to further stock up on merchandise. Looking to the future, she hopes to grow her business and secure the basic needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy general food products, hair extensions, and brocade

loans.name: Sonia Pauline

texts.fr: sonia est une femme de 32 ans, mariée et mère de 02 enfants. elle possède et gère une parfumerie dans un quartier de la ville depuis un an où elle vend des produits cosmétiques (parfum, lait corporel, shampoing, lotion) et des mèches. au vu de sa clientèle grandissante, elle sollicite ce crédit pour lui permettre de renforcer son stock de marchandises en achetant des lotion de beauté et des mèches afin d'augmenter son chiffre d'affaires et ses profits. les bénéfices générés vont être réinjectés dans son capital d'une part et d'autre part subviendront aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en: Sonia is a 32-year-old woman, married and mother of two children. Since the past year, she has owned and managed a perfumery in a neighborhood of the city, where she sells cosmetics (perfume, lotion, shampoo) and hair color. Due to her growing customer base, she is requesting this loan to increase her inventory by buying beauty lotion and hair color, in order to increase her sales and income. Income earned will partly be reinvested in the business and partly used to meet the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Benkadi 3 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe BENKADI 3 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 48 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à NIMPRODIOULA, un des villages de SIKASSO, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur sixième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  le pois sucré avec Mme  ALIMATA  assise en première position de la gauche  vers la droite sur la photo. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter le labour, la semence et les engrais  pour entretenir 0,5. La production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 80.000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Benkadi 3 Group are married women who, on average, are 48 years old and have four children each. They are all living in polygamous families at Nimprodioula, a village in Sikasso, the third administrative region of Mali. They work with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their agricultural activities during the rainy season. They are on their sixth loan with the institution, and past loans have been fully repaid. Their crop is sweet peas.
Alimata (seated, far left) intends to use her loan to pay for plowing and to buy seed and fertilizer to maintain 0.5 hectares. The produce is sold at the village at Sikasso, after the harvest, to male and female customers. She expects to earn an average income of 80.000 f CFA per year. This income will allow her to repay her loan and help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to pay for plowing and to buy farm inputs and agricultural seeds

loans.name: Benkadi 4 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe BENKADI 4 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 46 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à NIMPRODIOULA, un des villages de SIKASSO, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur sixième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  le pois sucré avec Mme  ABI  debout en cinquième position de la gauche  vers la droite sur la photo. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter le labour, la semence et les engrais  pour entretenir 0,5. La production est vendue au niveau du village et à SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 95.000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Benkadi 4 Group are married women who, on average, are 46 years old and have four children each. They are all living in polygamous families at Nimprodioula, a village in Sikasso, the third administrative region of Mali. They work with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their agricultural activities during the rainy season. They are on their sixth loan with the institution, and past loans have been fully repaid. Their crop is sweet peas.
Abi (standing second from the right) intends to use her loan to pay for plowing and to buy seed and fertilizer to maintain 0.5 hectares. The produce is sold at the village and at Sikasso, after the harvest, to male and female customers. She expects to earn an average income of 95.000 f CFA per year. This income will allow her to repay her loan and help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to pay for plowing and to buy farm inputs and agricultural seeds

loans.name: Reina Isabel

texts.es:
La  señora  Reina es una persona  emprendedora,  honesta, responsable   y seria, vive con  sus 2 hijos en  una comunidad  al  sur de Honduras. Su negocio es la  compra y  venta  de  ropa  y cuajada.
Doña Reina realiza su trabajo desde hace 20 años en su casa de habitación y lugares cercanos a  esta, dicha  actividad  forma la mayor parte de sus ingresos. 
Doña Reina el préstamo lo necesita  para  la compra de blusas, pantalones, vestidos,  calzonetas, etc. en  fardos de ropa con el préstamo espera que las ventas en su negocio aumenten al tener más mercadería que ofrecer a los clientes y cubrir las necesidades de los mismos y con esto mejorar la situación  económica de su familia.  
Doña  Reina  espera que  a un corto plazo  su negocio siga  creciendo y  consolidándose  para que se convierta en  el  más conocido de su colonia y seguir  apoyando a su familia para que sus hijos y se conviertan en personas honesta  con principios y valores.



Choluteca, Honduras –  Agosto  del   2013
texts.en:
Reina is an entrepreneur, honest, responsible and reliable woman who lives with her two children in a community in the South of Honduras. She has her own business buying and selling clothes and junket, and has been working in her house and its surroundings for 20 years. Most of her income comes from this activity. 

Reina will use the loan to buy blouses, pants, dresses, boxers, etc. Having more products to offer to clients and to cover their needs, she expects her sales to increase and the economic situation of her family to improve. She also expects that her business will continue growing and become the most popular one in the neighborhood. Her goal is to support her family so that her children will become honest people with principles and values. 

Choluteca, Honduras - August 2013

loans.use: to buy blouses, pants, dresses, boxers, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Erika Jesus

texts.es:
Erika es una mujer de 34 años, vive en la ciudad de Cañete, en el distrito de Imperial con su pequeña hija, ella es madre soltera, muy trabajadora,que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Erika no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional.
Por iniciativa propia, Erika trabaja como obrera de campo en un fundo agrícola de su ciudad,adicionalmente tiene una pequeña bodega de venta de golosinas, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Erika se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada comprará mayor cantidad y variedad de golosinas para abastecer su negocio, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ver a su convertida en una buena profesional.
texts.en:
Erika, 34, lives with her young daughter in the city of Cañete in the district of Imperial.  She is a hard-working, single mother who dedicates all her efforts to providing for her family.  Unfortunately, because of a lack of economic resources and the need to work, Erika was unable to get a university degree.

On her own initiative, Erika works as a farm hand at an agricultural site in her city.  She also runs a small store where she sells sweets.  She works every day about ten hours and believes that things are going well for her because of her dedication and kindness to others.

Erika is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to their support she will be able to buy a variety of sweets to stock her store.  This will allow her to continue working and striving to reach her goal of becoming a good professional.

loans.use: To buy sweets.

loans.name: Maribel Victoria

texts.es:
Maribel es una mujer de 46 años, vive en la ciudad de Pisco con sus dos pequeños hijos, ella es una madres soltera, trabajadora, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, Maribel trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de abarrotes y bebidas, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 12 horas y cree que le va bien por su esfuerzo y trato amable.
Maribel se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva,ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada comprara mayor cantidad y variedad de mercadería para abastecer su negocio, así pues Maribel seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener una vivienda adecuada y segura.
texts.en:
Maribel is a 46-year old woman who lives in the city of Pisco with her two young children. She is a single mother that works hard to support her family and has her own small business selling food products and drinks. She works every day for approximately 12 hours and thinks the business is going well because she works hard and is kind to her customers. 

Maribel is very grateful to Kiva lenders. Thanks to them, she will be able to buy a larger quantity and wider variety of products. Maribel will continue working hard and fighting to achieve her dream of having a suitable and safe house.

loans.use: to buy goods.

loans.name: Benkadi A Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe BENKADI A sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 46 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à NIMPRODIOULA, un des villages de SIKASSO, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur sixième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  le pois sucré avec Mme  KARI  debout en deuxième position de la gauche  vers la droite sur la photo. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter le labour, la semence et les engrais  pour entretenir 0,5. La production est vendue au niveau du village et à SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 95.000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Benkadi A Group are married women who, on average, are 46 years old and have four children each. They are all living in polygamous families at Nimprodioula, a village in Sikasso, the third administrative region of Mali. They work with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their agricultural activities during the rainy season. They are on their sixth loan with the institution, and past loans have been fully repaid. Their crop is sweet peas.
Kari (standing second from the left) intends to use her loan to pay for plowing and to buy seed and fertilizer to maintain 0.5 hectares. The produce is sold at the village and at Sikasso, after the harvest, to male and female customers. She expects to earn an average income of 95.000 f CFA per year. This income will allow her to repay her loan and help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to pay for plowing and to buy farm inputs and agricultural seeds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy three dozen men's shirts, two dozen women's shirts, underwear, and five dozen pairs of flip-flops for children and adults.

loans.name: Jose Hermogenes

texts.es:
Jose es un hombre de 68 años,vive en la ciudad de Huaraz,en el distrito de Carhuaz con su esposa, con quien tuvo 2 hijos, el es una persona amable, trabajador, que ha dedicado todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Jose no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional.
Por iniciativa propia, Jose trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de gorros y sombreros, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y buenos precios.
Jose se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada comprará mayor cantidad y variedad de mercadería, así pues Jose seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograra su gran sueño de llevar una vida tranquila y apacible.
texts.en:
Jose, 68, lives in the city of Huaraz in the district of Carhuaz with his wife.  He has two children and is a kind, hard-working person who does all he can to provide for his family.  Unfortunately, due to a lack of economic resources and the need to work, Jose was unable to get professional training.

On his own initiative, Jose has a small business selling hats.  He works about ten hours a day and believes things are going well for him because of his dedication and low prices.

Jose is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to their support he will be able to buy more volume and a wider variety of merchandise.  This will allow him to continue working and striving to reach his goal in life which is to lead a tranquil, peaceful existence.

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Mariano

texts.es:
Mariano es un hombre de 63 años, vive en la ciudad de Nazca con sus dos hijos, el es una persona amable, trabajador, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Mariano no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional.
Por iniciativa propia, Mariano trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de artículos de cocina, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y buenos precios.
Mariano se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada comprará mayor cantidad mercadería, como platos de loza, jarras, juegos de ollas y otros, así pues Mariano seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Mariano, 63, lives in the city of Nazca with his two children.  He is a kind, hard-working person who does all he can to provide for his family.  Unfortunately, due to a lack of economic resources and the need to work, Mariano was unable to get professional training.

On his own initiative, Mariano works in his small business selling kitchen items.  He works about ten hours a day and believes things are going well for him because of his dedication and low prices.

Mariano is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to their support he will be able to buy more merchandise such as earthenware dishes, pitchers, pots and pans, etc.

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To repair the bathroom.

loans.name: Sadith

texts.es:
Sadith es una mujer de 55 años, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa con su esposo e hijos, ella es muy amable, trabajadora, que junto con su esposo dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Sadith no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional.
Por iniciativa propia, Sadith trabaja en su pequeño negocio de confección y venta de amacas y abanas, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y esfuerzo.
Sadith se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada comprara una maquina de coser y telas, de esta manera ella podrá seguir trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener un gran taller de costura.
texts.en:
Sadith is a 55-year old woman who lives in the city of Pucallpa with her husband and children. She is very kind and hard-working and, together with her husband, works to support their family. Unfortunately, due to a lack of financial resources and the need to work, Sadith could not pursue professional studies. 

Sadith took the initiative to start her own small business sewing and selling hammocks. She works every day for approximately 10 hours and thinks the business goes well thanks to her dedication and hard work. 

Sadith is very grateful to Kiva lenders. Thanks to their support she will be able to buy a sewing machine and fabrics, and to continue working hard to achieve her dream of having a big sewing workshop.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and fabrics.

loans.name: Villavista Cojata Pampa Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “VILLAVISTA COJATA PAMPA”  iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Achacachi, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Juana es la Presidenta. Los negocios que los integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de leche, venta de queso, venta de ganado, venta de lanas, tejido de camas, venta de comida.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Juana es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de comida; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió hace varios años atrás ayudando a su madre en el negocio familiar, posteriormente ella decide seguir con el negocio pero de forma independiente.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de arroz, aceite y fideo) que adquirirá de las ferias aledañas y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación en salud y crédito.
texts.en:
Villavista Cojata Pampa Communal Bank will start its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Achacachi Regional Office.  It's made up of eight members and governed by a board of directors of which Juana's the president.  The members carry out a variety of businesses, including milk sales, cheese sales, livestock sales, wool sales, weaving bedding, and food sales.

The loan they're getting will benefit small business entrepreneurs like Juana.  She says it's the first time she has been a member of Pro Mujer, having joined on the invitation of a counselor from the institution who visited her at home.  Currently she has a business selling food, which she learned several years ago helping her mother in the family business.  Later she decided to continue with the business but on her own.

The loan she's going to get is to increase her capital by buying rice, oil, and pasta in the local markets.  After preparing the food she'll sell it in her stall.  This form of work allows her to generate income to support her household to the extent possible, because she's married and has three children. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer she says the health and loan training.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, and pasta

loans.name: Mayra

texts.es:
Mayra es una mujer de 31 años, vive en la ciudad de Huaraz, en el distrito de Carhuaz con sus dos hijos, ella es madres soltera, muy trabajadora, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Mayra no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional.
Por iniciativa propia,Mayra trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de productos naturales, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y buenos precios.
Mayra se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada comprará mayor cantidad y variedad de mercadería, de esta manera atender a mas clientes, así pues Mayra seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ver a sus hijos convertidos en profesionales.
texts.en:
Mayra is a 31-year old woman who lives in the city of Huaraz, district of Carhuaz, with her two children. She is a very hard-working single mother who devotes all her efforts to support her family. Unfortunately, due to a lack of financial resources and the need to work, Mayra could not pursue professional studies. 

Mayra took the initiative to start her own small business selling natural products. She works every day for approximately 10 hours and thinks the business goes well because of her dedication and good prices. 

Mayra is very grateful to Kiva lenders. Thanks to their support, she will be able to buy a larger amount and wider variety of products and to serve more clients. Mayra will continue to work hard with an aim to achieve her dream: to see her children become professionals.

loans.use: to buy goods.

loans.name: Rosa Matilde

texts.es:
Rosa es una mujer de 59 años, vive en la ciudad de Pisco con su esposo y sus tres hijos, ella es muy trabajado y con su esposo dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Rosa no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional.
Por iniciativa propia,Rosa trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de ropa y zapatos, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y buenos precios.
Rosa se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada comprará mayor cantidad de mercadería (zapatos, zapatillas, botas, etc.) para abastecer su negocio, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su propio local de ventas.
texts.en:
Rosa is a 59-year old woman who lives in the city of Pisco with her husband and three children. She is very hard-working and, together with her husband, devotes all her efforts to support their family. Unfortunately, due to a lack of financial resources and the need to work, Rosa could not pursue professional studies. 

Rosa took the initiative to start her own small business selling clothes and shoes. She works everyday for approximately 10 hours and thinks the business goes well because of her dedication and good prices. 

Rosa is very grateful to Kiva lenders. Thanks to their support, she will be able to buy a larger amount of goods (shoes, sneakers, boots, etc.) for her business. She will continue to work hard to achieve her dream of having her own store.

loans.use: to buy goods.

loans.name: Benkadi 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe BENKADI 1 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 52 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à NATIEN, un des villages de SIKASSO, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur sixième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  le pois sucré avec Mme  MADJATA  assise  en première position de la gauche  vers la droite sur la photo. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter le labour, la semence et les engrais  pour entretenir champ de 1 ha  La production est vendue au niveau du village et au marché après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 175.000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of BENKADI 1 are married women who average 52 years of age and 5 children. They all live in polygamous families in Natien, one of Sikasso's villages, in the third administrative region of Mali.

They work with Kiva's partner, the MFI Soro Yiriwaso, in order to carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are seeking their sixth loan from the MFI, and the previous loans were repaid without problems.

Mrs Madjata (first woman on the left in the sitting row) is growing earth almonds. She intends to use her loan to buy seeds and fertilizers, and to pay for plowing in order to maintain a one-hectare field. 

After the harvest, the production is sold in the village and at the market, to a clientele comprising both men and women.

She intends to turn an average profit of XOF 175'000 (ca US$ 350) per planting, which will enable her to repay the loan and also help her husband cover daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers, and pay for plowing

loans.name: Yanet Marleny

texts.es:
Yanet es una mujer de 23 años, vive en la ciudad de Pisco con su pequeño hijo, ella es madre soltera, trabajadora, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia;lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Yanet no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Enfermería que deseaba.
Por iniciativa propia, Yanet trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de bebidas y gaseosas, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y esfuerzo.
Yanet se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada comprará mayor cantidad y variedad de bebidas, de esta manera atenderá a mas clientes, así pues Yanet seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de convertirse en una distribuidora mayorista de bebidas.
texts.en:
Yanet is a 23-year old woman who lives in the city of Pisco with her young son. She is a very hard-working single mother who devotes all her efforts to support her family. Unfortunately, due to a lack of financial resources and the need to work, Yanet could not pursue Nursing studies, as she would have liked.

Yanet took the initiative to start her own small business selling drinks and soda waters. She works everyday for approximately 10 hours and thinks the business goes well because of her dedication and hard work.

Yanet is very grateful to Kiva lenders. Thanks to their support, she will be able to buy a larger amount and wider variety of drinks to serve more clients. She will continue to work hard to achieve her dream of becoming a wholesale retailer.

loans.use: to buy drinks.

loans.name: Edith Xiomara

texts.es:
La Señora Edith es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable vive junto a sus hijos y su esposo en una comunidad en la zona  de Honduras. Su negocio es la venta y elaboración de tortillas.
Doña Edith su negocio es muy conocido en su comunidad lo que hace que la demanda de su producto sea mucha. Necesita el préstamo para la compra de maíz, leña y cal que es la materia prima para seguir elaborando sus tortillas.
Doña Edith espera que gracias al préstamo poder contar con los insumos necesarios para seguir realizando su negocio y así cubrir la demanda de sus clientes y de igual manera que las ventas tengan un aumento que le permita mejorar un poco su calidad de vida y  la de su familia.
Doña Edith desea que su negocio  siga creciendo y que se convierta en uno de los más conocidos de la comunidad y de esta manera poder seguir apoyando a su familia para que  sus hijos continúen con  sus estudios y tengan mayores oportunidades en la vida.



Choluteca, Honduras – Agosto  2013
texts.en:
Edith is a very hard-working and responsible woman who lives with her children and husband in Honduras. She has her own business making and selling tortillas. Edith's business is well-known in the community and there is a good demand for her products. She needs the loan to buy corn, firewood and lime, which are necessary to make the tortillas. 

Thanks to this loan, Edith expects to buy the inputs she needs to continue with the business and to cover demand. She also expects sales to increase so that the quality of life of her family will improve. Edith wants to grow the business and to see it become one of the most popular in the community. This way she will be able to continue supporting her family and her children will pursue their studies and have better opportunities in their lives. 

Choluteca, Honduras – August 2013

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood and lime for her business.

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es: Eduardo tiene  40 años, esta casado con Lucia y tiene 5 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia. Desde niño logró aprender  las actividades del campo ya que este fue el principal sustento de su familia durante muchos años, hoy con 20 años de experiencia y trabajando de forma independiente decidió seguir con el rubro del cacao orgánico para el sustento de la familia que formo con tanto orgullo. Posee terrenos de cultivo que compró de a pocos, en donde el cacao orgánico ocupa casi el 70% del área que labora conjuntamente con el apoyo de su esposa y en ocasiones de trabajadores del lugar quienes por un salario justo lo apoyan en las tareas complicadas que requieren sus parcelas. Le agrada mucho su trabajo ya que no depende de terceros para desempeñar su labor y porque considera que el cacao es uno de los productos con mayor demanda en su zona . Al iniciarse una nueva temporada de cacao desea como de costumbre contar con un capital suficiente que le permita correr con los gastos de producción. Este es su segundo préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecido por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. En está ocasión desea contar con 1,000 nuevos soles para la compra de abono orgánico.
texts.en:
Eduardo is a 40-year old man who is married to Lucia and has five children living at home. He started learning how to work the land when he was a kid, as this was the main income source of his family for many years. Today, with 20 years of experience and working independently, he has continued working with organic cocoa to support his family. He owns land plots where organic cocoa accounts for almost 70% and works with his wife and sometimes workers that receive a fair wage and perform the complicated tasks. He enjoys his job because he does not depend on third parties and because cocoa is one of the products with a higher demand in the area. 

With the start of the new cocoa season, he would like to count on a sufficient capital to cover production costs. This is his second loan with Kiva and he is grateful for the financial support received to get ahead. He commits to pay as scheduled and is requesting 1,000 nuevos soles to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Usmon

texts.ru: Усмон трудолюбивый молодой человек. Он студент 1 курса Худжандского Государственного Университета по специальности Востоковедение. Он является одним из успешных студентов. Он хорошо учится и выполняет все задания. Усмон с детства всегда мечтал получить высшее образование и служить своему народу. Усмон должен оплатить за учебный договор, но он сирота и поэтому не имеет поддержки. Он запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Usmon is a hardworking young man. He is a first year student at the Khujand State University majoring in the eastern studies. He is one of the best students. He studies well and completes all of the assignments. Usmon has been dreaming since he was little to get a higher education and serve his peoples. Usmon has to pay for tuition, but he is an orphan and does not have support. He is asking for a loan to pay for the tuition. He is waiting for your generosity and hopes for your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for education at the university.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock to sell such as canned goods, noodles, soda, soap and toiletries.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
This is Zenaida. She previously accessed a 15,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her child’s education and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 25,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and her child’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Zenaida dreams that her family will always be in good conditions and hopes that her business will continue to prosper. She meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Adora

texts.en: Adora is a member in good standing for two years under CUMI membership. She is married and blessed with two children. Her business has existed for five years and it is very successful. She would like a loan from the Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative in the amount of 5,000 PHP to replace her supply of store items to sell. She hopes and prays that her business will be more successful in the future.

loans.use: To replace her supply of store items to sell.

loans.name: Evarista

texts.es: Evarista tiene 47 años, es  viuda y tiene 2 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia. Evarista posee un puesto de ropa ubicado en el mercado de abastos de su localidad logrando establecerse hace mas de 15 años y donde ofrece a sus clientes diversa variedad de prendas tanto para damas, caballeros y niños. Tiene también conocimientos en al área textil y con una maquina de coser manual realiza trabajos como costurera y es capaz de modificar una gran variedad de prendas para vestir incluso llegando a confeccionar ropa a solicitud de sus clientes. Considera que su actividad es muy rentable puesto que los productos que vende son netamente para la gente cuya labor principal son las actividades agrícolas que visitan la ciudad los fines de semana a fin de realizar sus compras semanales. Este es su segundo préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecido por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. En esta ocasión desea contar con 3,000 nuevos soles para la compra de mercadería al por mayor tales como ropa para damas, caballeros y niños asi como tela para confeccionar diferentes prendas.
texts.en: 47-year-old Evarista is a widow who lives in her own home along with her children.  She runs a clothing stall in her local market, where she managed to set up in business more than 15 years ago, and offers her clients a wide range of ladies', men's and children's clothing.  She is also knowledgeable about the textile industry and works as a seamstress, using a manual sewing machine to make alterations to different types of clothing and can even making bespoke clothing for her customers.  She believes that her business is very profitable because the products she sells are purely for people who work mainly in agriculture and who come to the city at weekends to doing their weekly shopping.  This is her second Kiva loan and she is grateful for this financial help which enables her to make ends meet.  She is also committed to make her repayments punctually.  On this occasion she would like to receive 3,000 nuevos soles to buy in bulk merchandise such as ladies', men's and children's clothing as well as fabric to make various items of clothing.

loans.use: to buy clothing in bulk and fabric to make various items of clothing

loans.name: Nigina

texts.ru: Нигина добросовестная женщина. Несколько лет назад она потеряла своего мужа. Ее муж погиб, и она осталась без кормильца с 2 маленькими детьми. После смерти мужа ей пришлось работать. Она начала работать в разных кафе и ресторанов посуда мойкой и официанткой. Она более 10 лет работает официанткой. Она единственная кормилица в семье. Дети маленькие, старшему 15 и младшему 13 лет. Она старается, чтобы ее дети росли в достатке и получили хорошее образование. Нигина уже несколько лет планирует купить дом, так как она не имеет нормального дома. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки дома. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Nigina is a conscientious woman. Several years ago she lost her husband. When he died, she was left without a provider and two children. She was forced to work. She started by working in various cafes and restaurants as a dishwasher and waitress. She has been working as a waitress for more than ten years, and is the sole provider for her family. Her children are young; the oldest is 15 and the youngest is 13. She tries to ensure that they have everything they need and receive a good education. For several years she has been planning to buy a house, because they don't have a normal home. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 5000 somoni to buy a house. She awaits your kind assistance and is counting on your generosity.

loans.use: To buy a house for her family

loans.name: Remeshwa Group

texts.fr:
Constance fait partie du groupe  Remeshwa et  habite à Bujumbura. C'est une veuve de 32ans.Elle a 3enfants âgés de 2 à 10 ans dont 2 étudient.  

Elle fait le commerce des bijoux et des habits  depuis 6ans. 

Elle est à son quatrième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter 50 sacoches et 50 paires d' uniformes à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle  voudrait  acheter une parcelle et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Constance, age 32, is a member of the group Remeshwa and she lives in Bujumbura. She is the widowed mother of three children aged 2 to 10, two of whom go to school. She has been selling clothing and jewelry for six years. 

This is her 4th loan cycle with Turame. She plans to use her new loan to bolster her working capital. She will buy 50 handbags and 50 sets of uniforms to increase her sales and revenue.  

In the coming years, she wants to buy some land, and she looks forward to her children pursuing their studies.

loans.use: to buy 50 handbags and 50 sets of uniforms for resale.

loans.name: Niyonkuru Group

texts.fr:
Mireille fait partie du groupe  Niyonkuru  et  habite à Bujumbura. Elle a 31 ans et est mariée à J.de Dieu, un commerçant. Ensemble ils ont 4 enfants  âgés de 3 à 15 ans, tous étudient. 
Elle a sous sa charge sa nièce,qui étudie.

Elle fait le commerce des habits  depuis 8 ans. 

Elle est à son douzième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup d’habits  à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle  voudrait construire une maison et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Mireille, age 31, is a member of the Niyonkuru group and she lives in Bujumbura. She is married to a merchant named J.de Dieu. They have four children aged 3 to 15 who all go to school. In addition to her children, she supports her niece, who also attends school. 

Mireille has been selling clothing for 8 years. This is her 12th loan cycle with Turame. She plans to use the credit to bolster her working capital and stock up on clothing to sell and increase her revenue. 

In the coming years, she would like to build a house and support her children’s education.

loans.use: to stock up on clothing to sell and increase her revenue.

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.es:
Doña Vicenta tiene 51 años de edad es madre de 3 hijos, casada, ama de casa y agricultora desde hace muchos años con un grado de escolaridad de primaria incompleta cursado hasta 3 grado. Fueron ellos quienes le enseñaron a trabajar y a cultivar café entre otros ya que en su familia es una tradición la cual practican hace muchas generaciones. Sus clientes son los diferentes compradores e intermediarios que llegan a la zona para su compra/venta en otras aldeas como también los vecinos y amigos. La tierra que en compañía de su esposo y sus hijos trabajan es propia y está ubicada a una distancia de 15 minutos de su casa de habitación por lo que el mantenimiento y cuidado se le hace fácil. 

Ella ha solicitado a la cooperativa COMIXMUL un financiamiento para poder preparar la tierra en la que será cultivado su vivero de café el cual ya lo tiene y la otra parte para la compra de 10 QQ de fórmula 12-24-12, 12 QQ de 18-46-0, 9 kilos de nutrí café y 5 kilos de evicet.

Sus planes y sueños son los de seguir construyendo un patrimonio sólido para sus hijos, que ellos puedan tener una tierra donde vivir y donde trabajar como también seguir aumentando más sus tierras y seguir aumentando sus cultivos con una mejor y más atractiva variedad.
texts.en:
Doña Vicenta, 51, is the mother of three children. She is married and has worked as a housewife and in agriculture for many years. She could not finish school and left after the third grade. It was her family who taught her to grow coffee and other crops; it has been a tradition through many generations.

Her customers are different buyers and intermediaries that visit the region to buy and sell in other villages, but also neighbors and friends. She, her husband and children work in a piece of land of their own. It is located fifteen minutes away from home, which makes it easier for them to take care of it.

Vicenta has requested a loan at COMIXMUL in order to be able to prepare her land for growing coffee. She has already bought the plants but requires fertilizers: 10 quintals [around 1000 lbs.] of “24-12-12” [Nitrogen-Phosphorus-Potassium in %], 12 quintals [around 1200 lbs.] of “18-46-0” [Nitrogen-Phosphorus in %], 9 kg. of “nutrí café” and 5 kg. of “evicet.”

Her plans and dreams are to continue building something to leave to her children, that they have land where to live and work, to acquire more land and to expand their plantations making them better, and more attractive and varied.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to grow coffee.

loans.name: Lola

texts.ru: Лола женщина с прекрасной душой и прекрасными мыслями. Она замужем и воспитывает умных и прекрасных детей. Лола любит трудиться. Она занимается садоводством. Она выращивает абрикосовых деревьев. Она начинает свой рабочий день с раненного утра. Лола данное время живет с дочерью, так как ее муж и сыновья находятся в трудовой миграции в Российской Федерации. Она живет в основном за счет денег, которые она получает от мужа. Она хочет сделать навес перед домом, но не имеет достаточно денег,  для покупки шифера, древесины и т.п. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1000 долларов США. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Lola is a woman with a wonderful spirit and beautiful thoughts. She is married and is raising smart and beautiful children. She loves to work, and is engaged in agriculture. She grows apricot trees. She begins her work day early in the morning. She currently lives with her daughter; her husband and son are migrant workers in the Russian Federation. She lives on the money that she receives from her husband. She wants to put a shed in front of her house, and can't afford to buy the slate, lumber, and etc. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 1000 US dollars. She awaits your kind assistance.

loans.use: To buy slate, wood for making a shed

loans.name: Santos Santos

texts.es: Santos de 46 años de edad vive junto a su esposo y sus 4 hijos todos menores de edad, en total son 6 personas las que viven en su hogar; Es una mujer muy entregada al trabajo que siempre ha trabajado duro para salir adelante por su familia. Actualmente trabaja vendiendo lámparas, jabones, cepillos y platos a ella le pagan el día por vender dichos productos; Siempre con el deseo y la visión de ser emprendedora junto a su esposo que es agricultor una persona que trabaja en la mano de obra de la siembra de un producto. Al finalizar el mes juntan los sueldos y pagan las cuentas pendientes de cada mes. Santos desea con muchas ansias la construcción de una pila para almacenar agua pues la que tiene es pequeña es por eso que solicito a FUSAI un préstamo para la construcción de esta y comprar cemento, grava, arena, y los materiales que se utilizan , cuenta con buenas referencias de pago, espera que se le brinde apoyo.
texts.en: Santos is 46 years old. She lives with her husband and her four minor children, for a total of 6 people living in her house. She is a woman who is very dedicated to her work. She has always worked hard to get ahead for her family. Right now, she is working selling lamps, soap, brushes  and plates. She is paid every day to sell these products. She always has wanted and has had the vision to be an entrepreneur with her husband, who is a farmer, doing manual labor to plant a crop. At the end of the month they combine their wages and pay the monthly bills. Santos really wants to build a cistern to store her water. She one she has is very small and that is why she has asked FUSAI for a loan to build it. She will buy cement, gravel, sand, and the materials to be used. She says that she has good payment references and she hopes she will get support.

loans.use: to build a large cistern, buying cement, gravel, and the materials to be used.

loans.name: Jyldyz

texts.ru: Жылдыз 35 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 4 детей. У Жылдыз - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Жылдыз занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 19 лет назад, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Жылдыз, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 корова с приплодом, 15 овец, 1 лошадь, также обрабатывает 3,10 ГА земельного надела, ежегодно выращивает фасоль. Ежемесячный доход составляет 5,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Жылдыз обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Жылдыз планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Jyldyz is 35, married, and is raising 4 children together with her husband. She has a high school education, and as her  family's main provider, is engaged in animal husbandry and agriculture. She started the business 19 years, buying some animals for 10,000 som KGS. Thanks to her hard work, her farm now has 1 cow with a calf, 15 sheep, 1 horse, and 3.1 hectares of land planted in beans. Her farm earns 5000 som (KGS) per month. With the goal of expanding her business, Jyldyz has requested a loan through Bai-Tushum & Partners in the amount of 20,000 som (KGS) to buy a sheep and increase the size of her livestock herd. She plans to invest the proceeds earned with the loan into further increasing the size of her herd.

loans.use: to buy sheep

loans.name: Eduardo Gehovani

texts.es: Eduardo de 23 años de edad, es un hombre muy trabajador que se encuentra felizmente casado y con una pequeña hija de tan solo 3 años de edad; Habita en casa propia desde hace ya un tiempo. Siempre con deseos de superación ha estado interesado por el bienestar de su familia. Eduardo se desempeña como mecánico soldador, es decir trabaja con estructuras metálicas en un taller propiedad de su tío, donde también venden celulares y computadoras. Eduardo desea cambiar el techo de su hogar y a su vez cambiar la madera en algunos cuartos, pues la que tiene está deteriorada, es por eso que ha decidido obtener un préstamo en FUSAI para la compra de lamina galvanizada, polines de madera , pines, etc.
texts.en: Eduardo is 23 years old. He is a very hard working man who finds himself happily married and with a small daughter who is only 3 years old. He has lived in his own house for a time. Always with wishes to get ahead, he has been interested in the wellbeing of his family. Eduardo works as a welding mechanic. He works with metal structures in a shop owned by his uncle where they also sell cell phones and computers. Eduardo wishes to change the roof on his house and, at the same time, change the wood in some rooms since what's there is deteriorating. It is for this that he has decided to obtain a loan from FUSAI for the purchase of galvinized sheets, lumber, pins etc.

loans.use: to repair his roof and buy galvinized sheets, limber, pins,etc.

loans.name: Edith

texts.es: Edith elabora bolsos y mochilas artesanales con sus propias manos desde muy joven, pues además de provenir de San Jacinto: el pueblo de las hamacas y mochilas mas lindas de Colombia, sus familiares también tradicionalmente practicaron este oficio y ella aprendió de ellos. Hoy tiene su propio taller en su casa, desde donde vende los artículos que produce y que gustan mucho a los turistas y en los almacenes a los que distribuye en este municipio y en las ciudades mas cercanas de su natal San Jacinto. En la actualidad su sueño de crecimiento no se detiene, por ello está dispuesta a ponerle todo su empeño en que esto suceda, pero su mayor desafío, es que no tiene suficiente capital de trabajo para hacerlo. Ella se acercó a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para aplicar a su primer financiamiento, pues necesita tener en mayor cantidad materias primas e insumos, para responder a pedidos y prepararse para las festividades de la población, temporada en la cual sus ventas se incrementan. Con su credikiva comprará hilos, telas y cumplirá con su clientela, quien la espera hasta que termine de tejer las mochilas, y bolsos, pues le quedan muy lindos.
texts.en: Edith has made artisanal bags and backpacks by hand since she was young. In addition to being from San Jacinto, the town of the most beautiful hammocks and backpacks in Colombia, her relatives also practiced this trade traditionally, and she learned from them. Today she has her own workshop in her house, where she sells the items she produces that are well liked by tourists. She distributes them also to stores in this town and in cities further away from her birthplace of San Jacinto. Right now, her dream of growing won't stop, and that is why she is willing to put all of her effort into making that happen. But her biggest challenge is that she doesn't have enough working capital to do it. She approached Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to apply for her first loan, because she needs to have more raw materials to fill orders and get ready for the town festivals, when sales increase. With her Kiva loan, she will buy thread, fabric and fill her customers' orders. They are waiting for her to finish weaving the backpacks and bags, because they are very pretty.

loans.use: to buy thread and fabric and to fill her customers' orders.

loans.name: Madres Laboriosas Group

texts.es: La Alcancía Comunal “Madres Laboriosas” está integrada por 12 socios activos y responsables que han ido mejorando con el transcurso del tiempo. Gilseia una de las socias de 48 años es separada y tiene  03 hijos dependientes. Al ver que los ingresos no eran suficientes para cubrir con los gastos del hogar Gilseia toma la decisión de emprender su propio negocio, la cual actualmente se dedica a la  venta de productos de belleza. Gilseia se siente orgullosa pues gracias a su perseverancia a logrado apoyar a sus hijos en su educación. Con el fin de seguir mejorando solicitó el crédito para la compra de talcos, colonias, cremas y de esta manera tener que ofrecer a sus clientes. El grupo “Madres Laboriosas” agradecen a las personas que hicieron posible este crédito. Gilseia se encuentra en la parte posterior es la cuarta del lado derecho lleva lentes y viste blusa negra con flores.
texts.en: The “Madres Laboriosas” communal bank is made up of 12 active and responsible members who have been improving over time. Gilseia, one of the members, is 48, separated, and has 3 dependent children. Upon seeing that her income wasn't enough to cover the household expenses, Gilseia decided to start her own business, and now she sells beauty products. Gilseia is proud, but thanks to her perseverance, she has been able to support her children in their education. In order to keep improving, she asked for the loan to buy powders, colognes, and creams in order to have more to offer her customers.   The “Madres Laboriosas” group is grateful to the people who made this loan possible. Gilseia is in the back, fourth from the right, wearing glasses and dressed in a black blouse with flowers

loans.use: to buy powders, colognes, and creams.

loans.name: Edson Victor

texts.es:
Edson es un hombre de 23 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Pisco con sus padres y hermanos, el es muy trabajador y dedica todos sus esfuerzos por salir adelante; lamentablemente por falta de recursos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Edson no pudo estudia estudiar una carrera profesional.
Por iniciativa propia, Edson trabaja brindando servicios de vigilancia en una empresa de seguridad de su ciudad, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 12 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y buen desempeño.
Edson se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada comprara una mototaxi, la cual utilizara para brindar servicios de transporte, de esta manea Edson tendrá un poco mas de ingresos económicos, los cuales utilizara para lograr su gran sueño de estudiar una profesión.
texts.en:
Edson is a 23 year old man. He is single, lives in the city of Pisco with his parents and brother. He is very hard working and dedicates all of his efforts to get ahead. Unfortunately, due to a lack of resources and the need to work, Edson was not able to study a professional career. By his own initiative, Edson works providing security services in a security company in his city. He works every day for approximately 12 hours and believes it's going well due to his dedication and hard work.

Edson finds himself very thankful to the Kiva lenders since, thanks to the help provided, he will buy a mototaxi, which he will use to provide transportation services. In this way, Edson will have a little more economic income which he will use to achieve his great dream of studying a profession.

loans.use: to buy a mototaxi.

loans.name: Teodocia Emerita

texts.es:
Teodocia es una mujer de 47 años, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa con sus 4 hijos, ella es madres soltera, trabajadora, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Teodocia no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Administración de Empresas.
Por iniciativa propia, Teodocia trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de abarrotes y bebidas, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y esfuerzo.
Teodocia se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada comprara materiales de construcción para mejorar su vivienda, de esta manera ella y su familia tendrá mayor seguridad y bienestar, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener un minimarket.
texts.en: Teodacia is 47 and lives in the city of Pucallpa with her four children. She is a hardworking single mother who puts all her energy into providing for her family. Unfortunately, due to a lack of economic resources and the need to work, she was unable to study for a degree in Business Administration. On her own initiative, Teodacia runs a small convenience store selling groceries and drinks. She works approximately 10 hours every day and believes that things are going well for her thanks to her hard work and her efforts. Teodacia is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, as thanks to their help she will buy building materials to improve her home and give her family greater security and wellbeing. She will continue to work hard and push herself towards achieving her dream of having a minimarket.

loans.use: to improve her home.

loans.name: Virgen Asunta Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “VIRGEN ASUNTA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Yuli ella es conviviente y tiene 25 años y tiene 1 hijo; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de comida, la socia prepara diferentes platos como pollo al horno,estofado de pollo y sopas, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 2:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un restaurant. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar verduras, carne y pollo para que prepare la comida.
Los socios que estan pegados a la foto grupal se les tomo despues la foto porque pidieron permiso por motivos de trabajo.
El socio que su cara esta tapado con un circulo ya no pertenece al banco comunal Virgen Asunta
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de comida, negocio de venta de animales, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de verduras.

 
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the “VIRGEN ASUNTA” communal bank. Their bank is located in the district of Anta, belonging to the province of Anta and the department of Cuzco.

The member named Yuli lives with someone and is 25 years old. She has 1 child. She works in her business selling food. She prepares different plates such as baked chicken, chicken stew and soups. She works from 8:00 a.m. until 2:00 p.m. and has had this business for 5 years. It is going well for her and her dream is to have a restaurant. She is asking for this loan to buy vegetables, beef and chicken to prepare the food. 

The members in that are added on to the group photo were photographed later because they had to be absent for work reasons. The member whose face is blanked out does not belong to the Virgen Asunta communal bank.
 
The other members work in selling food, selling animals, running a convenience store and selling vegetables. 

This member is grateful to those who are a part of this dream in this way and she is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, beef and chicken to prepare food.

loans.name: Armanda Dorotea

texts.es:
Armanda es una mujer de 44 años, vive en la ciudad de Huaraz, en el distrito de Carhuaz con su esposo y sus dos hijos, ella es muy trabajadora y dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar,Armanda no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional. 
Por iniciativa propia, Armanda trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de bebidas diversas y gaseosas, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y esfuerzo.
Armanda se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada comprará mayor cantidad y variedad de bebidas para abastecer su negocio, de esta manera atenderá a mas clientes, así pues Armamda seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ver a sus hijos convertidos en profesionales.
texts.en: Armanda is 44 and lives with her husband and two children in the city of Huaraz in the district of Carhuaz. She is very hardworking and puts all her energy into providing for her family. Unfortunately, due to a lack of economic resources, Armanda could not study for a degree. On her own initiative, Armanda runs a small shop selling a range of drinks. She works for approximately 10 hours every day and believes that things are going well for her thanks to her dedication and her efforts. Armanda is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, as thanks to their help she will be able to buy a greater quantity and variety of drinks to stock up her shop, and therefore serve more customers. She will continue to work hard towards achieving her dream of seeing her two children have good careers.

loans.use: to buy drinks.

loans.name: Merchie

texts.en:
Merchie, a 34-year-old married mother of two children, both of whom are in school, is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Merchie has a personal products business in the Philippines which she has been operating for two years. She has requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional products such as body lotion, perfume and other personal products.


In the future, Merchie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like body lotion, perfume and other personal products.

loans.name: Douglas Adonay

texts.es:
Douglas es un joven de 32 años de edad, es una persona muy conocida en la zona y trabajadora,  estudio hasta el bachillerato, él vive con sus padres y su compañera de vida y unos niños adoptados, que son hijos de su ex esposa que los dejo abandonados, él tiene la custodia de ellos. Los niños tiene la edades de 6 y 10 años, ellos están en la escuela.

Él trabaja con su padre en la agricultura, también en la construcción de casas; su compañera de vida solo se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar. La albañilería la aprendió, cuando estaba en los estados unidos, él se fue desde la edad de 14 años y comenzó a trabajar en compañías de construcción de casas; luego se regresó a El Salvador y se quedó ayudando a su padre, quien también le enseño el arte de la carpintería.

Él utilizara el dinero para  terminar de poner las puertas y las ventanas de la casa que está por terminar de construir, solo le faltan el afinado de las paredes. El préstamo le mejorara su condición de vida, porqué terminara de construir su casa para habitarla con su familia.

El señor menciona que en un futuro, tiene pensado comprar un carro nuevo del que tiene, y también ayudar a su padre en la siembra del maíz, en el próximo año esto lo realizara con la ayuda de crédito que solicitara con la fundación campo.
texts.en:
Douglas is a young 32 year old man. He is a person who is well known in the area and hard working. He studied up to his baccalaureate. He lives with his parents and his partner and some adopted children who are the children of his ex-wife who abandoned them. He has custody of them. The children are 6 and 10 years old and they are in school.

He works with his father in agriculture as well as building houses. His partner is only dedicated to housework. He learned masonry when he was in the United States. He went there when he was 14 years old and he began to work for housing construction companies. Then he returned to El Salvador and he stayed helping his father who also taught him the art of carpentry.

He will use the money to finish putting the doors and windows on the house that is almost finished. All that is left is to finish the walls. The loan will improve his quality of life because when he finishes building the house he will live in it with his family.

He mentions that, in the future, he is thinking about buying a new car and to help his father with planting maize. In the next year, he will make this happen with the help of a loan he will request with Fundacion Campo.

loans.use: to finish putting doors and windows on the house that he is almost built.

loans.name: Janit

texts.en:
Janit, from the town of San Miguel, Bohol, is a married woman who has been growing rice for more than three years now. She is requesting a loan to pay for fertilizer, pesticides and farm labor costs. These expenditures will enable her to improve the productivity of the farm, thus augmenting their yield and profit. 


In the future, Janit hopes to make their farming venture a success and a stable source of income. Moreover, she wants to save money for the future schooling of her children.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer, pesticides and farm labor costs

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia tiene 31 años, vive junto a su esposo y su hija de 9 años en su casa propia. Es comerciante y se dedica a la venta ropa para vestir de diversa variedades hace más de 8 años. Se inició con ayuda de su esposo logrando adquirir su primer lote de prendas al por mayor gracias a los ahorros que obtuvo hasta el momento.
Comenta que inicialmente realizaba sus ventas en las distintas comunidades de su localidad logrando así obtener buenas ganancias ya que solía regresar a su domicilio con sus sacos vacíos. Fue así que obtuvo basta experiencia hasta convertirlo en el principal sustento de su economía logrando incluso a contar con el apoyo constante de su esposo.Tiene participación en la ferida dominical de su distrito donde ofrece a sus clientes diversa variedad de prendas para vestir como pantalones, blusas, polos, ropa deportiva entre otros; teniendo entre sus principales compradores personas del campo que visitan la feria realizando así sus compras semanales.
Este es su tercer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida de recibir un apoyo financiero que le permita seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. En está oportunidad desea contar con 3,000 nuevos soles y adquirir ropa al por mayor como pantalones para caballeros, chompas y polos deportivos.
texts.en:
Sonia is 31 years old. She lives alongside her husband and their 9 year old daughter in their own house. She is a vendor and has been dedicated to selling a diverse range of clothing  for more than 8 years. She began with the help of her husband managing to acquire her first batch of garments at wholesale thanks to the savings she had obtained up to that moment.

She comments that initially she made her sales in different communities of her town, managing to earn good income since she only returned to her house with empty bags. It was this way that she obtained enough experience to turn it into the main source of her income managing to count on the constant support of her husband. She participates in the Sunday market in her district where she offers her customers a diverse variety of garments like pants, blouses, T-shirts, sports clothes, among others. Among her main buyers are country people who visit the market to make their weekly purchases.

This is her third loan with Kiva and she feels thankful to receive financial support that allows her to keep advancing. Additionally she promises to make her payments punctually. At this time, she wishes to have 3,000 "soles" and acquire clothing at wholesale like mens' pants,sweaters and sports polos.

loans.use: to buy clothing at wholesale.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn, a 50-year-old married mother of four children, three of whom are in school, works very hard to provide for her family. For four years now she has been operating a general store in the Philippines that sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods and other groceries. 


 Evelyn has requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en: Adelaida has been a member of PMPC since 2006. She is 52 years old, a widow and has four children. She has started a business of corn production and earns a good return on this type of work. Now she is applying for a loan to purchase farm inputs for her corn production business. She deeply wishes to save more for her retirement and for emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase for farm inputs for her corn production business

loans.name: Baba Biswakarma Group

texts.en:
In 2009, four women from Bhuliasikuan village located in Nuapada district of Odisha, India, stepped out and decided to build a secure future for their families with their contributions. They formed a group named Baba Biswakarma to access credit from Mahashakti Foundation for development of their existing businesses.
